Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE.... Stay there if you can!”
Reviews.Author: capegirlonthego
Reviews.Content: SPOTLESS... Beautiful... great location! Highly recommend! Don't hesitate at ALL!

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, VERY WELL STAFFED AND BEAUTIFUL ROOM”
Reviews.Author: babs067
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our St pattys trip this year. This was our first visit and I was NOTvery impressed at first. The location was questionable as was the entrance. We had to go down a few steps as we entered with our luggage. We then had to proceed to a set of elevators and go to the 3rd floor to reach the lobby!! After that we had to take another set of elevators to our room. When we did reach our room, it was beautiful, clean and bright. Our multiple walks, and I do mean multiple walks to downtown Boston were nice. There were plenty of stores, restaurants and patrols. That's where I found out the reasoning behind the ENTRANCE. The building itself is over 30 years old, so it was originally designed to keep the RIFF-RAFF out. It still does, because there is a doorman and also someone in the downstairs lobby, not to menton the numerous people on the 3rd floor before you get to the second set of elevators. It actually sounds more confusing than it is. We visited the hotel bar, where we met Peter and William. They were great!! They were our highlight of the hotel, and they didn't even know it. I would definately stay here again. All the staff were great. A special thank you to Peter and William !!!! Last but not least, our room service was precise on their timing, the room was perfect and quiet....the halls were quiet....and everything was clean, clean, clean! ABSOLUTELY NO COMPLAINTS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you are going to a show”
Reviews.Author: JFino
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it is across from the Opera House, and we were in town to see a show. The set up is a little different bc the lobby is above street level. This was only a minor inconvenience to us, when you want to come and go. The hotel was clean and the room was nice. The staff was helpful as well. There is a pretty good restaurant on site. Good for drinks or a pre theater dinner. It is close to some shopping and other areas (We didnt have time to explore much, but there was a Starbucks, CVS, Macys, DD, cafes, and theaters.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Alexander_NL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the night on a business trip. Very good service, good hotel room. Clean, good bed, good facilities.. what more do you need... Breakfast more than average. Hotel is in a good area of Boston, at walking distance of all there is too see. Good choice.

Reviews.Title: “I think the the renovations should be reflected in the price”
Reviews.Author: Moshe L
Reviews.Content: Very well placed, near the park and china town, clean and well maintained with a great breakfast spread. The renovations in the hotel make it a labaranth, and the new building outside make it a bit of a nag. Would stay in the Barbour or even more I town.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to all major attractions”
Reviews.Author: Hopsing-NH
Reviews.Content: We always stay at this location when we come to Boston. You can easily walk to the public gardens, the waterfront/aquarium, Quincy Market and the north end. Yeah, there are closer hotels but we are usually here for a convention at BCEC and they have a shuttle for the event. Parking garage fee is outrageous, it is not part of the Hyatt, it belongs to the city. It is very secure but its $32 for 24 hours. Rooms are clean, beds a bit too soft. Did not like the feather mattress topper. Very few channels on the television. We never use the pool or dine there. They had just started a lobby renovation too. Very quiet to the world outside but you can easily hear folks in the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Would NEVER Return”
Reviews.Author: eaglesclaw121
Reviews.Content: The one positive: It's in a great area. The negatives are endless: 1. Who has ever stayed at a hotel where the taxi entrance (the main hotel entrance) is two floors lower than the hotel lobby? Anyone? Which means you take your luggage into an an elevator, go up two flights, then have to take a second elevator to your room. It's ridiculous and minor league. 2. Wear headphones - stuff your ears with cotton balls - then put on background music because you will hear EVERYTHING - every word uttered - by people in adjoining rooms. The people next to us had their alarm clocks go off one morning and I could have sworn I set ours by mistake. 3. You get NOTHING extra: Coffee is charged to your bill if you just want to get a cup in the morning. 3. Cost of breakfast: Highway robbery - $22 for the buffet? You can't be serious! I have never heard of such a price. Go up the street and eat anywhere but here. I will say the beds are comfortable - but what good is that when you hear the people in the adjoining rooms. 4. Now for the health room/pool: A "luxury" hotel with no whirlpool? If you want to walk a half mile to the sauna or pool, you traipse through a long hallway of guest rooms, go down steps, and eventually find the pool in the middle of nowhere. Again, ridiculous. This is a greatly overpriced hotel - go anywhere but here.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice but consider the location”
Reviews.Author: YankeeExplorer
Reviews.Content: I stay here a great deal on business. The hotel is a very good value. The rooms are generally very comfortable, always very clean and the service is good. The room service is prompt and reliable. Occasionally the front desk gets a little overrun with checkins but, nothing you wont expect from time to time in a hotel of this type. Health club and pool are among the best in Boston. Restaurant serves a great breakfast. When the hotel was built (As a Swissotel) it was part of a shopping mall complex. Escalators and elevators took you to a third floor lobby to check in. I supposed the idea was to separate the lobby from all the foot traffic in the mall. In a very short time, the mall folded and was remodelled into offices. However, the hotel was left with a third floor lobby that is now accessed by elevator. It is a minor annoyance. Maybe its less annoying if you know the history. I am always a little surprised by the number of tourists i see staying here becasue the location is not all that attractive. The immediate nieghborhood is a little down at the heels and grundgier than most of the other areas in or near downtown . While Boston isnt huge, visitors will have a bit of a hike to most of Boston's attractions like the waterfront, Fanuel Hall and Back Bay shopping. However, the price is right and, given everything else the hotel offers, it's probably worth the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: lovingAntigua
Reviews.Content: Our room was very comfortable and very clean. The climate control worked perfectly. Amazing views from all areas of the hotel. We were attending a show in the theatre district and the hotel was very convenient to the theatre, restaurants and attractions, all an easy walk from the hotel. The staff was very helpful in booking our show tickets and guiding us to a good place to eat. The breakfast buffet was amazing - loads of great food and very attentive staff. The hotel staff provided great service. The hotel is in the beginning stages of renovations which will only make it nicer than it already is.

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Supertraveler50
Reviews.Content: I spent Friday night at this hotel while recently in Boston. Like all other times I have visited this Hyatt property, the rooms, service and staff were all excellent. The staff was attentive and accommodating and made the check in and out process effortless. The hotelâ€™s location is easy to find and is superb if you are visiting anywhere in the City. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to stay in a classic city property.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but is tired....”
Reviews.Author: dozygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2011. Convenient location. Easy walk to Boston Common. Internal access to Macy's. The room we had had 2 double beds - which were comfortable, The room was clean but carpet was worn and furniture had seen better days. The bathroom was on the small side and is definintely due to be updated. On the upside, the rooom service food was good value and quite respectable. Our daughters have a tendency to order room service wherever we go, they were impressed! Internet was only free in the lobby. There is a computer in the lobby where one can print boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: gzcMexico
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to stay here for two nights. Rooms are very comfortable, the bathroom is small but everything is very clean. Food is ok and the service is very good, personnel at the restaurant and bar provide great service. Location is good, lots of restaurants, theatre, shops within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in need of renovations”
Reviews.Author: TOTravelerEJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night when I couldn't extend my stay at the Westin Copley Place. I thought it would be nice to try a hotel in a different part of the city. The service was adequate but the hotel itself is dark and old and in desperate need of a renovation. The decor is outdated and the furniture needed replacing. On the upside the room was clean and had a comfortable bed. There are better 4-star properties in Boston. Maybe I would consider staying here if the hotel is updated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: MVTraveler31
Reviews.Content: Great location and terrific staff. We had a late arrival and were graciously accommodated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: NSmith1985
Reviews.Content: Close to Boston Common and near Macy's plus the subway - so great location. Okay the double lobby/lift arrangement is annoying but it's a minor thing. Attentive staff. We had a nice room on 12th Floor. Very quiet at night - despite on a couple of occassions us passing kids who had been left by their parents to run unsupervised around the hotel core and corridors earlier in the day. Rooms are good and reasonable views. As ever hate the petty attempts by big hotel chains to charge for in room wifi - but if you dont want to pay on principle then you can get 20 mins free log in down in the lobby or most coffee houses nearby. Overall good value for money booking via Hotwire

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Love the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bhappy50
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here several times. I love the location - close to the T stop in Boston Commons, near China town and walking distance to many restaurants and shops. There is a wonderful large movie theater right nearby and a Starbucks, too. The rooms are very clean and updated and the staff has been very helpful. If you feel like splurging on a great breakfast, the buffet can't be beat. Eggs and pancakes cooked to order, fresh fruit and juice, breads and muffins, etc. The only thing that would make it better would be fresh squeezed juice. I use the fitness center every time I am here. Plenty of treadmills and ellipticals and a decent sized weights area. They even have earphones to use in order to watch the tv that is on each cardio machine. The pool was being renovated last time I was here - I look forward to seeing the improvements. Renovations are ongoing right now in the lobby area, but it did not inconvenience us at all. All in all, an excellent hotel to base at for a Boston visit.

Reviews.Title: “No better hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Richard M
Reviews.Content: Great location and greater service at this Hyatt in Boston. No more convient place to stay. Came in by train and never needed to have a car. You are right in the middle of everything! The hotel & service is top notch and this isn't my first stay in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway Weekend”
Reviews.Author: leven4all
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend at the Boston Hyatt. The room was very spacious and the staff was very accommodating. People at the front desk were very nice and the concierge had good recommendations about places to eat in town.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge???”
Reviews.Author: Lewis R
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency Boston. Always find Hyatts quite nice, and this one was no exception. Nice room, well equipped gym, pool was under renovation, but sure it will be completed and nice. My only problem with the hotel was the concierge was not particularly helpful. Not her fault, as she was quite nice, but every suggestion she gave us was a disaster. Never found a good restaurant. Asked for a suggestion for a nice brunch on Sun. and the place didn't even open til noon. We got there at 10:30 The map we were given was hard to follow. Thought it was me, but everywhere we went, there were people looking at maps with o clue where they were. Went to the Science Museum which was great, Ate a lot of oysters, had a nice time, just should have been better prepared, as I received little help from the hotel. Had dinner at the restaurant there, and the kitchen apparently is not particularly close to the restaurant. Everything was cooked perfectly, but not hot. Would suggest plate covers. The waiter told us it was an ongoing problem. He did buy our wine, but I would rather have had hot food!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: 1ovetraveling
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic, right in the heart of the city but still in a quiet area. The room was excellent, and the price about right. I didn't notice a single problem with the room, although no free wifi and the lack of a microwave was slightly irritating. The best part was the extremely friendly staff, and I most definitely will stay here again on my next Boston visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service From All...Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ord2002
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about the GREAT customer service experienced both before arriving and while staying at the Hyatt Regency in Boston. I booked three rooms for two nights in December, as I was flying back to the US from Paris for the holidays and wanted to spend a few days in Boston with the family. As a Diamond member, I recieved an email the week prior to my arrival asking if I had any special requests, needed dinner reservations, etc. This must be unique to the Hyatt Boston, as it had never occurred before; but is a very nice welcoming touch. My niece and nephew had never been to a big city hotel, so I requested an upper floor with a city view and a welcome snack on their arrival. The hotel took care of everything, checked everyone in while saving the official check-in for me, gave everyone rooms on the same floor but separated and brought the kids a big plate of cookies and milk. I found the rooms very clean and average size for a city hotel and the bed was very comfortable. The dinner suggestions were very nice the first night, although the second night the concierge suggested a gastro-pub type of place. I should have known better...it wasn't really the place for kids, although was a lively and noisy place so good for active kids. The breakfast buffet is very nice, with plenty of options and tastes for everyone. The made to order station has many options. The staff was incredible, especially our waiter and one of the chefs, remembering everything the second morning we had liked the morning before and bringing the kids coloring books and chef's hats. As we were getting into the cars to head home, the kids didn't want to leave. Mission accomplished...and much thanks to the Hyatt Regency Boston for making the stay a memorable one. Will definately be back...

Reviews.Title: “Pot Smokers, Rusty Bathroom Fixtures, Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: watrskiergurl
Reviews.Content: I can't say my stay here was fantastic. Upon settling in, our neighbors next door arrived. We had to listen to them all night fighting and calling each other obscene names. Downstairs someone was smoking pot and the smell wafted up into our room and hallway. Yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency Boston for a night out and some live music with my wife and another couple at the house of Blues. The staff was simply amazing, so friendly and extremely attentive. Check in was super fast and easy, and paperless checkout was even easier. Our room was super clean and the beds at the Hyatt are unreal. I don't think ever had a better night sleep. Location can't be beat as you can enjoy downtown Boston, Faneuil Hall, Boston Commons, and the North End by foot. This is also the perfect place to stay whether your going to a Red Sox, Celtics, or Bruins game as the T basically runs underneath the hotel. If you not into sports and into live music, the House of Blues, the Garden, or any show in the Theater District couldn't be easier to get to. This hotel is also pet friendly which is super cool if your a dog owner and want to bring your pooch. My only regret was not eating breakfast there as the buffet and made to order items smelled absolutely amazing while we were checking out. Next time I am staying the night in Boston, this will definitely be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Joel L
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel repeatedly for business purposes and I cannot stress how business friendly this hotel is. The staff, all staff, are constantly asking how to improve my stay from the Bellman to the hotel Managers. My rooms have always been clean and well prepped. When I need to use the restaurant, it is reliable. The location is terrific with an easy walk to the Commons, Theater District, Copley, Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market, China Town, or South Station and their many excellent restaurants. Bring clothes to work out in and a bathing suit for their indoor pool or steam room. And what a value it is for a 4 star hotel in Boston. I won't stay anywhere else when I am traveling in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: charports
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel, we were thoroughly disappointed to find the pool was out of service. The rudely clerk responded it was posted on the Hyatt website; I then told her I had booked through Expedia, and she said it was posted on their site also. It was not. The clerk then said we could swim at another hotel--a car ride away! We went to the other hotel to swim, only to find the pool heater there broken. I had asked if there would be any compensation at the Hyatt, like free breakfast, but they said no, that the ability to swim at the other hotel was the compensation. The bathroom was also in great need of repair. The walls are paper thin; we heard every sound from the very active couple next door. If you use the refrigerator, you must pay a $25 cleaning charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience for Business & Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: JST429
Reviews.Content: This post is long overdue. I travel to Boston frequently for work, and the Hyatt Regency in Boston is always my hotel preference. The Hyatt is a beautiful hotel that offers great value and incredible service. Every time I come back to the hotel, the staff remembers my name. The rooms are very spacious and clean. The breakfast buffet is fantastic. Great gym, great pool. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel for travel or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “On Business or Pleasure, A Great Location with World Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Skintol
Reviews.Content: Over the past 8 months I have stayed at the Hyatt on Avenue De Lafayette an average of 5 nights per week. When I arrive at the hotel I am always greeted with warm friendly smiles and wonderful customer service. The staff's service allows me to free myself from worrying about my room, my food, my dry cleaning or when I am going to exercise and allows me to concentrate on the reason I am in Boston in the first place: work. While I have never stayed at the hotel for pleasure, I constantly see tourists both American and Foreign wandering out of the hotel and into the heart of downtown Boston. The one time I did use the concierge for directions (to what other than Fenway Park) they not only took the time to detail the different options to get there (take the T or jump in a Cab) but also recommended a wonderful restaurant in the Fenway district for after the game. While I don't frequent Boston quite as much as I used to I will always stay at this property; the staff earned my business.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: zeevc
Reviews.Content: 5 star hotel friendlly staff....in the center of downtown

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Outstanding room!”
Reviews.Author: hehasawifeyouknow
Reviews.Content: Decided to take a weekend vacation in Boston, and by chance ended up at this hotel. The hotel is about a ten minute walk to Faneuil Hall, 15 minutes to the TD Garden, 5 minutes to South Stations and less than 5 minutes to the Commons. It is right on the edge of the Chinatown, the theatre district and everything else that makes Boston a great place to visit. Our room had a great view of the state house, and was just right for our weekend away. I would definitely recommend this hotel, with its easy access to the T and walking distance to everything else, it was a very nice surprise!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel literally stinks!!”
Reviews.Author: LeavingOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: You can't seem to go anywhere in this hotel without having to smell the noxious chemicals they pump into the air to make the place smell better. The hallways and elevators get spritzed along with the rooms and restrooms. It's enough already! I know this is a part of a broader trend in the industry but it's simply over-done at this property. I even caught them spraying in the gym - the place was packed at 6.00 pm and some guy came in and started spraying a nasty blue spray on the carpets - I had to stop my work out. If it hadnt been for all the headache-inducing smells I would have rated this place higher. The staff are friendly and responsive and the rooms are functional and nicely furnished (although no safes). It's still in transition as they remodel in different areas so be prepared for some disruptions and noise.

Reviews.Title: “Decent busines hotel, right in the middle of the financial district”
Reviews.Author: Mac1312
Reviews.Content: This was between very good and average (but I did not have that rating option). I stayed here for a number of weeks and I have very few complaints about the hotel itself. Positives: The rooms are spacious, nicely decorated with a nice bathroom. The location of the hotel is perfect if you are working in the financial district. However, this area empties out at 6pm and can be dead at weekends. It is however, only a few minutes walk from Boston Common, Beacon Hill and the theatre district (or street). It is located very close to the Downtown metro stop and a couple of minutes walking distance from the South Station (Boston's main train station). There is a basic keep-fit gym in the hotel (some free-weights, treadmills and machines) with a nice pool and steam room. There are some negatives. Overall, the hotel lobby and corridors appear a little stale and worn. The restaurant and bar is very average and inferior to the other hotels of the area (like the Four Seasons or the Ritz Carlton), but the staff were friendly and the service was great overall. I am always frustrated with the priced-wifi situation in hotels, however I can understand the economics of it and mine was in fact free due to the time I spent there. The fact that you need to get 2 elevators to your room is a little annoying, but thats the way it is. In Summary, good but dated business hotel, in a district that empties out after 6pm. But Boston is small and this should not put you off if you get a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok...”
Reviews.Author: sammy2268
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it was close to the theatre disctrict. There was alot of construction going on in the streets so it was hard to find with the directions we had. It was very noisy from the construction going on as well. We were put off that the only refrigerator that was in the room was the minibar one and couldn't be used. We did order one up to the room and it was only $15. Although they ended up bringing up two so we had to send one back. The pub food was ok but they were out of almost everything when we went there around 10pm even though they serve food there until midnight. The bed was comfortable and the room was spacious although I felt the decor was a bit tacky and could use some updating. Nothing to really complain or rave about...it was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: Adamsaid17
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. Plenty of places and attractions within walking distance of the hotel. Words of advice- do not bring stay here if you need to park your car. Parking is minimum of $40 a day. They also charge you for WIFI, which for a 4 star hotel you would expect them to provide more then just a bed to rest on and except such amenities. Other then that, if you can get for 50-100 dollars a night, this would be worth the stay, but be weary of your budgeting as parking and wifi costs money.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in nice area”
Reviews.Author: Daninchatham
Reviews.Content: I go to Boston often, and usually stay here, as it is very close to my office. Rooms are nice, although getting a bit dated and run down. The pool and gym is a bit of a walk, but clean and well kept. The only issue I have ever had (and I've had this same issue each time I go) is when checking in, Im always told my room doesnt come with a breakfast....although each time I book, it clearly says so. Their first reaction is, no sir, your wrong...then after they research it, the call my room to say they were wrong....thye need to get this corrected. Getting into a hotel and the first thing you hear is 'your wrong' isnt the most welcoming to a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ALloyd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a work convention. The location was great. We were within walking distance to many great shops and sights. The room itself was just average and the walls were paper thin. Now the lobby had a couple of restaurants and lounges which had a very nice atmosphere. I probably wouldn't stay here again because it was so overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Typical business class hotel”
Reviews.Author: timminn
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and professional, restaurant & bar were good. The rooms are nice but ordinary and the bathrooms are very small. Internet worked great, check-out easy, etc. The hotel was easy walking distance to our meeting and the door staff helpful in directing us to our destination. The bed was comfortable and I liked that the duvet was not overly warm, which was helpful since it was difficult to get the room cool enough to sleep. This isn't unusual at large hotels. No problems, I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “special anniversary”
Reviews.Author: lpapa11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was right off of the highway and very easy to get to. We requested a high floor room and they gave us the 20th floor, right under the suites. The floor was very quiet and the view was fantastic. As we were leaving to make our 8:15 dinner reservations we heard a knock at the door and when we opened it room service was there. The server asked what the last name was and when i told him he brought in gourmet chocolates and champagne on ice. The note said "Happy Anniversary! thanks for staying with us - Jennifer at the front desk". Fabulous hotel staff need I say more? We will be staying there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Boston”
Reviews.Author: jenna15s
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful. Staff were among most polite and helpful I've ever encountered. Buffet breakfast was excellent (try to book it with your room- it's a better bargain than paying out of pocket each day). Garage parking directly beneath hotel was really convenient. Will absolutely return!

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnriqueGomezLima
Reviews.Content: It was nothing special as a four star hotel. The location is veeery good! The attention was ok until the kicked out my friend (that was waiting for me) from the looby, because he almost fall sleep. Otherwise, nothing different. Remember to pay for parking!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pmonachina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 01/15/12 for one night, through Hotwire. Location is key, especially when the weather is a factor as it was below zero with the wind chill factor. The subway is around the corner and Downtown Crossing, Fanuiel Hall, Boston Common,and the North End are all within easy walking distance. Retail giants, T.J. Maxx,Marshalls, and Macy's are also closeby, as well as the Boston Opera House. An adjacent parking garage make easy access to the hotel. The lobby is located on the third floor, which is inconvient, but the rooms are clean and the staff friendly. If you want a drink(very expensive) or a bite, there's a bar and restaurant in the lobby area. Overall, a great experience. I'd go there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably great staff”
Reviews.Author: Tom09234098
Reviews.Content: The woman, Trang, who checked us in remembered our names 3 days later. The guy who held the door to the hotel open does it with a smile. The bellman on the elevator tried extra hard to make room to fit everyone. The people who answered the phone at the front desk, housekeeping, the concierge.... I could go on forever. Literally every contact we had with someone at this hotel (3 nights) was superb (I have no other word for it). I could talk about how many other hotels I've stayed at, but it's tedious when others do that. Just trust me - this experience with staff was w/in the top 3 in my lifetime. P.S. I'm not a shill for the hotel. They've got a noise problem - you can hear way too much of what's going on in the hallway for me. But, if that's not an issue for you, stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Central location, good room size - some construction noise”
Reviews.Author: fuzz021
Reviews.Content: On the whole we were very pleased with our stay. The hotel is well located for all of the sights, is near to Boston Common and the rooms are large with huge beds. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel bar and restaurant prices are expensive but were have found this is much the same for all hotels. We had a problem with noise from pipes on our third night but staff moved us to the other side of the hotel in the middle of the night and did their best to solve the problem. There is a construction site outside of the hotel so try and get a room as far away from this as possible. That said the noise didn't start until 8am so if you are an early riser it shouldn't be a problem. We good a good rate through price line and were happy with what we got for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Worn and tired”
Reviews.Author: 95Chris
Reviews.Content: Won the room at a good rate on Priceline and it definitely is not worth more than I paid. It is in no way a 4 star. Weird setup because you must first go downstairs, the up to the lobby on the third floor. Really dated lobby, but friendly and attentive staff. All of the furniture, the vanity, doors etc. chipped and scratched. Terrible sink faucet with an aerator so you can't get a steady stream of water to fill a water bottle. Awful and strongly scented toiletries. Room service was goo, but only had the cheeseburger and paid over $24. No free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is just OK”
Reviews.Author: aamip
Reviews.Content: It felt dated. The rooms were fine, the hotel was fine. But, I used a restroom facility at the ground floor near the garage and it was in terrible need of an update. I have no particular complaints, but this was an average hotel and nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great price!”
Reviews.Author: baseball111997
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute on priceline.com (I did not know the name of the hotel until after I booked the room). The rate was terrific. My room was very nice and quiet. I was able to check into the hotel early @ 11:30 AM which helped me a great deal. The location was perfect - a nice coffee/tea shop within a block. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful. I rented a room the week before @ another Boston hotel for twice as much money so this was a really good deal and a very pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, very quiet but everything has a price...”
Reviews.Author: ThomasBL
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Hotwire at a reasonnable rate and were pleased to be situated in the theater district in a known 4 stars trademark hotel with very nice staff upon arrival. Pros : - Well located in the heart of the city (near Chinatown and Financial district) - 21 floors with an appreciable view of downtown (even on the 10th floor) - Rooms and accessories were clean - Very quiet, we didn't heat neighbors at all during our 2 night stay - Regular room is a bit bigger than what i expected Cons : - 10$/day for Wi-Fi or Wired Internet - 32$/Day for parking, no rebates for registered hotel guests (and not possible parking around) - Were charged 5$ for a water bottle we didn't use (but got reimbursed easily without justification) - It felt like everything we touched was to be billed, at high rates... - 2 different elevators to get to the rooms. In conclusion, it is a nice and modern place to stay, but maybe a bit deceiving for a 4 star hotel of this reputation. I would still recommend it, if at the price we got from Hotwire, but i would have been deceived by paying the full official rate. Bon voyage !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: Nick E
Reviews.Content: This is your typical four star level hotel, very nice and what you would expect. Was able to get a good rate through priceline. The hotel is located in a very nice area of Botston. The Theater / financial District is very busy and congested. but really in the center of it all. Boston Common is a few blocks and a short walk away. Beacon Hill is just a few minutes walk further. Faneuil Hall and Quincy market is a short walk as well. The North End is also with in walking distance. Upon arriving at the hotel the doorman was very courteous and helpful. The hotel lobby is not located on the ground floor so you must take an elevator to get to the lobby . Was a bit annoying having to take two elevators every time we came and went, but not the end of the world. I think there might also be some alternative entrance/exits but was not there long enough to figure that out. Arrive early, but was able to check in around 11:30 a.m. Rooms were very much what you would expect. Clean and nice, flat screen tv, desk, and chair.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rgmDurham
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised by the Hyatt after securing a room through hotwire. It's a very comfortable hotel, though the lobby and entrance area left much to be desired. Strange layout, with a parking garage basically the first thing you see of the hotel. Great location if you're interested in the theater district or the down-town crossing shopping district - it's actually in the same complex that also houses the big Macy's store in boston. The park is also very close by. Very quiet while we were there. Nice pool, though a hot tub is sorely missed! Small but decent work-out room is attached to the pool. Didn't try the restaurant - decided there were much more reasonably priced places to eat near-by. All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than OK”
Reviews.Author: AmyMtl
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel we were worried because we saw more negative reviews than good at that time. I have no complainst...the staff was very helpful, the in house restaurant was excellent, the rooms were very clean. Very close to Macy's, TJ Maxx and Marshall's. . .walking distance to all other sites that we wanted to see. . . The only thing I can say negatively is paying for WIFI but that is a problem with all hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adam S
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on Priceline for a great deal. The hotel is right in the middle of downtown Boston. You can walk to almost anything. Great rooms and service. Parking was very reasonable. The bathrooms could be nicer / bigger but overall an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen A
Reviews.Content: I went on hotwire.com and found a great rate at this hotel. Of course with hotwire you don't know the name of the hotel until after you book it. Beautiful hotel! Nice big rooms! CLEAN! Located right in Downtown Crossing close to everything. I travel to Boston many times on business and I will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: DCMcMac
Reviews.Content: Disappointing when hotels such as this still charge for wifi access. We didn't get notified verbally about the complimentary breakfast either although it was no doubt in the fine print somewhere. Rooms were nice and clean although a little boring and the bed not that comfortable. Can't fault the location, it was very easy to get anywhere with the subway station a few hundred metres away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: jess_779
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the HR Boston in October 2011 for 4 days, and it was a relaxing and enjoyable stay! We were greeted with smiles since we arrived: from valets, housekeeping, front desk and the rest of the staff. Our room was very clean, spacious and comfortable; we were lucky to get a room in the 21st floor and we were able to see a bit of Boston Common from our room. The hotel is at a perfect location; minutes away from the Boston Common, next to the Theater District, close to Beacon Hill, and shopping was just around the corner! I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone who is making a trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: ericsf
Reviews.Content: Once again Hyatt has lived up to its name. I am a huge Hyatt fan because of the consistency of their product and great customer service. The Hyatt Regency Boston was yet again another flawless Hyatt property. the hotel is in a very convenient location only blocks from the Boston Common in the heart of downtown Boston. Upon entering I was immediately greeted by friendly doormen. Check in was fast and most importantly the front desk associate was extremely pleasant and welcoming. My room was on the 15th floor with a great view of the city. The room was spotless and very nicely decorated. The bed was amazing. Slept like a baby both nights of my stay. Hotel also had a nice indoor pool and great stay fit gym. The only things I could find wrong were very minor flaws like some of the public spaces are in need of renovation and the shower in the room could have been better quality. Still overall it was a perfect stay. I was highly impressed with the 5 star customer service I received from all of the hotel staff. I definitely will stay here again on my next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “visiting MA”
Reviews.Author: rayger
Reviews.Content: would stay again. wish they told us about complimentary breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good location ...but it's just okay”
Reviews.Author: toby495
Reviews.Content: Listed on Priceline as a 4-star hotel but it was more a 3-star. Good downtown crossing location, near shopping and subway. Good views of the Boston skyline. Room was comfortable but needs minor updating and maintenance. The lobby can be a bit tricky to find (need to take elevator to the 3rd fl). Lots of construction going on nearby. At night the homeless can be found sleeping in doorways and under store overhangs around this hotel. The five lane lap pool is on the smaller size. I cannot attest to the restaurant or Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from business hotel in large city”
Reviews.Author: bccorb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as due to Thanksgiving weekend price was cheaper than staying in suburban hotel and wanted to stay out late and not deal with driving after drinking. Hotel is in perfect location expecially if coming to town to see Nutcracker or whatever is at nearby theatre. Room was ample size with everything you would expect from business class hotel(ie flat screen tv, king sized bed and good toiletries. Mini Fridge was packed with for pay items so could not use it to chill own stuff. Did get 20 minutes of free wi fi which was plenty to check email and look up how to get to restaurants and attractions. After that need to pay which is common for these hotels which I always found weird as Hyatt Place there cheaper brand gives this for free. Cable was a bit limited as only had 20 or so channels. Access to hotel is a bit weird as enter through street level and then go up one level to lobby to get to elevators to room. Hotel is split into four story atrium levels and due to arrangement there was ample light in this area as one wall is full of windows looking out to city. Elevator bank was small considering size of hotel so judge at busier times would take awhile to come to your floor. Parking is expensive at 42 dollars a day for valet though do allow for unlimited in and outs so if traveling over city in car this is nice though if plan to do that why stay in downtown Boston. Can find 20 dollar a day parking nearby. Did not eat breakfast as cost extra so walked a few blocks and grabbed Dunkin Donuts as you are near shopping district. Also did not try out fitness center. If coming to Boston for Business in downtown or to see a show it is a nice option as compares nicely to Marriot but for me would rather save my money and go to one of the hotels on outskirt of town like the Hyatt Place I reviewed also.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Samantha P
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed here for a night as a mini no child getaway. Staff was wonderful, the room was clean, as well as the bathroom. The bed was comfy and the sheets were nice. The hotel was in great location. Close to Quincy Market/ Faneuil Hall (about a 10-12 min walk). Street type fair around the corner in front of Macy's. The parking garage was clean and I felt safe leaving my car there over night ($32 for 12-24hrs) But compared to other garages and parking areas, I felt like it was worth the $32. All in all we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot. Needs upgrading”
Reviews.Author: baddabingtmc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for holiday while visiting family. Pricelined the place. Room was not bad. Parking is 32. Dollars a night. Valet is 45. Noisy neighbors kept us awake. You could sit in bathroom and here next room through the vent. Not a place I would recommend or stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “This is our go to hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Skye7144
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a number of times and I have never been disappointed with the property, staff or amenities. On our recent tip over Thanksgiving, the staff kindly offered to upgrade us to a very spacious corner room with two layaway beds (at no extra charge) when I explained I was traveling with two teenage boys. On several days there were either fresh homemade cookies or hot cider offered to arriving guests. There were several bowls of fresh fruit available at the front desk. The well-equipped fitness room was open 24 hours. The very comfortable beds with soft down comforters are heaven, just the thing you look forward to after a long day of sightseeing. Staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful at all times. These little things are important to me and are usually the deciding factor when choosing a hotel. In addition, as many previous reviewers have stated, you could not find a better location for either shopping or sightseeing. The only thing I didn't love about this hotel was the low water pressure, the shower experience could have been a better one. But as this is a relatively minor issue (and one that will hopefully be corrected) we will continue to stay at the Hyatt Regency whenever we visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME LOCATION!!!! So-so amenities.”
Reviews.Author: PaulPendon
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel on November 19, 2011. The hotel was right off the highway and easy to navigate to. Plenty of signage indicating where to park. Parking was $32 - which some may think is expensive (it is) but we payed $41 at the Hilton Back Bay in the summer so.....yea... Check-in was very quick - you have to take an elevator to get to the lobby if you're coming from outside or from the parking lot, which is an interesting design. We were put on the 18th floor - a previous recommendation to get a higher floor for less noise is definitely worthwhile. The room itself was pretty typical. King-size bed, flat screen TV, desk, chair with leg rest. The washroom was okay - the shower has this ledge that goes along the inside which is great for putting all of our shampoo and soap from home. We could quite clearly hear conversations between people in the hallways that were passing through - there were a few signs in the room asking guests to be quiet after 9pm. They must have had noise issues in the past. Bed was very comfortable and had tons of pillows. Check-out was quick but the elevator area to get to the parking lot/main exit got a little congested. The location is probably the best factor about this place. So close to Faneuil Hall, the harbour, lots of stores along Washington Road.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: KDutton10
Reviews.Content: We were very nervous about getting this hotel on priceline for $90 after we read bad reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised. Our room was upgraded for free to a suite which goes for $340 regularly. It was our anniversary and everyone said "happy anniversary" to us. They made sure our cab was there on time, and gave us a beautiful room that was clean and very quiet. I would absolutely go back. Hyatt Regency Boston is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: SFDutchman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the first week of November for a conference and was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. I usually stay at Starwood hotels (Westin, W, & Sheraton). The hotel staff are very well trained (perhaps due to the fact that this hotel was formerly a SwissHotel?), friendly, and willing to go the extra mile to assist guests. The hotel is excellently situated for transportation (downtown crossings T-line station is 1/2 a block away). The rooms are well-appointed and designed well. The entire hotel could use a renovation of its public areas & furniture (I hear it is coming in early 2012). The hotel has a fantastic fitness center (open 24 hours) and a great pool & locker rooms. Each locker room has a sauna, showers, lockers etc. The only problem I had with the fitness center was the showers in the mens locker room....they need an update! (again, I was told this will be improved with the planned renovation). For coffee drinkers, take note of a wonderful coffee cafe called Boston Common Coffee Co which is across the street on Washington. The only reason I gave this hotel a Very Good instead of an Excellent rating is the need for a renovation. I would return on my next visit for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location, really nice, great service!”
Reviews.Author: jazzjunkysue
Reviews.Content: If you want to get to know the historic parts of Boston on foot, this is a great choice, and it's cheaper than other comparable hotels. We didn't use the indoor pool, but it was really warm! This is in the downtown crossing, meaning you're a block or two from every train line. The Boston metro is clean, cute, feels safe, and quick. Parking is expensive, and contrary to other reviews I've read online, the garage below the hotel is $32/ every 24 hours weekends. There might have been cheaper open lots nearby, but that might take you some running around to find, and if there's a saturday event nearby at the theaters, just give up and pay. The other lots will soak you for the evening and then tack on the night....Your saving grace is to get the car out before your 24 hours are up and put it on the street sunday morning. The on-street parking opens up significantly sunday. We didn't eat there but I'm sure it's at least OK. There are so many good choices to eat at every price point, I'd look elsewhere. Beds are those legendary Hyatt soft beds. Hard to get out of. The bathtub was fine, but nothing to write home about. Right near Beacon Hill and back bay, short walk to Quincy market, the north end/italian section, Boston Harbor long wharf, and right in chinatown. The entrances from the hotel are not really in chinatown: They're in the business district. I'll use it again.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: nh2boston
Reviews.Content: we have been going to this property for years. it has always been a dependable and constant experiance. however this last trip left us wondering if we will return. we take many trips to boston each year, and depending on our agenda we use several hotels. this last visit was disappointing from a standards point. the staff at the desk and car park were extremly nice. problems began in the room. there were no glass glasses for drinks just 2 coffee cups. the lotion bottle was left over from the last guest as it was only half full. sitting down on the bed we discovered 1 pillow case with what appeared to be blood stains on it. since there were many pillows we just put that one off to the side. using the shower the next morning we discovered the grout along the tub wall seam was missing and there was mold in the gap. as i said earlier, we are long time customers here. my best guess is that managment has been in place too long and time for a shuffle. these are basic simple issues a hotel of the hyatts standing should never have.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for downtown business trip”
Reviews.Author: ckb18
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this location many times and the hotel is a perfect place to stay if your conducting business in downtown boston. The rooms are very nice. The gym has a steam room, sauna and a pool. The staff is helpful in making my stay as easy as possible, the concierge has always recommended great places for client dinners. The hotel is walking distance away from south station and the heart of the financial district. I definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: AllisonNNH
Reviews.Content: Before i even start my review, I have to address the previous post "Nickel and Dimed." First, some of costs cited are not correct. Parking was $32. In-room wireless was $9.95. And there was free coffee in the room. Second, parking rates in Boston are generally very high. (My office building 100 yards from the Hyatt gets $38 per day, more if you stay overnight.) This is a hotel in the business area of the city and while we may not like the fees, they are pro forma in this type of hotel. If you do not want this, then choose a Hampton Inn type hotel or stay in the 'burbs and you will be much happier. I had a great 1 night stay at this hotel. Room was clean, spacious and very well appointed. Every staff person I encountered went above and beyond. I was there bc I had no power in my home for 5 days and I could not have found a nicer place to stay. There are many nice restaurants in the area and the theater district is steps away. The hotel is also on the edge of Chinatown, which does get a little iffy late at night. Just be aware of your surroundings and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, a good Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Galfons
Reviews.Content: We have been there for a couple of days (tourism). The room was gorgeous: clean and much bigger than expected. Food and location were fine. Reception and concierge were very kind in giving us support, though reception not being at ground floor is quite unusual to me! As we were there with Hyatt Gold Points, I cannot say if daily rate is fair.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Debmiester
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel in October 2011 before leaving on a cruise. All of the literature we read was that this was considered "waterfront". Imagine our dismay, when finding this hotel a couple of miles from the actual waterfront area. It is a nice hotel but nothing extra special. The staff is friendly enough and the rooms nice enough. If you want a nice hotel in the Theater District in Boston, this might be a reasonable priced choice. If you want waterfront, stay at the Marriot Long Warf.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: kbockl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently situated between the Boston Common and Downtown Crossing (a great shopping destination.) It's also an easy walk to Quincy Market and the waterfront. The staff was very professional and helpful from the front desk, to housekeeping, to in-room dining deliveries; and the meetings services staff was particularly helpful. Food was a step above the usual restaurant fare including room service, the restaurant, and catered meals for meeting events. My 6 night stay was for a large meeting. My only issue with teh property is its layout. The meeting rooms are spread out over three floors and our group was always confused. You also have to take three different elevators for various floors - parking garage to lobby, lobby to rooms, street entrance to lobby, etc.

Reviews.Title: “nickle and dime”
Reviews.Author: PietoJ
Reviews.Content: Quite simply my biggest complaint was how they charge for every extra amenity that I have gotten free at even the dumpiest hotels. OK I did get my room thru Priceline so I guess in their minds it's OK to treat me like a second class citizen. First it was the $35 parking fee per day to use the garage ! $35!!! I know this is Boston but it's not like it's in the North End. Like many guests I just went 3 blocks down on some dark and empty side street - for free at the risk of a break in. Then it was the wireless. Fine doesn't need to be free in my room but no Hotspot in the building left me a captive unless I paid $15/hr. $5 for bottled water in the room? OK all that just left be bitter.. but $2. for coffee in the morning !!! REALLY. You can't throw down some free coffee ?? Is Hyatt going under? Because all this terribly cheapness makes it feel low budget.. I left the hotel soap and shampoo... maybe they'll start changing for toilet paper next. Probably going to go somewhere with out the Hyatt name that feels less like staying with a cheap relative.

Reviews.Title: “Great location BUT!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorKeo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as the start to Falls & Foliage Tour â€“ so this wasnâ€™t my choice. The public rooms were splendid and the check in staff was very helpful. Our room was nice and spacious and well appointed. My real problem with the hotel was the sound insulation â€“ The bedside alarm went off at 3 am in the NEXT room, it was so loud that I thought it was mine. We both had a disturbed night, as we could hear the occupants of the adjoining room talking (and singing to the radio!). I also thought that charging $9.95 a day for the Internet is penny pinching â€“ All the other hotels we stayed at during the rest of our tour the Internet was free.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get a room at the Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: KayleighTurner
Reviews.Content: We arrived mid afternoon with a very tired 4 year old to find that our room was not ready! We went to wait in the bar (very nice staff) and were eventually told we had a room. The room itself lacks any personality but is perfect if you just want somewhere to sleep. Be warned though you have to pay hefty prices to watch any of the tv programmes/ play the games! Do not stay here if you are likely to want some fresh air or a cigarette as you have to go down in one set of elevators then walk through the large lobby to some other elevators then walk through another lobby to get outside! The staff in general were all very nice and helpful. The fitness facilities are great for adults and kids (though probably best to go with kids to the pool when its empty). The hotel is in a great location but we were led to believe it was above Macy's- it's not. You have to go to yet another set of elevators down 2 floors then its a short walk from there. We tried not to spend too much time here but on the second night we had to order room service as our son had fallen asleep and the Clam Chowder and fries were excellent!!! All in all its not a terrible hotel but I wouldn't stay here again. The price was also very steep with it being half term week (the Marriot on the waterfront would have been $200 dollars a night cheaper but it was full). Also the maid service is terrible. The beds were made and towels were tidied but the room itself was not tidied (as you would expect it to be

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: sdonnac40601
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hyatt in downtown Boston for 5 nights. It was a great stay. Very clean and the staff was great, especially Ryan at the front desk. Great location as we could walk anywhere we wanted to go. 10 minute walk to Quincy Market. 10 minutes to the bus station. 2 minutes to Boston Common. Would definately stay there again if in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “I liked our stay but would it was just ok”
Reviews.Author: cruzngreg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because I had a pet, small dog. Location was easy to get to off the I90 and I returned a Hertz car which was walking distance to the hotel. The outside area of the hotel borders Chinatown and it is filthy, although convenient to walk to all the sights. I wouldn't stay in this area again. It was a block to the park with the dog, for a dog friendly place I was surprised that there was no place to take your pet without walking to the park, a small grassy area was no where in site. Also, I left my dog's leash in NY with family and the gift shop has nothing for pets, no pet food, no leash, etc. Just a suggestion, they may want to include emergency supplies for pets in the gift shop. Also, no in-room safe, although the front desk does have a safe for your use, it was not as convenient as having one in-room which can easily be done. I hate those mini-bar refrigerators, no space to store pet food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall stay”
Reviews.Author: jason31574
Reviews.Content: Hotel was decent though obvious that the hotel needs some updating in the bathrooms, public areas and elevators. Room was average size, good place for a conference. Very good food. At the right price, well worth it

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: AMITSPVERMA
Reviews.Content: the biggest plus of this hotel is the location - which is just in mid of the city, with financial district visible from your window. Even the local market and resturants are a short walk away, and so is chinatown. The nearest rail head is also fifty steps away. It has a public parking next door, and even the tourist sites are a short walk away - so location is where it scores a 10/10. Very useful business hotel - free internet, good clean rooms and fabulous inviting beds. The view from the higher floors was nothing much to speak about. Staff were friendly and helpful. A proper 5 star property with little to complain - buffet breakfast is pricey but hey is not that also expected of a hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “WiFi should be free”
Reviews.Author: Loveable_Wookie
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice. Climate control was off, it was cooler in the hallway which had central core between the rooms. We called about the A/C and we were assured that it would be looked at. No difference the entire stay, it was nicer climate-wise out in the hall. The Internet was not complimentary and at these prices compared to lesser hotels that offer free internet I was offended. The entry was not convenient, no clear entrance to the hotel. It was a good location close to the Freedom trail, within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: bruce440
Reviews.Content: Easy to find and walk to from South Station. Nice rooms and good views from high floor we requested. Nice to be upgraded to business package with internet and one free buffet breakfast. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey with annoying extra charges-Book elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Roch06
Reviews.Content: As many other reviewers have already stated, the hotel's location is its strongest point. It is centrally located, public parking is next door, subway station around the corner along with theatres, shops, restaurants and many tourist sites. We found the hotel to be clean and well maintained. Staff were friendly and courteous. My only concern was the nickel and diming of extra fees in addition to a $300/night rate (without breakfast) that we paid. I was very annoyed to find there was no free internet access in rooms or in the shared business center on the first floor. However, you can buy internet access at a mere cost of $26/hour. That's outrageous. The Hyatt is very large and accommodates conferences, conventions and corporate clients. Apparently, they don't care what individual customers want or experience, so I'd suggest looking elsewhere for a better value and a more positive experience. Now I understand why the Hyatt is ranked a "C" by reviewers (56 out of 73 hotels) in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, with great views, but not worth the high prices”
Reviews.Author: gk1star
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, great location, but it was definately the price was high for a standard hotel. The free breakfast was great, actually pretty good quailty for a free buffet. This hotel is in the heart of it all, walking distance to everything. 2 things, please Hyatt...the coffee was bad and the white ginger line of shampoo/conditioner/soap smells horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but found connecting rooms not well sound proof”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_maple_leaf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently location to discover Boston city center and walk downtown within a few minutes. However we were disturbed by the noise of the ice machine (despite being several doors away) and it was possible to hear people talks next door because all rooms connect together with doors which did not make rooms properly sound proof, in my opinion. Excepted this, the hotel is clean, breakfast buffet is great and the hotel has eveything expected for such hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StillDreaming
Reviews.Content: We were only going to be in downtown Boston for 2 days so we wanted to be close to the freedom trail. I pricelined and won the Hyatt for a great price (for Boston $). We walked everywhere from the hotel. The hotel has a few rough edges in the rooms but nothing that would deter me from staying there again. Bed was great, did a sweep for bedbugs and did not see any traces!!! Yea!! Service at the hotel was very friendly, door men were very helpful on directions and restaurant had wonderful food.

Reviews.Title: “so so stay”
Reviews.Author: jamom111
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not up to what you would expect of the Hyatt Regency. Although room was clean, it was worn out, nothing special. Carpet did not feel clean. Hair dryer was cracked and had been repaired with glue! Bathroom was old. Lobby is small and it is hard to find your way around inside. Porter left our luggage in lobby at check-in, and we never got it in our room- finally went back to get it ourselves as reception phone didn't work. Previous stay at a competing hotel across from MIT was much more luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “In need of update”
Reviews.Author: Travel2much4work
Reviews.Content: Nicely located near the T...steps away from Tufts Hospital and china town. We had a hard time finding restaurants near the hotel. Reception area does not have wifi; not convenient for a business traveler in need of internet while waiting for room availability. Rooms were in need of an upgrade, old bathroom fixtures, old furniture- very run down and depressing. Luckily we were only there for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, adequate accommodations”
Reviews.Author: slcSF
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed at the Hyatt for 3 nights recently. We found the location very convenient to the T, downtown, Chinatown, North Beach, Boston Common, and the Back Bay. All were within an easy walking distance, ranging from a minute or two to the T to just over 15 minutes to North Beach. I have to agree with some reviewers that our room on the 8th floor, while comfortable, was lacking in some areas. The bathroom had the most obvious deficiencies: both the wallpaper and the wood panel below the sink were worn and chipped. The toilet paper holder looked unnecessarily cheap and was installed crooked. The bathtub had marks near the drain that made the tub look unclean. Upon rubbing, however, I discovered the marks were really chips in the surface or some other permanent defect. Finally, the bottom sheet on my bed did not cover the entire foot of the bed. I woke up one night to discover my feet extended beyond the end of the sheet and onto whatever lay underneath! It's hard to understand how anyone could think this was an acceptable way to make a bed. As of Sept. 2011, there was wireless internet for the common $9.95 daily fee, contrary to other travelers' comments. We found the information in our room's Hyatt binder was outdated. There was an insert in our key sleeve informing us of the wireless option. The two elevators (one from street/garage to lobby and another from lobby to rooms)are an inconvenience, and we never got used to it. I can see that this arrangement would be annoying if dealing with a wheelchair or stroller. Since we had neither issues, we could live with it. The pool and exercise room were nice, but a bit of a hike....with more stairs in several places. I don't know how you access that area with a stroller or wheelchair. Overall, a good place to stay if you do not have to pay top dollar.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: lelake
Reviews.Content: I went through Priceline and got a great deal at the Hyatt by naming my own price. It's a good hotel for crashing for the night when you are sightseeing or on bussiness. The fitness room was great and I loved the steam shower and pool! The sauna was not working. Great location to walk easily to the North End, decent room. The room was clean, comfy enough. Phone did not work. Have to pay for Wireless, so I did without.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: gri396
Reviews.Content: A high school friend of mine and I pick a different city for an annual 'get together' trip. This year we met in Boston. The Hyatt proved to be the perfect location to see the city. Close to Chinatown and the Theatre district among other things. The local restaurants are splendid. Would recommend to anyone for a perfect weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tekwizrd
Reviews.Content: Very nice accommodations. Many perks, lots of room. Clean, great buffet. Centrally located. Staff very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Details tip the scale”
Reviews.Author: AusTXGal
Reviews.Content: And unfortunately, not in the direction of 'Wow, I can't wait to come back here'. The hotel was in an excellent location for us as we toured Boston for the first time, being situated in the midst of shopping, steps from the subway and at the edge of the Common. While the Regency overall was good and clean, the housekeeping was spotty. Dirty glasses left behind, sheets not renewed when requested and other small things that don't measure up to the standard of a hotel like this. All the staff we interacted with were lovely and helpful. The room mini bar can't hold anything you might want to keep cold - you have to ask for an additional refrigerator. There are no vending machines, only a Gift Shop in the lobby where a bottle of water and a soda will set you back $7.50. You get a sense of being nickeled and dimed here. It's a good thing there are options within walking distance such as a cute little coffee shop, a Dunkin Donuts and a wine store. So, with a little planning and forethought you can avoid senseless costs. I believe that staying at a nice hotel should offer many of the things this hotel does, but what would make me come back would be if the details were more tangible. I would have much rather had the convenience of getting a soda steps from my room, than TWO doormen greeting me each day as I left or returned. In my opinion, customer service is the whole package of the product delivered and how it is done. The Regency clearly ensures their staff know how to approach customers, but I left wishing I had been taken care of a little better.

Reviews.Title: “5-star price for 2.5-star room”
Reviews.Author: Ciel_M
Reviews.Content: The location is great the the doorman & valet parking people are top-notch; very attentive and helpful. I would give 5-stars in those areas. However, for the price paid, we expected an IMPECCABLE room, and that's not what we got. Everything was just so-so; nothing special. The beds were small, somewhat comfortable, but nothing said "high-end luxury" except for the price! To top it off, our bathroom had two unsightly problems that really should have been fixed before renting the room to anyone (and we stayed on a weekday night, so it's not like they were SO full that they HAD to use that room). We had just finished the "Freedom Trail" by foot and were sore, weary, and had to figure out where to get boarding passes printed out before getting cleaned up for dinner with friends, so no, we didn't re-pack all of our belongings and drag everything down to the 3rd floor reception area to ask for a different room. No time or energy to tell them how to do their job; as they shouldn't have put anyone in a room that was not up to par in the first place. According to the hotel website, they have "Business Services" but nothing about printing documents, so we had to walk to the nearest UPS store to get it done - AFTER paying another $9.95 to the Hyatt Regency for internet. Geesh! Even hotels that charge half what you do come with free internet these days; what's up with that Haytt? They also kept all the hallways uncomfortably COLD; we dreaded the walk from our room to the elevator. Bottom line, we felt we didn't get the high-end luxury experience we paid for, and we'd look elsewhere if staying in Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Less quality than expected”
Reviews.Author: may0572
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Great location but quality of room wasn't worth the price. Also no wifi; which I haven't experienced at any of the other hotels I sttayed at in Boston. Room service for breakfast was poor. Burnt soggy toast and tasteless homefries. Not a bad experience but for the money you can do much better in the theatre district.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, forgettable stay”
Reviews.Author: middyj2005
Reviews.Content: Traveling to Boston, the Hyatt offered an ideal central location, clean accommodations, and little else. The beds were in need of replacement, as the matress sloped significantly. In addition, walls were surprisingly thin for a major hotel. The concierge was remarkable. For business travel, the hotel gets a reluctant pass, but this isn't a hotel I'd return to for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Ele”
Reviews.Author: lavau610
Reviews.Content: This hotel had HORRIBLE customer service. When we arrived, we were trying to check in and they wouldn't let us leave our car to check in. They wanted our keys or one of us had to stay with the car. The AC in our room leaked and made the carpet soaking wet. The location wasn't good at all if you are looking for a place to walk to dinner. Finally, they wouldn't give me my Hyatt points because I booked through another website.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Great Location, but...”
Reviews.Author: cbozman
Reviews.Content: All in all, my wife and I loved this place. It was convenient to all the things we wanted to do, we got a great rate on Priceline, the concierge was very helpful and the front desk check-in staff put us on the 21st (out of 22) floor, so we had great views. The location is right in the theater district, it's about a 15 min walk to the water taxis to go the to USS Constitution, or if you're feeling a little less inclined to walk, you're about a 5 min walk to the Boylston Station. The one thing that I didn't like was you had to take two elevators to get in and out of the hotel. You take one to get to the main lobby, and other to get to the street level. I think that could be simplified. I'm sure they have their reasons. Also, you would think that if you're paying for a nice hotel, they wouldn't nickel and dime you for Wi-Fi...but they do. C'mon Hyatt...even Motel 6 and The Comfort Inn pick up the cost on that. Overall, it was a nice room, a great location and the staff couldn't have been nicer. If we can get another great deal on Priceline.com, we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel, value, location”
Reviews.Author: EstelleHNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for Labor Day Weekend. I could not have asked for a more perfect hotel. The location was smack in the middle of the city so I was able to walk everywhere. The concierge was so helpful as well. I was traveling alone so she recommended the best restaurants and hot spots for each night. She also directed me to various tourist attractions. I had one issue with the AC and I called the front desk. Josephine directed me to Sasha who had someone up to my room in 15 mnutes. They upgraded me to the business plan for the inconvenience. Josephine followed up by calling the room to make sure all of my needs were met. The breakfast was great, the hotel was clean, rooms were comfortable and the staff was beyond helpful. I would never stay anywhere else and once again Hyatt continues to impress me!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place! A bit expensive and no wi-Fi! But, everything else is great!”
Reviews.Author: FearlessNinja
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Great service from the front door man, the receptionist, the restaurant and from the person getting a taxi. I will definitely come back here again. Plus, it is so close to the freedom trail. And, the downtown shopping area, Quincy market, shed aquarium. A big negative is that there is no wi-Fi!!!!!! Why can't this hotel just give it for free when I paid $400 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Amateur hour at the Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: fejrfr
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping doesn't come close to acceptable. Front desk is a bunch of lost youngsters without a clue, this place has lost its footing and should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: DeepOceanSwimmer
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fan of urban chain hotels, finding them considerably less pleasant than their counterparts in resort areas (my thinking was that the Hyatt on Maui is bound to be far better than a Hyatt in an East Coast megalopolis). And while the Boston Hyatt wasn't as good as it's sister on Maui, it was much better than we expected. Room service had truly excellent food (and I'm a bit of a food snob). The staff was polite and pleasant, fulfilling all requests. My only peeve with this hotel is that they use industrial smelling cleansers to clean the rooms, making it so that we had to sleep with the window open. (We tried 2 rooms, both smelled like cleaning fluid). At least the windows did open, or it would have been really unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “the best night's sleep in Boston”
Reviews.Author: MichaelACox
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and am always chuffed when it's the one that gets booked for my trips to Boston. It's quiet, very comfortable, the romms are spacious and well fitted and the beds are just great. It really is the best night's sleep in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for all Boston fun.”
Reviews.Author: TPM1010
Reviews.Content: We were able to walk or take T rail everywhere. Felt safe and area was clean. Plenty to do.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Comfortable, and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: trippinwiththekids
Reviews.Content: We staye here for our anniversary and couldn't be more pleased. This is not a luxury property but it is comfortable, the staff is super friendly, and it is convenient to everything. Our flight arrived early and we were given an early check-in. When the front desk learned that we were in town to celebrate our anniversary they upgraded us to a corner suite with a beautiful view of the state house. The concierge was able to make last minute reservations at one of our favorite restaurants. The restaurant on site has a fantastic breakfast. The omlettes and pancakes with blackberries and raspberries made to order are amazing! The hotel is a comfortable walk to anywhere in the city and public transporation is very very close by. All in all this was a wonderful stay. This is a solid hotel with nice, clean rooms and an iincerdible staff. I would recommend it and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A reliable staple”
Reviews.Author: JOP1_10
Reviews.Content: I stay here pretty often for work as it is close to my office, although the last few times I've been in Boston, I have stayed at the InterCon. The Hyatt is never going to win an award for it's design, in fact, when you arrive by taxi, you have to go downstairs and then up in the lift to get to reception. Crazy. The Hyatt Boston isn't a flash hotel. But it has great staff, who either really care about people orb who at least just don't have the (bad) attitude that so many staff at other hotels have. The other thing I notice, is that year after year, you see a number of the same staff faces and they are still smiling. That has to be a good thing. The buffet breakfast is nothing to rave about but not bad either. Hyatt - an upgrade to this old dame would be great. In the meantime, if you are looking for a clean, comfortable hotel where the Staffa smile at you, this is a good choice, and judging by the number of children who ere there this time, it appears very family friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AprilMThomas
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful long weekend in Boston, and this Hyatt serving as our home base made the visit even more enjoyable. Great views, comfy bed, concierge was very helpful. The only con I can think of is the price of parking, but being from Chicago it really wasn't too surprizing. I have been around the country and this wasn't the most expensive parking, but it seems that parking at hotels has gotten completely outrageous. As such, I usually try to find off-site parking close to any hotel in a city - and this hotel happened to have a parking lot directly across the street!! FYI - there are metered spots around this hotel, of which we also took advantage. Had an unpleasant experience with the bartender, but the waitress and restaurant were fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Jarr_mich
