Reviews.Content: Rooms were great. Bed really comfortable but decor in bathroom somewhat dated. Location is good for exploring Boston. Gym and pool facilities good. Would expect free wifi in this class of hotel. Staff were efficient but not particularly friendly ( apart from concierge who was great)

Reviews.Title: “Bring your sugar daddy!”
Reviews.Author: tbag3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a cheap stay by any means..and after paying a pretty decent nightly rate, they will nickle and dime you for EVERY little request that you may find comes standard in other hotels. ($15 room refrigerator delivery fee, $15 for one hour of internet in the business center, $16 for a crappy continental breakfast, self parking is over $30 per day, etc). The hotel does not have a shuttle service either. When asking the hotel staff questions, it seems each person will have a different, inconsistent response as well. Very discouraging. Good location& good if money is no issue.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JUAN G
Reviews.Content: Very well placed. We could go walking elsewhere. It's a very big hotel. Corner rooms are excellent! They are big and have two windows with amazing views on downtown buildings

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... needs a hot tub...”
Reviews.Author: mustangdjb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Boston for the Marathon and overall, it was very nice. The location was great (less than 1 k from the finish line) and the hotel staff were really great! We ran into some issues with having more than one computer on the internet and I was shocked that there was no hot tub (the pool, steam room and work out facility were first rate). The room service breakfast was pricey, but it was very tasty. The room was very clean and the view was great.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite east coast hotel”
Reviews.Author: manhattantraveler24
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be hands down the nicest chain hotel I have stayed in. The room was very clean and modern. The staff was incredibley nice and everytime we walked by the lobby they asked how we were doing and how are stay was. The pool was fantastic it was olympic size and had great dressing rooms. I love this hotel and recommend that anyone going to Boston should stay there

Reviews.Title: “Good experience would recommend if you can get the right price”
Reviews.Author: Clive J
Reviews.Content: We ended up paying about $225 per room per night including the Hyatt upgrade to get a high floor. This is a good quality hotel in a good location even as a visitor. I would not have wanted to pay more than I did but would recommend if you can get this price or less. Good fitness centre and pool. We asked for and were given connecting rooms as we were travelling with our teenage children. I think this is now a slightly older hotel so choose a high floor away from the elevator in order to get some quiet, you can hear people in the next room although we were not really disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “Great buffet breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbella85_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because i had a staff discount but otherwise i would probably opt for something a little more luxurious and couples friendly. Overall hotel is pretty nice. Staff at the front was a little "dry" if you ask me. Pros: -The gym although a little out of the way is very good with cardio machines, weights... -Swimming pool is great and not busy in the mornings...So is Sauna and Steam Room -Breakfast buffet is so delicious! The "omelette"station was quick and you can choose your own toppings as well as ask the lady ( she was super nice!) to use egg whites... -Central location of the hotel: access to major tourist points in the city Cons: -The room was fairly small -Security in the downstairs lobby is pretty strict about letting guests in ( which is good and bad i guess) and demand your room key.... -The hotel has more of a business feel to it and i wouldn't recommend it to couples looking for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: MelG9
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location if you are planning on walking everywhere but parking is a rip off as well as there are no perks. If you are looking to stay at a hotel that "gets the job done," then this is a nice place to stay but it is no way near what I expected for the price I paid for a room. Be careful when eating in the dining room as it is also overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room; Helpful Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Eggie84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Boston with my husband and 10 year old daughter after having reserved through Priceline. I was a bit concerned based on the reviews but was pleasantly surprised. When we checked in, the attendant asked why we were there and when we said that we planned to walk the Freedom Trail, he told us we were only a block away and gave us a map. The location is terrific. The beds were comfortable. The room was very clean and the bathroom was nicely appointed. We had stayed at the hotel when it was Swissotel and were pleased. We were pleased again with it in its Hyatt incarnation.

Reviews.Title: “Meh, just okay.”
Reviews.Author: SaraSutterfield
Reviews.Content: I hosted a gathering of friends at this hotel for a long weekend. I must say that the entire experience was...trying. After being transferred from person to person in the convention department, the contract was "misinterpreted" and the GM had to get involved. The GM resolved the issue, but the woman who took over my group after that still struggled to execute what should have been an easy weekend. My guess is that this hotel is only set up for business travelers and had no idea what to do with a large group of people traveling with kids. I set aside the booking experience and expected to enjoy a typical Hyatt visit. As a platinum Hyatt guest, I expect a basic level of service. This hotel was disappointing. The rooms were small and worn, though the bed was comfortable. I stayed in a end-of-hall suite and it was unimpressive. The doorways were so small, a wheelchair could not fit in the room (I had visiting friends that needed access, and I didn't feel comfortable taking up a "handicap room"). The toiletries were nice, but housekeeping didn't bother to replinish them each day (even though they were empty). Actually, housekeeping didn't bother to do much cleaning at all. We had to call down and actually ask them to come clean the room 2 days into the trip. The food at the buffet breakfast was mediocre, but the service was good. The omlette bar and pancake bar were nice, because at least the food was hot and fresh (unlike the lukewarm bacon sitting in its own grease for several hours), but the choices for omlettes was limited (e.g. no spinach). Also the fresh fruit was no very good, considering the season (but that might be the Californian in me not realizing that the East coast has bad fruit...) The atmosphere in the diningroom was very nice, so that made the breakfast a plesant enough experience. The pool was decent for a city hotel. It was warm enough, without being too warm. It had a door that opened up to a roof-top patio, which was a nice place for the kids to get outside and run around. But, to get to the pool you had to follow a long maze involving a lot of stairs. I never did locate elevator access (thereby making it handicap inaccessible). Overall, I wasn't impressed with this hotel. My friends (who stayed there because of me) were VERY unimpressed. It seems that the only redeeming quality I found (decent service) was not present in there experience. My guess is that my platinum status + role as event coordinator put me on the staff's radar, which means a regular guest would have an even worse experience. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again. I'll be back at the Omni Parkerhouse Hotel for my next Boston trip.

Reviews.Title: “NO CANCELLATIONS EVEN A MONTH AND A HALF PRIOR, PAID A FULL WEEK WITHOUT EVEN STAYING THERE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stoliarov
Reviews.Content: I made reservations here online for a business seminar two months in advance. Soon thereafter, due to work scheduling, I could not make it so I decided to cancel. Little did I know, the reservation I made included a small print statement of full pre-payment with no cancellations. I spoke to two people there and discussed my situation and noted the early notice to cancel but they would not bulge. No customer service whatsoever and sounded like some cheap motel receptions. WHAT A SCAM! I realize the economy is unstable but still, they have no effort to live up to their name, or what I USED TO think of their standards. NEVER MAKING RESERVATIONS WITH HYATT WORLDWIDE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for business and for tourism”
Reviews.Author: SamandDerek
Reviews.Content: Was only here one night and enjoyed my stay. The check-in was speedy (3PM) and the two check-in agents were extremely nice and funny. The room was spacious - bathroom door could have been nicer (it would not stay open and needed a good painting). The bed was comfy and I love the pillows. We had drinks at the bar and the server was very friendly. The location after dark is pretty deserted but we cabbed it back from dinner and didn't have any problems. We also cabbed it to/from Logan with ease. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice , but not worth upgrading the room”
Reviews.Author: holidayfan59
Reviews.Content: usual problem, requested a high floor and they could not give us one, despite asking 2 days in a row. we booked a la fayettee suite and were disapointed to find that they all come with a cecting door! very poorly fitted conecting door, our sons were in a standard room and they dont have conecting doors !! one of the reasons for booking this hotel as it had an outside sitting area, however i was asked to leave it twice during my stay as it had been booked for private functions , whats that about ? it either does or it does not have an external seating area. bathrooms in all rooms very tired and in need of renovation. also only had 6 coathangers in a room that can take 4 peopel ! not great value for moeny we paid $300 plus a night and then stung $22 for breakfast !

Reviews.Title: “Need to renew: service and food.”
Reviews.Author: Fsanches
Reviews.Content: Good location, no good deal in rooms and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, location, and food.”
Reviews.Author: Watetslider
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a weekend stay at the hotel. The hotel is a pretty short walk from South Station, Boston's major transit station, and had an enjoyable walk over. We were checked in by a Ms Maggie, who was professional and did her job well enough, but it was a series of motions rather than an engaging conversation. The rooms are nicely decorated and we had a pretty view of the city; we had a two bed room. Everything was flawless; the housekeeping staff had paid a lot of attention of detail. We went downstairs to the Concierge Desk, and were greeted by a Mr Mike, a Mr Stephan, and a Ms Susan. Each were friendly and extremely knowledgable. We had some pretty non-standard questions about the city and bars, but they were able to help us set everything up. A+ to all three individuals. They were also able to give us information for the tours we wanted to take, the places we wanted to go, and gave us suggestions for further exploring. As we headed out, Mr Steven, the bellman, was extraordinarily friendly and offered to help us find where to go and how to get there. He even remembered us later in the night when we checked back in -- they were doing a simple check for keys, which made us feel a lot safer --and he not only remembered us but remembered a joke we had made with him. Kudos to that fine gentleman. We also had a chance to dine in the restuarant. For breakfast, which was an excellent buffet, Mr Andjul helped us and was extremely friendly and an excellent host. A better server could not be asked for, save for Ms Alyson, who served us at dinner. Both made enjoyable small talk, recognized us when we came back, answered our questions, and couldn't have been nicer. Dinner was spectacular, and I couldn't more gladly recommend the creme brulee. Overall, we were blown away. The service was exceptional and memorable - hence why I can name names and give examples. The room was beautiful, the location excellent (it was only about 1/2 hour walk to anywhere we wanted to go) and the food fantastic. You couldn't find a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: edredw
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable. Good location near to Common and shopping. Quite expensive, but what really bothered me was all the potential extras. Fridge- $15, WiFi additional charges. The list goes on. I do expect to pay extra for certain things, but in this price bracket not everything. Would look for an alternative hotel nearby next time.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again for sure!!!”
Reviews.Author: mapp1
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel---everything that makes you love a hotel!! The location is great--about a block from The Commons, the Freedom Trail and the subway. Shopping is all around here too. The hotel itself is lovely and the staff is very helpful and pleasant. The concierge was especially helpful and great to talk to. The rooms are large with large bathrooms. They are very clean and well-decorated. There is a very nice cafe with a nice buffet for breakfast. It might have the buffet for lunch too but we were always out sightseeing at that time. And the price was right!! And-----one of the greatest and unexpected features about staying here is that there is a parking lot right across the street that is MUCH more reasonably priced than parking at the hotel. We rented a car for 4 days to do out of town sightseeing and this parking lot was wonderful---a great price for overnight if you are just out by 8am. The only negative is that my sister and I had specified separate beds and when we arrived very late, as they had been informed would be the case, they had only a room with a king bed. We got that straightened out the next day. YES, WE WOULD ABSOLUTELY STAY HERE AGAIN !!!!! WE COULDN'T ASK FOR ANYTHING MORE.

Reviews.Title: “An awful hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: eejvphd
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end, our stay in this hotel was abysmal. I was here for a conference the last week in June, and didn't have a say on where to stay, and was concerned about the reviews I read, but was hoping it was better than others thought. The most negative of the reviews were right on!! The first night, the a/c in the room was non-existent, and the room would not cool off. We called several times, and they told us to radically lower the thermostat, which had no real effect. We then asked to have a fan sent up, which they did after some time. We then asked the next night to have a different room, which was somewhat better, but we luckily kept the fan, or it wouldn't have been usable. The minibar in both rooms was set up so that you couldn't use it to store other cold items without being charged $25.00; even Red Roof Inn have usable mini refrigerators in their rooms! The problems continued - the conference I attended ran out of coffee after 1/2 hour, and the hotel, claiming to take care of this, did nothing until the 2nd day, at which time they still provided inadequate coffee. The hotel staff, other than one young man, were surly and ineffectual. To top things off, in the new room my wife opened the nightstand and found that someone had left a sexual device there! I couldn't make this stuff up! The cleaning staff obviously didn't do their job. We returned the sexual device to the front desk, and didn't receive any formal apology about this. Then after the second night, the comforter that was on the bed was taken, and when the room was made up, the comforter was never returned! 7 phone calls later, on the 4th day we were there, they finally brought a comforter, but it was a full size (the bed was a King), and it was wet! We returned that. For our hassles, the hotel did provide us a free dinner, but the restaurant had horrible service on the terrace, and the young waitstaff acted as though they had never waited on any customer before. I should also mention that the rooms were small. The pool was not handicap accessible, there were two staircases of 10 stairs each leading down to it, in a very inaccessible spot. There were no soda or snack machines anywhere on any floor. They charged 50 cents a minute for computer access in their "business" center. Once people found that out, they didn't use it, and it was empty, although the hotel employed a person to sit there and provide service (mostly fielding angry comments about the cost). They charged $ per day for wireless internet access, which is incredibly cheap. On check out, there were hassles with the hotel charging me several Massachusetts taxes, even though I had documentation that because it was a Federally Funded Conference I should not be charged state lodging taxes. Other people at the convention I attended had the same problem. The quality control at this Hyatt is obviously very subpar.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: KEMP527
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be overpriced for what you get. Our room was fine and had a partial view of the city. We gave our bags to the Bellhop-- took a full half an hour for him to get them upstairs, despite there being no other guests baggage at check-in when we arrived. We had to call down and ask for the bags to come up again. Beds were comfortable. The food in their downstairs restaurant (Avenue?) was ridiculously overpriced. The menu looked fun and creative, but when we got our breakfast, it was really just very typical hotel food.

Reviews.Title: “Sub Par, Find a Better Place!”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandBumpkin
Reviews.Content: The Good: 1. Gave us free toothpaste. 2. Room Size was decent for me and husband, ample counter space in bathroom 3. had a decent room view with good lighting 4. there was a jack for my ipod on the alarm clock The Bad 1. Cold, unplesant front desk. I knew I might have a problem checking in since my husband made the reservation and he wasn't with me yet. Policy is your name has to be on the reservation, ok fine I get that- but no need to be rude about it. The front desk girl literally threw her hands up in the air saying nothing she can do. Wow. I was also corrected when I asked where the "rooftop bar is" It is NOT a rooftop- it is a TERRACE ok.... 2. The hotel layout is confusing. You walk in and must go down about 8 steps with all your luggage (hard for a petite woman by herself) and nobody was there to assist. Then you go to one elevator to the lobby then to other guest elevators to get to your room. 3. The area isn't bad by the hotel, but it is not great either. I went for a walk and was turned off by the gobs of odd characters on the couple streets right next to hotel. Don't be fooled by the Mac and Macys next door - there is also this weird circus music playing which makes it feel more like a freak show. 4. This bothered me the most. All I wanted was a bottled water. We moved from a different hotel (just for change of scenery) called the Omni and they brough bottled room to your room everyday FOR FREE. Not the Hyatt. They don't have a vending machine either so your forced to buy their mini bar water for about 4 bucks each. Fine. We did but it make me SO mad. What happened to vending machines?! 5. I guess hotels are doing away with business centers since they charge people for wi-fi. The business center had 2 computers you need to pay to use. All in all I would not stay here ever again. I see much nicer areas very close by and it would be worth it to pay a little more. 6 At check in the girl asked why I blocked off a certain room. (I didn't but we booked through priceline so maybe they blocked it. Well I swear our room is next to a cleaning lounge- all day this room is soooo loud.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful result for a stressful situation.....”
Reviews.Author: jmmosholder1
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Boston recently as our adult son was having an operation at Tuft's Medical Center in Boston. We had researched which hotels near Tuft's had rates for families experiencing surgeries at Tuft's. There were a few but we chose the Hyatt. What an excellent choice! The room was just as ordered, two beds, one for our son and one for me. Very clean, the whole hotel is spotless actually (and I am picky). The staff is like none that I have seen recently and I travel quite a bit. Very very helpful in every way, the TV had some funky button thing wrong, they sent a technician that was professional, courteous and got the job done. The gym is a dream! Great place to get away from it all when in a big city like Boston. Nice location too, very eclectic, I liked that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: sienasinging
Reviews.Content: Great location to everything. We were able to walk to mostly everything.

Reviews.Title: “An Unforgettable Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie29609
Reviews.Content: When we decided to get married in a location that recognizes same-sex marriage, Boston, MA seemed the obvious choice: major airport, lots to do, and, very importantly, family ties to the area. As members of the Hyatt Gold Passport Program, we opted to explore what Hyatt properties could offer. We picked Hyatt Regency Boston because of the attractive photos on the website and because of the friendliness of the catering staff. Because we had not actually visited the hotel, we were nervous about our choice. Two months before the ceremony we made our first visit to the hotel to meet with Christine, one of the catering managers. Christine walked us through our options (there were many!) and together we developed a plan for the rehearsal dinner and the wedding ceremony. When we arrived at the Hyatt the day before the ceremony, Christine met us at the desk and throughout the event, took care of our every need. After the ceremony, our photographer made use of several locations on site, including the grand staircase, for wedding pictures. Because of the attentiveness, generosity, and kindness of the staff of Hyatt Regency Boston, our wedding wasn't just an event to remember. Instead, it was an UNFORGETTABLE one!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: CynBeth6
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from 7/5-7/10. We were on the 21st floor and liked our room. The hotel always smelled nice and looked clean. The staff we encountered were wonderful. We had 2 minor issues the day we checked in where our room keys did not work and someone had to come twice to fix the problem and there was a mixup where the person at the valet area left our luggage in the trunk of the car instead of bringing it up. Because of those things happening we were given a $150 voucher to use at the hotel restaurant. We liked all the meals we had at the restaurant and the 2 nights we did room service. We found the hotel to be pretty quiet as well. We had our dog with us and it is close to Boston Common so she had a nice place to do her business. A lot of attractions were in walking distance and sometimes if we were too tired to walk most cab rides cost about $10 from there. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: MaxxMontreal
Reviews.Content: Check your bill Pros: great location, room service pizza is excellent. Cons: starting to feel outdated, confusing entrance, very tall lumpy uncomfortable bed, heavy lumpy pillows, nickel and dime everything (sensor operated fridge which doesn't even refrigerate, gratuity automatically added to room service, no free wifi), useless cleaning staff (they swept crumbs under the ottoman), not enough water pressure, the gym is so far that you get your workout just getting there and back, very rude impolite staff (arrogant, and supervisors just as bad). I'm surprised they don't charge to use the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 4th of July weekend. We booked through expedia and we got a good rate. I must admit I was a bit disappointed in the overall stay. Front desk checknin staff was not cordial or hospitable at all. Our room was small unlike other reviews. We were on the 22 fl but no corner, so be aware all the rooms are not spacious. Location was good as we walked almost everywhere. So to sum this all up, this stay was just ok, nothing special. We would not stay here again, but liking or not liking this hotel really depend on your individual expectations in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unevenly OK service”
Reviews.Author: LovePlanAndTravel
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel last minute for 4th of July holidays/anniversary celebration for 1 night. To avoid dealing with additional charges, we selected "Balance" package that (according to Hyatt's website) included breakfast, valet parking for hybrid car, 2 reusable bottles and tot bag. When we arrived at the hotel, the front desk discovered that there is a massage session added to our package which they "have never seen in their lives". I guessed that it might've been because it is our anniversary but they had no idea and it was just for one person. We did receive an upgrade to a suite from a corner room - it was a great gesture by the front desk person but massage has never materialized as it had to be booked in advance with an outside party... The room was very nice and spacious with a good city views. Bedding is comfortable, bathroom amenities and towels of a standard Hyatt quality. Internet is $10 per day - even for Hyatt Gold program members. Buffet breakfast in the hotel - nothing extraordinary but good selection and good quality. Wait staff at breakfast - excellent! Dining at the only hotel restaurant was much better than expected. More on the gourmet side then your regular hotel restaurant dishes. Service in the restaurant - probably the best service in the whole hotel - very good! Health center: sauna did not work in the women's room, pool was overcrowded and had cold water, steam room - zero visibility (my husband slipped and cut his knee), no personnel at the pool or health center at all... Back to the "mystery massage package" - I ended up calling front desk who asked me how they can make up for the massage that never happened and offered a bottle of wine or champagne with a cheese platter. I selected the wine and an hour later they brought a bottle of wine with some fruits (not cheeses) and asked for a signature and asked (yes) for tips (suggesting to change a big bill we had). At check-out time - $60 charge appeared on our bill for room service - they did take it off when I related the whole story about "massage" to them, but the fact itself does not play in the hotel management favor. And we never got the reusable bottles and a tot bag that was originally included in the hotel package - they told us that "each location is different and we don't have any bottles for you"... Overall, the hotel staff seemed a bit clueless and unsure of how to serve customers. The location of the hotel is closer to Chinatown and Financial District. It is a walkable distance to the most attractions. Security within the hotel is not the best - if I was alone, as a female traveler, I would not feel safe entering the main entrance and then going to the 3rd floor on the elevator that did not have a secure hotel guest only card. If I had to stay in Boston again, I would pick a different place.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your bill when you check out”
Reviews.Author: martinphudson
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a typical city chain hotel. Reception staff were unfriendly with little or no personality, their English was not the best either! The buffet breakfast at $20 a head and self service was a joke. The food was poor, cold and unappetising, not even worth $5 a head! When we came to check out after our two night stay they added a $8 tip to our breakfast bill which they eventually deducted, having first found the card slip with no tip signed by me, not a good parting gesture. However it was when we arrived home. I found that they had charged my credit card with $329.62 so I sent an email to them. Two days later i received a reply and my account was credited.The email contained the following words by way of an apology 'You may rest assured the matter has been addressed with proper staffing to avoid future re occurrence'. We will, understandably, NOT be staying at this Hyatt or any other Hyatt in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk lady lied to me, so did the hotel manager”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Today is July 1st 2011. I had to download the app to my iPhone and write this review, because I was so upset that I was lied to by the front desk lady, as well as the manger. When I confronted them with their lies, they had the IQs to create more blatant lies. I stayed at the corner room on the 16th floor, it was. Good size room with 2 beds. I asked for another rollaway bed, I had done this at the Marriott Copley square hotel where the room was much smaller. The front desk lady ( extremely unpleasant) said 'no , it's a fire harzard'. I knew it was a lie, because Boston rules And regulations should applied go both hotels. I asked for proof of of the rules, she could not provide. Her manager called , he said it was not Boston reggulation, but hyatt's policy, however, this is a policy he can not show me ( a customer), when asked why a hotel has some secret policy which is not open to customer, he again changed to another story, saying something like the maid does not want to have a rollaway bed because it is too crowded. How strange? I told him this room is 30% larger than the one I stayed at the marriot Boston, if it was not crowded at the Marriott ( they always brought the rollaway when asked) , why it should be crowded at the Haytt? Here's his answer: ' you can go back to the Marriott' So for those of you who've traveled around, here's your taste of the professionalism at the Hyatt Boston. I am extreme upset, but this is the July 4th , leaving is not an easy option, my only choice is get on here to write my review.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, spacious room, friendly staff, good location..free wifi and other perks would have been nice!”
Reviews.Author: JK12311
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a business/family trip. I am pretty familiar with Boston and this location was excellent! Right by South Station for easy access to the airport or amtrak and right by the subway as well as in the heart of downtown boston so many things are within walking distance. Our room was very nice and spacious, I don't know how we lucked out, but they put us on the top floor in a corner room. The front desk staff as well as the concierage were all very friendly. We booked a decent deal on this room, would not have wanted to pay full price..but all decent rooms in downtown Boston are overpriced. I can't figure out why hotels don't all offer free wi-fi anymore..just seems like another way to nickel and dime customers especially when this hotel didn't come with any other perks like a free breakfast or even a reasonably priced breakfast ($20 for the buffet!). However, the pool and fitness center did help make up for this, both very nice, but the indoor pool was very cold and no hot tub..but the steam room was nice! But, I would definitely stay here again for the location, quality of the rooms and the staff. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: UsaLovestoTravel
Reviews.Content: The staff was great and rooms were clean and fresh! Thank you for the great hotel and i think it was worth the money i paid! I love the fitness center and believe it or not the Spa though needs updating I had a great massage!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, overall very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: inkwave17
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of a good rate offered and was very satisfied. First of all, the location is great - walking distance to almost everything in Boston, around the corner from the Boston Common and Downtown Crossing shops. The T is easily accessible, although to be honest we walked almost everywhere. The lobby setup is a bit annoying with all the different elevators but that was a minor problem. Public areas were nice although a bit tired looking. Business center was way too expensive for internet access and printing, which was not a surprise but still annoying. There was also a small shop onsite that had snacks and souvenirs which was nice when you just needed something small and didn't want to leave the hotel. The hotel bar/restaurant was adequate with friendly staff. The room itself was a good size with a nice view and an extremely big and comfortable bed. Plenty of space and everything was very clean and well-kept. I do agree with some other reviewers that housekeeping was a bit inconsistent. One day they restocked the amenities and included different toiletry items, folded the towels over - the next day only toothpaste was replaced, not the lotion or soap, and towels were not folded. Again, just a small thing but I think consistency would be good to maintain the brand since this is a fairly expensive hotel and part of what you pay for is service and knowing what to expect. The room service operator was very professional and my food arrived 20 minutes earlier than expected, which was great. Food was tasty, although very small portions. I had ordered the exact same items at another Hyatt property and received about 2x as much food. Again, consistency would be appreciated. On the plus side, I liked being offered late checkout already when I checked in due to my Hyatt Gold Passport membership. Nice to not have to ask for it! Overall, I would definitely stay here again and think the room comfort and location are great, even if there were a few small issues.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: S_foridaBeachbum
Reviews.Content: we were in boston for a wedding and spent two nights at the Hyatt. the hotel is very conveniently locate in the heart of the theathre district and china town. There were lots of the historical sites within easy walking distance. The rooms were really nice and the beds very comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful in fufilling every need taht we had.

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing visit being far below normal Hyatt standard”
Reviews.Author: audjon
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this Hyatt. As Gold Passport member I was so disappointed with the hotel standard as compared with those I have visited in Europe and other places in the world. I understand this is not a franchised hotel but actually owned by Hyatt. Paper cups for in room tea/coffee facility, no robes, no slippers bathroom extractor not working thus all mirrors steamed up.Unhelpful and bordering on rude front desk staff. Waiter requesting I retain the knife used for cooked breakfast to spread my marmalade on the toast!! Am I being picky - yes and why not at a cost of $2700 for six nights. I expect certain standards from Hyatt and this hotel is far below norm. We requested many times for the red indicator light on our phone to be extinguished without success. On our last night we eventually covered the phone with a towel. As we checked out our friendly light continued to wink at us as we left the room. Incidentally Mr. Foster (Guest Relations Manager)room 1024 on the 19th of June was being hoovered by housekeeping at 10.00 pm. We were in room 1026 the noise was definite disturbing. Message to Management " get a grip of this hotel standards" Take a trip to Europe and see how a Hyatt should be run and then send your staff, particularly "front desk" for a visit to Cologne,Dusseldorf,Hamburg, Mainz and Berlin all of which would put this hotel to shame. Finally the hotel is long overdue a total refurbishment and decorating. It's looking tired and scruffy. Sorry Boston but the answer to your obvious problems are in your own hands. Not a good reference fo your world wide organisation. Regards Mrs. Christian UK

Reviews.Title: “Service great; nickel&dime on amenities”
Reviews.Author: LVinWA
Reviews.Content: Service was exceptional and as business woman traveling solo: neighborhood felt safe if precautions taken (doorman usually around). Signage inside was poor (elevators going up/down? --a mystery). Slighted hotel on rating more b/c Hyatt policy than staff there: pay for WiFi, pay for music via TV, can't move anything in (sensor) mini-bar if wanted to bring in own beverage. Staying 2 nights for almost $800? Throw the Internet in as complimentary. I'd stay elsewhere next time at that rate; there's plenty of choices nearby. (Hyatt, review your policies if you want the business traveler.) Cleaning staff didn't refill toiletries, towel had someone else's makeup on it. Otherwise, superior service from staff!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: clarkbhm
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised at the number of reviews that spoke poorly of the hotel. I thought it was nice and enjoyed my stay. Here are some interesting points: 1. The front desk is on the 3rd floor. From the street, you have to go down a set of stairs to a small lobby and then take an elevator back up to check in. 2. Later in the evening, they don't let you access the hotel elevators unless you are a guest. Some Hyatt's accomplish this by requiring that you put your room key into a slot in the elevator. Here, they had an employee standing outside the elevator banks asking to see your room key. He was very pleasant and polite, but it continuously made me wonder whether they had a security problem. 3. The small conference room facilities are on the first floor as well and are adequate although not necessarily nice. The catered lunch included with the conference was quite tasty though. 4. Modern flat screen tvs in the room were appreciated as I could hook up my own dvd player. 5. Yes, wireless is not free, but that's standard for all Hyatt Regency hotels, not just this one. 6. The hotel is a short walk from the nearest T station, saving money when traveling from the airport. Overall, I enjoyed my visit and plan to stay here again when I return in July 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Scary late night”
Reviews.Author: LizBunny
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business at special rate of about $220/night. The self-parking in the garage underneath adds about another 30/night. The hotel is a bit run-down but OK (minibar appreciated), and was about a 20-minute walk from the convention center. The lobby is one level above street level and as a result, the street entrance at night, which is on a side street, is fairly desolate. They do not have anyone working the entrance at street level at any time of day. I took a cab back both nights around 11 PM and found no one at the entrance which was a little unnerving in a big city. As a woman staying alone I'd pick another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, police intervention?”
Reviews.Author: Jeffreylabombard
Reviews.Content: I don't know where the good service reviews came from. This place was possibly the worst hotel experience I've ever had. A co worker of mine and myself were just casually chatting in my room when security showed up and said they had received complaints. Complaints, plural? On two people? This was comical. Until this second time the security came, and said we were being evicted for excessive complaints. Since when does the word of some crazy neighbor mean eviction? I had to pack my bags and be escorted by security to speak with the manager, who talked down to me and didnt seem to care about my side of the story. Move my room if there was a problem, but dont threatened with police intervention when I state how ridiculous the experience was. This place is unprofessional to professional people and a horrible place to stay, I'm glad this happened because I will never stay at another hyatt again. Nice work customer service.

Reviews.Title: “poor housekeeping!”
Reviews.Author: HirK
Reviews.Content: At the first night, bath towel is missing, so I left a note. At the second night, everything is OK , so I let 5 dollars. At the third night, the room was not cleaned, so I left only two dollars, At the fourth night, unbelievably, the bath gel and treatment was missing, and my toothbrush and toothpaste were missing! I could not help that it was done on purpose!! I have never experienced such a poor housekeeping at so-called star hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the hotel and the location was great!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganLuke
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and the location was awesome. It was walking distance to all the major attractions. It was located right across from the Boston Commons. They even brought in a mini fridge for our daughter and a microwave to warm up her food. They provided a nice crib for her too. We would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but could be better”
Reviews.Author: SecretDane
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Prior to arriving I had applied for several types of standby upgrades, including the Business Plan upgrade. I discovered on arrival that I got the Business Plan upgrade. I received a letter from the front desk clerk informing me of what this included (internet, local and long distance phone calls, one breakfast daily, a bottle of water, etc). Boy was I glad I saved that letter. The staff at this hotel simply don't know what they offer. One of the days we went to breakfast. I had to argue with the hostess that I was 100% positive that one breakfast was indeed included on my room rate. And upon checkout I was told that long distance calls were not covered. I pulled out the letter to show the desk clerk that indeed they were covered. She quickly changed it and said that they had just changed what the business plan offered. Fair enough but then management needs to be better about communicating to staff about what is included in the rates. I don't want to have to go to the front desk to check out and get a corrected bill. I would rather have checked out online in my room. But this wasn't an option as the included charges had to be removed from the bill after the fact. Very annoying. Another annoying thing were the bellboys trying to hijack our luggage constantly. One bellman came over to my husband and TOOK his suitcase despite his protestations that he could manage it himself. It seems like they are simply desperate for tips. Or that's how it comes across to me. The location is good. The rooms were ok. But I wouldn't rate it high for cleanliness - I noticed an M&M on the carpet and it was still there the next day. Same for the gum wrapper that was near the chair. Bed slept ok though. All in all, I wouldn't say that it was a particularly good value for the money. And the management needs to get the staff to be more competent and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking Front Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrvlGrl
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 rooms for a group of friends. I had requested that all the rooms be close together and have king beds and was told that there shouldn't be an issue. When we arrived the front desk had difficulty finding the reservation and said that they had not held the rooms as promised. First they tried to tell me I had clearly made a mistake and I was at fault until I reproduced the email from the manager indicating my request would be honored. At that time they simply said well it's impossible now so here are your double bed rooms. Other than the front desk staff being very rude I would have to say the hotel is nice. The rooms are clean and spacious, but the double beds are very small. The location is great for site seeing. Easy to get to the Airport bus and the subway stations.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bunhun
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hyatt Regency Boston for a night and it was a good experience. We got early check-in into our room and we couldnt be more thankful for that. We got a room on level 5 and we was greeted with a pleasant scent along the corridor to our room. The hotel is conveniently near to the subway, less than 5 minutes walk. It is also very near to Chinatown and the

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hyatt Regency Boston”
Reviews.Author: HappyBostonVisitor
Reviews.Content: Great stay! The city is beautiful, hotel location was great, the room was clean and spacious! I appreciated the assistance, directions and site-seeing details provided by the staff. They were polite and friendly and were always available to provide assistance! Thank you for helping to make our first trip to Boston so special!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: argentofulci
Reviews.Content: Simply terrible service at this high priced, poorly managed establishment. The rooms are pretty standard fair, not bad. Be prepared to be nickel and dimed throughout your stay and dont bother trying to request or discuss anything with their incompetent staff unless you enjoy talking with people who could care less about hospitality. There are plenty of options in Boston, avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DCoady
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great as it is walking distance to everything in the downtown area. I was surprised that there was no useable fridge in the room to put your own things in. The fridge had 'sensors' in the fridge that would bill your room as soon as you took the bottle of water off the sensor. Not sure if this is true as I did not take the chance. The layout of the hotel is is a little odd as the check in lobby is on the 2nd floor and you had to take 2 different elevators to get out of the hotel. We stayed in a room that was near the open area of floors 10-13. This proved to be loud as you could hear people coming and going on the floors above and below you. Parking is quite expensive if you are using a car ($32/day). The staff was great and very friendly. The hotel was very clean and the staff did a great job with keeping your room clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice, depending on the deal”
Reviews.Author: AstroJunq
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is not the best hotel is Boston, but it is a very good choice, specially depending on the deal you get. Be warned that parking is ridiculously expensive ($43), but fortunately there are plenty of cheaper choices nearby. Wi-fi is also available and although at a reasonable price ($10), I believe it should be free for guests. The hotel itself is very elegant and roomy, I specially liked the 3-story atrium on the room floors. The room is is a high point: it is big enough, the bed is comfortable, the shower/amenities good and the TV/speakers/etc. are modern. The fitness and pool are also proper, albeit tucked away and hard to get to. I also experienced the room service and have to say that I quite enjoyed the food. What I still don't get are hotels that charge gratuity (18%) plus service fee ($4). The common sense should be one or the other, otherwise is a blatant extortion of the guest's money. The location is actually really good. Although not on the best of neighborhoods, it is very central, close to the park, major shopping, subway stations, and walking distance to pretty much anywhere around the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: tsheehan031
Reviews.Content: This is excellent hotel for tourist. Boston Commons is 2 blocks away, Hotel is in heart of theatre district, Beginning of Freedom Trail, Faneuil Hall Marketplace, mass transit, financial district, Macy's (attached to hotel), and Chinatown are all within easy walking distance. Clean, clean, clean. Charles Foster, Guest Relations Manager, is as good as it gets--consummate professional--what an asset to the hotel. Save on parking-- go to Central Parking website, select Millennium Garage coupon--less than a block from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for nearly any downtown activities...”
Reviews.Author: Italiana58
Reviews.Content: This hotel meets the high standards of cleanliness and comfort of a Hyatt Regency. The best feature is its location in the heart of the theatre district. The Boston Ballet is steps away, but one can also walk to restaurants, the Commons, the history walk, and plenty of shopping. I did not rent a car for this trip (I don't like driving in Boston!) but the subway was close to the hotel and of course, taxis are plentiful. The subway goes directly to Boston University and Boston College. It's a bit of a ride to BC, but its a direct trip and I find this area preferable than staying closer to the College. This hotel is also ideal if you are visiting a student at Emerson as its only a couple block walk.

Reviews.Title: “false advertising”
Reviews.Author: tamasGreenfieldMa
Reviews.Content: told one thing found it to be false.corner room at hyatt is not a room in the corner of hotel w/ two sides of glass like all other hotels nope but they charge extra anyway ,omg when we called ft desk to tell them of mistake we were told oh no thats our corner room sorry anything else we can help you with rude and short told us we made a mistake staying here. the next time in beantown its a corner room at the sheraton ,the w ,westin,lenox,or any of the other 25 hotels that have a room they advertise. at check out 6people in line and one person on the desk nice cust service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Service & Food!”
Reviews.Author: jimengel
Reviews.Content: The staff is very coureous and rooms were beautiful. Very few challenges of any kind. I was surprised how quiet it was at night. I was on 11th floor so that may have helped. Great location within walking distance of Theater District.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: luckyteacher
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 2 nights at the Hyatt Regency. I checked the tripadvisor reviews before we booked and was especially impressed that Charles Foster from the hotel had responded to previous guests's comments, both positive and negative. I had sent Mr. Foster a few emails asking questions about the hotel, and he responded in a courteous and prompt fashion. This prompted me to book this hotel. We parked in the self-park garage for $32 per night, and left the car the entire stay. The check-in was quick and courteous and Mr. Foster himself checked us in. He remembered our correspondence and upgraded us to a room with a nice view of Boston. The hotel is in a good location with shopping nearby (Macy's and many other stores) and is within walking distance to Fanueil Hall, Quincy Market, etc... The staff at the concierge bent over backwards to help us with sightseeing information, etc... We rode the trolley car for 2 days and hopped on and off at various sites. We especially loved the tour of Fenway park. We ate in a great Italian restaurant in Little Italy and had famous pastries from Mike's. The hotel is very clean and the rooms spacious and comfortable. The hotel has an indoor pool, but there was an extremely long walk down hallways and 3 flights of stairs to get to the pool. I was unable to do this walk, with bad knees and in poor health. I later found out that there is a service elevator that I may have used. This info is good for next time. One caveat, do not use the refrigerator to store personal items, they have sensors inside and are computerized. They will charge you for any item that is moved. All in all, I would recommend this hotel and will return in the future. Thanks again Mr. Foster!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good location...”
Reviews.Author: susan3589
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency Boston after getting it thru priceline for $90.00 per night. We really only have 2 complaints. 1) The walls are paper thin. You can hear EVERYTHING going on in the rooms next to you...and I mean EVERYTHING!!! 2) the pillows seemed very hard. I took one out of the pillow case and found it was hard because it was jammed into this very skinny case that was about 12 inches wide. I guess they were going for looks, not function! The location was very good for what we were in town for. We wanted to stroll around a bit and visit Quincey Mkt. It was very east to get to the hotel from the Mass Pike too!

Reviews.Title: “Almost a home run - so close that I would have given it 4.5 score”
Reviews.Author: nancyesca
Reviews.Content: I arrived early and they were kind enough to get me a room right away. May have been the luck of the draw - but kind. I had asked for a room with two double beds - as I had 3 days of business and then a friend was joining me. I was on the 7th floor - 2 floors above the lobby. At first I was disappointed being on a lower floor - but it worked. I would avoid the 6th floor only because the gym is on that floor and it is open extended hours - which may lead to more noise in the hallway. Speaking of the gym...the workout is getting there - LOL but really it is a great gym with a pool, state of the art gym equipment, steam rooms and really clean. The only misses were the housekeeping staff - they clearly do not read english - which I have no problem with - but they need to speak with their supervisor if they cannot read the note (and tip) I left. I wanted my window left cracked (it was closed) and I had asked for extra Decaf coffee. Also, I had requested turn down service each night - and it was only done 1 night. When I called - they were prompt to send someone quickly - and the turndown staff does a great job of refreshing the room and bathroom. Overall the hotel is in a GREAT location - centrally located - a quick walk from the T (several different T stations - Downtown Crossing, South Station, Chinatown and several others). Very close to Chinatown - attached to a Macys, near many theaters and near the Boston Commons. A couple of quick tips - great and inexpensive lobster at Peach Farm - Chinatown - close to a CVS and the concierge had great restaurant suggestions. I did eat at the Avenue one - the restaurant - the food was very good (lunch) and reasonably priced. I did drink in the bar and wish the red wine choices were more varied. Oh, and one more note: the weekdays the clientele was strickly business - the weekend is a WHOLE different (and louder) crowd - be forewarned

Reviews.Title: “Great place and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 2d2k
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights with our two boys. Very quiet hotel. Room was clean and staff were helpful. Close to all the attractions and 20 minute walk to the TD Centre to see a NHL hockey game.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Yleahcim
Reviews.Content: Had a redeye into Boston. I thought I would get rest on my flight. Did I? No because there was a baby that wouldn't stop crying. To make matters worse, I was sick. I opted to for the early check in and upgrade at check out ( if avail). As soon as I landed I headed to the hotel to see if I could check-in early bc I needed to take nyquil and rest. Trang at the front desk informed me that early check-in wasn't available, BUT she'd call me as soon as a room was available. She took my number down and I went to the nearby equinox to shower while I waited for my room. Low and behold, I get a call from the manager letting me know my room is available. There was also a PAX event that weekend. You get the point. Trang totally went out of the way to help me out. Trang has converted me from a Starwood loyalist to a hyatt costumer for life. When you're at your lowest point and someone is a human being, shows a lot. The whole hyatt staff was cordial except the Russian chick. The room: it's standard. But the hallway lightbulb went out, and their toiletries smell weird. I much prefer Westin's or W's bliss. The room was clean and the bed was heavenly. But Starwoods heavenly beds are always much better.Â

Reviews.Title: “Quite good - great location”
Reviews.Author: LassiComeHome
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of the city. Comfortable rooms, and I found the hotel to be very quiet. never used the restaurant so can't comment on that - there are so many great restaurants close by. The concierge was very helpful - she recommended an Italian restaurant in the North End which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not for light sleepers.”
Reviews.Author: PhineusFlog
Reviews.Content: I was given a room at the Hyatt Regency for a work event early the next day. Staying in the theater district/downtown on a weekend night isn't exactly conducive to getting a good's night's sleep, but I avoided the temptations and went to bed early. Or at least tried. Few places I've stayed at have been as loud as this place Slamming doors and people walking up and down the hallway were compounded by the fact that there is an atrium that allows noise from several floors to cascade up and down. I clearly heard my neighbor come in at about 2 a.m. and use the bathroom twice, and several co-workers were less than amused by their neighbors late night exploits in bed. You would think a place such as this would better soundproof their walls. Added to this is the $32 parking fee. At least my employer paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly service, if a little rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: awanless
Reviews.Content: We decided on the Hyatt Regency Finiancial District after looking at several air/land packages offered by AA Vacations, primarily because of proximity to all the T lines (you can walk to the green, blue, red, orange, and silver SL5 easily) and the price of the room. It's a great location if you plan on seeing a lot of the Boston area. The area immediately around the hotel is a mix of grit and glitz, with Chinatown and some rowdy clubs nearby, but it's also right next to a few theatres, the new Ritz-Carlton, and of course the Boston Common. The hotel itself is a slightly layout, and the lower lobby rather unimpressive. Upon arriving in the main lobby, the impression improves, but the reception areas of the hotel, once fresh, still look in need of update. Contrary to other reviews on this property, I found the staff friendly and helpful. The common areas and rooms in the hotel are very clean and smell fresh, and the room itself was well appointed. One bizarre omission is the absence of a mini-bar price list; we called to ask for one to be sent up, but were told that they do not publish one. The operator was able to provide the prices, which were appropriate. Overall, we found the room a comfortable retreat from touring the city and given the price were impressed. If you're looking for a true four-star experience, though, you might try another hotel; there are many others close by!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Poppins!”
Reviews.Author: Kkkkelly
Reviews.Content: Literally outside the door of the theatre where Mary Poppins is playing. In the Downtown Crossing area, near Chinatown and many other restaurants. Hotel is clean, staff friendly and helpful. Nice pool and 24 hr fitness center. Rooms are updated and comfortable. Docking station for my iPhone is a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “A greedy monster in the Financial District”
Reviews.Author: Juli Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt with my husband on a short stopover in Boston. Booked the hotel through priceline (you would think the experience would have at least been decent value for money...) Paid $105 for the room, but then an additional $43 +tax for valet and $10 +tax for internet! For $160 you can stay at the Omni, a much nicer 4 star establishment in the same neighbourhood. The Hyatt is of a monstrous size, feels worn and hollow. The room was a little shabby with chipping paint in places and banged up furniture. Our heating was not working when we first arrived (a cold January night), the window was leaking whatever little heat was in the room. Someone came to fix it shortly after we called down. Once it was fixed he asked us not to touch the controls. The vent kept turning on and off all night, making a lot of noise. Our king bed was very high up and had a feather bed on top of the mattress, which made it too soft. I felt like I was floating all night. The pillows on the other hand were too hard. The location was ok, but too far to walk to Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market area, where parking is once again outrageously expensive. The last time I was in Boston I stayed at the Omni, closer to the market and North End where there are tons of great restaurants and shopping. The omni staff was fantastic and they brought up complimentary fresh juice/coffee/hot chocolate in the mornings. Will go back there next time. Never again to the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well kept rooms”
Reviews.Author: EarnyinLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night and the hotel is in the same building as a Macys. You can get there by taking the Red/Orange line and getting off the Downtown Crossing stop. There are many places that are in walking distance such as Fanneuil Hall and Boston Common. The room was clean and in good shape and up to date with a LCD tv. Parking is pretty expensive at 12 dollars an hour and over 30 a day. Overall this is a good place to stay in Boston as it is close to subways and local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: stgregorygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for New Year's Eve. I had booked it through Priceline. I was somewhat disappointed when I learned this was the hotel I had won. Fortunately, the hotel was better than I expected. My primary objection to it was the location. I had been hoping for something in the Copley Square area. It was, however, much better than I expected. We were given an excellent room on one of the top floors. From our room, we could see the early evening fireworks on the Boston Common. That was an unexpected plus!! The bed, linens, and overall cleanliness was excellent. The room was very quiet with good air circulation. I don't normally sleep well in hotel rooms but this one was great. On the negative side, the entrance to this hotel isn't the best. You have to take the elevator up to the lobby. Once there, it is a little bit small and could use some updating. The area where the hotel is located is fine but not the best part of Boston. You are close to the Boston Common and the theater district but the better shopping is in Copley Square.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Seemann11
Reviews.Content: In general a very good hotel, great room, good location, wonderful pool and steam room. But be aware, if they give you a room with a connecting door you can forget about silence. The guy next door was just talking by phone and I heard him as if he was talking into my ear. they write everywhere in the hotel that you should keep silence. But instead of that they would need just to take care of the good noise insulation between the rooms. Another minuses were no sleepers for the pool, no keys in the pool lockers and several other detail. Well nevertheless in general we enjoyed our stay here, but it could be much better, usually you get better quality and service in Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T BE LURED BY THE HYATT NAME OR THE 4 STAR RATING”
Reviews.Author: Mainewanderer12
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel. The room was quiet and clean. That's the only positive. The concierge was horribly uninformed in every way. The front desk was unresponsive. The lobby is sterile and noisy. The bed was way too soft. There are no safes in the rooms. The sauna was out of order and the locker room needs an immediate overhaul. The food in the restaurant is below average. The place gives a general impression that no one is in charge. We were charged for items in the minibar that we never consumed. Extra cost for wifi. And apparently they treat their employees badly. There were pickets outside. 4 Star? No way.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: bluephlash
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on Priceline, and I was really excited because it's RIGHT downtown, and a block from Downtown Crossing station. The inside of the hotel is nice enough, although weirdly laid out. The lobby is on the 3rd floor, and you have to take an elevator from the street level to get to it. This wouldn't be so strange, except for the fact that the elevators to the rooms are on the other side of the lobby. If the elevators were all the same, it would be fine. The rooms were nice, pretty large for downtown, and had great views. I could see the state house clearly from my room. The bed was crazy comfortable, I think it was a featherbed. I just wanted to sleep all day. The only problem with the rooms, and this is a big one, is that the walls are VERY thin. We could hear our neighbors talking, watching tv, even coughing in their room. Which made me wonder what they could hear from our room. Definitely a big minus.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic First Night 2011”
Reviews.Author: goiania123
Reviews.Content: We just returned after a 1 night stay at the Hyatt Regency/Boston for New Years Eve. I could not have customized a better location if I was given the opportunity. The hotel is located in the middle of the theatre district, steps away from the Boston Common where a lot of the 1st Night activities were being held. The hotel is also located steps away from downtown crossing, a major shopping area in the city, and a 10ish minute walk to the waterfront/quincy market area. I would say this hotel is a 3.75, though the staff would get 5 stars, Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. The hallways are really bright, as is the color scheme of the rooms. Our room was on the 18th floor with views of the Common and State House. The room was immaculate and the beds were super comfortable. There was an LG flatscreen TV..I would guess 37-40 inches?? The bathrooms are a good size, pretty decor and the closets are large too. There was a well stocked fridge with snacks/soda/beer/nips etc....though the price was a little high for all the items. We didnt touch it, but did go to the lobby gift shop for drinks, which were less expensive than in the room. We went to the pool, which was a good size(rectangle). The fitness center had plenty of equipment (though to get to both was a small workout..down a long hallway and couple flights of stairs) We ate dinner at Avenue One. The food was delicous, the wait staff was superb. In addition to the regular menu, there is a childrens buffet filled with chicken tenders, burgers, mac and cheese, veggies, apple sauce etc....fantastic idea for those with children as children tend to be picky eaters. I read comments before going about the layout of this hotel. I didnt find anything to be unusual, except possibly the pool area, but I was just happy to have a pool area! I also read comments about the smell in the common areas. I did notice this (a clean smell) and actually spent more time than I should have trying to figure out what scent it was! Valet parking was a breeze and they do also have the option of self parking. All in all, our "1st Night" out was wonderful. I will definately be back at the Hyatt Regency in the future. If your planning a trip there, do not go by the wesite directions. Use a GPS or mapquest. Also, if you plan to dine there, dont use "Open Table" on the website. I tried and it stated no tables were available within 2 hours of the time I wanted. I called and ws told they could accomodate us. When I arrived, the restaurant was 1/2 empty. Im sure "Open Table" is hurting their business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mbetesh
Reviews.Content: loved our stay.. hotel very accommodating with the kids...attached to macys...great staff..paid a little more for upgrade to a suite with separate bedroom/living room

Reviews.Title: “Not very customer oriented”
Reviews.Author: tiborgh
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel started on a bad note: after learning that internet access is an extra $10, I took the bullet and paid for it (this is not the only place to charge for WiFi). But my surprise came when I found that only one device can be connected to the T-mobile hotspot at a time. I wasn't happy to log in and out between my phone and laptop for the rest of the day. T-Mobile customer service (the provider of the WiFi signal) advised me that the hotel management sets the pricing policies, therefore I should discuss the issue with them. The advise I got from the front desk was to buy an other $10 day pass if I want to have both devices connected simultaneously, which sounded ridiculos to me. I know it wasn't a straightforward issue, but the way they chose to handle it left me with a bad impression about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: mamaanna
Reviews.Content: The lobby is in repair and the hotel is very dated and dark. The layout is a little quirky too. It was okay, but wasn't great.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: MermaidFlorida_USA
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure it was to stay at the Hyatt Regency Boston. The room was beautiful and the location was perfect. We walked to Boston Gardens and got to enjoy watching our grandson chase the squirrels. In the evening we walked to the Boston harbor waterfront and had a glass of wine. We then walked to Quincy Market and enjoyed a fabulous dinner at the Todd English restaurant. This hotel is a wonderful base for exploring Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to spend the week!”
Reviews.Author: explorer1421
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency through an RCI exchange week. The place was great. Very friendly and helpful staff- from the check in with Kyle to the doormen that were always ready to give directions and assit. The location is great. Three minute walk to the Chinatown T station and Downtown Crossing station. From the airport took the silver line to south station and then walked up to the Hyatt- probably a eight min. walk. The room was nice. The workout room and pool were great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Area”
Reviews.Author: Indybindy
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - clean and comfy beds (cleanliness is a MUST for me), centrally located to many good little pubs, restaurants and shops - Macy's is right around the corner. A car is not needed - we walked everywhere we wanted to go, or took the trolley bus tour ($38 per person) where we could get on and off at whatever site seeing stops we wanted to - we could either walk back to the hotel or wait for the next trolley to come. In most cases we just walked back to the hotel because it was walkable (and I have bad knees) and SOOOO many things to see on the way back; the tour was good for two straight days. We ate breakfast (buffet) one morning in the hotel restaurant; I loved the food (my husband thought it was just o.k. - but I loved it). I loved the atmosphere of the restaurant and the the workers were friendly and attentive. It would have been nice if free internet service had been provided in the lobby (common area) like many other hotels have; it would have been helpful to search and map out restaurants and other things of interest. It was like $5.00 for each 10 minutes of use, which I thought was extravagant. Anyway, we got the hotel at a SUPER PRICE so I can't complain. We had never been to Boston before and we loved it - we were surprised that it was such a crowded, busy city; people everywhere and the brick/cobblestone sidewalks/streets were so quaint. We stayed 3 nights but I wished we had stayed longer but we were on a 3 city trip staying 3 nights in each city - Portland, Maine; Boston and New York City. The Hyatt - being so clean, having comfortable beds and being centrally located helped up enjoy our visit even more to this very interesting and pretty city. (Tip: The Hyatt is close to Washington Street - which is very busy and filled with shops, restaurants, etc. and with side streets that lead off to more restaurants, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: BEYLHR
Reviews.Content: spacious room, not the most modern decor or furniture but in great condition, good value for the money. you wont get much of a view but not a deal breaker. the area was excellent, 5 minute walk to quincy market, the waterfront and other locations on the freedom trail. macys is right around the corner and so is lots of other shopping. subway station is a 2 minute walk down the street. not much options for dining at night (past 9:00). definitely take the subway from and to the airport its only a 5 minute walk from the hotel, not worth paying 35 for a cab. take the subway to newbury street, very nice street you must visit.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Concierge Makes Great Hotel Stay Even Better”
Reviews.Author: NancyClareAtl
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Hyatt while visiting colleges with my high school senior. Never been to Boston before and chose to use the Metro as a good experience for her to have. Also worked in as many historical tours as possible. Anthony, the concierge with the islands accent, made the whole visit easy and fun. After following his instructions the first day, we lost any "fear factor" of navigating around and came to rely on his advice on tackling the original tea party city. He will be part of our happy memories of this trip. The hotel was great. Fantastic location just two blocks from the Commons and the jumping off point for Freedom Trail. Room and bed very comfortable. Ate in the restaurant twice it was so good (OK, a little on the salty side, but still very good.) I got a great price on Priceline, which is why I rated the value so high. It was worth much more.

Reviews.Title: “CENTRAL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: fifitrixibelle_10
Reviews.Content: Very central Location. Reception Staff not very helpful could do with some customer training skills. Door and Conceirge Staff all very helpful and friendly. Rooms adequate small but clean. Night life very sparse as it is based in Theatre District so had to go looking for decent pubs restaurant in hotel ok if a bit overpriced. I would recommend the hotel for it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, minimum amenities”
Reviews.Author: idimport
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for business. It was in a great location, close to the theater district, shopping, etc. There is only one restaurant and a very small bar in the hotel. It would have been nice to have additional options. There were restaurants close by, but again, it would have been nice to have had the convenience of additional dining places. The fitness center was so so. I was very disappointed that there was a charge for internet. When paying the price we paid per night, that should have been included in the room cost. Great concierges.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: steviec1211
Reviews.Content: NIce hotel.Good staff, rooms comfortable, roomy and clean. Location is excellent. Right next door to Macys, across from Boston Common and within walking distance of Chinatown & the Theatre district. Bit of a nuisance having to use two seperate lifts to get to the exit but you get used to it. Did not have breakfast in the hotel but can recommend the Boston Common Coffee house across the road. Good Coffee and Breakfast pastries. Good restaurant for a quiet evening meal. This hotel is much frequented by Airline personnel which is a good sign.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our stay in and around Boston”
Reviews.Author: traveller186314
Reviews.Content: After seeing a few negative comments I did have reservations about our stay. But we found check in very friendly and efficient. The whole hotel was clean to my high standards, the bed was AMAZING, the breakfast kept us going all day and what noise were people experiencing we heard none. We cant wait to come back and would encourage anyone to stay here. By the way Macys could not be nearer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: tut124
Reviews.Content: This had a great location really close to everything. We easily walked to everywhere from Chinatown to Boston Public Gardens and freedom trail. The beds were way better then other Hyatt Regencys in other cities which tends to have two sheets and a comforter. Their beds were super soft and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: glrintreasurelake
Reviews.Content: We are pretty picky about where we stay, and we were very pleased with this hotel. Room was exceptionally clean with nice clean carpeting. The bed was so comfortable we didn't want to get up. We did not hear any noise whatsoever from the hallway or the rooms adjoining ours. Great shower! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay downtown, and will definitely return myself. Very, very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but good location”
Reviews.Author: richvabrew
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week for business reasons and only got one really good night's sleep. The doors on the guest rooms are extremely loud when they shut and I could hear the folks around me in other rooms. Since Chinatown is so close, I understand that this is the hotel of choice after a night of clubbing. It is in a very good location and the staff was extremely attentive. The steps going down to get to the registration area was no big deal, odd ...but was told it was for safety reasons. The breakfast was delicious, Deirdre makes a great omlette. Not sure I would stay here again until they replace the doors with something more quiet.

Reviews.Title: “For $140, we get a double queen size room with a living room, which we think can stuff in 6 people”
Reviews.Author: ivonmx
Reviews.Content: This HYATT is only 15 mins drive to Boston Aquarium, for $140, we get a double queen size room with a living room, which we think can stuff in 6 people. The bed the super cozy and I like the decoration style! The front desk is very helpful, they will provide you extra useful information for your hole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comortable beds in Boston's Theatre District”
Reviews.Author: LoulouQC
Reviews.Content: We snagged this for $150 per night on Priceline, which was actually a considerable discount versus the rack rate. Parking was very expensive, in the neighbourhood of $30 per day. A word to the wise - park at Boston Common Garage because on weekends after 4pm on Friday, they have a rate of $11 per day until Monday morning. I believe this is also the evening rate. The hotel itself was very nice and quite well-located. It is located in the midst of the Theater District and all of downtown is within walking distance. The nearast subway station is about a 5 minute walk away, so no need for cabs. The beds were amongst the most comfortable I've ever slept on in a hotel. The pool area was nice, although the water was a bit cold and the sauna was closed for repairs. While we were there, they were replacing all of the TVs on our floor with flatscreens. Unfortunately, they didn't make it to our room before the end of our stay. Next time! If you can get a good deal on this hotel, I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: drmacab
Reviews.Content: We stayed both at this hotel & another 4-star downtown hotel. The Hyatt was amazing! The rooms were a nice size, service was wonderful & parking was prompt. We did vallet parking b/c the price was about the same as self-parking. They were always ready to pick us up, no waiting. Very polite staff. Clean rooms & lobby. Great location, we walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Boston center”
Reviews.Author: vee91
