Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency is just a sophisticated business hotel is the middle of downtown Boston that also caters to families. Take advantage of the great room service, fitness center, incredibly comfortable beds and prime location close to shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as ...”
Reviews.Author: GaiaGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: On our leisure trip to Cape Cod , we relied on Hyatt as we usually do , for our trips within the States . I am a Hyatt "afficcionado" (San Francisco Hyatt Embarcadero , Chicago Hyatt Regency) , but although the quality and attentiveness of service remains untouchable , this particular Hyatt lacks a good Restaurant (Avenue One is a poor solution) and a proper Fitness Center (Good Lord ! So many stairs and hidden corridors to get there ! ...) . The service remains attentive and friendly/polite : Kindly , the receptionist upgraded us (me & Isabel) from the Corner Suite to the Lafayette suite , with a fantastic view over Boston Downtown .

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: RackWeaver
Reviews.Content: I did not chose the hotel, nor did I have to pay for my stay; In Boston for a meeting, I was chagrined by the negative reviews, but I found the Hyatt to be quite nice. The beds are comfortable, bathrooms adequate, they just upgraded the tv sets to LCD flat screens, the windows open a bit, the rooms are a decent size. The only noise I was ever aware of was water noise when someone took a shower. The hallways are bright and cheerful, and there is a 4 floor triangullar open space outside the elevator lobbies that really opens the space up. Yes, you have to go down 4-5 steps from the street, but the doormen are more than willing to help you with your luggage down those few steps (and no, they do not expect a tip). Check-in was efficient and friendly (thank you, Julia). Abdell, a young man from Morocco, is a great asset to this hotel at the front door. I found the staff to be uniformly pleasant and helpful. The location is really great - its a 15 minute walk to Copley Square, a 15 minute walk to the North End, and a 2 minute walk to Boston Common and the Public Gardens. Keep in mind that there is a ton of stuff to see during your 15 minutes of walking. I ate in the restaurant on 2 occasions, once having a steak and cheese sandwich which was one of the best I've ever eaten, and one having the clam chowder, which was delicious. The food was pricey, but very, very good. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service Nightmare--Motel Service in 4-Star Clothing”
Reviews.Author: SoxTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I'm a Bostonian, and I've had to find a hotel to live in while my home is being renovated. I needed a hotel I could stay in long term, so I stayed in a few different hotels until I found one that could make me feel comfortable, like home. This hotel had the worst service of all the Boston hotels I tried in that time period. The day I arrived, my companion and I were tired, so we decided to have a little bit to eat and some drinks in their restaurant, I can't remember the name, but it's the one by the lobby. The service was miserably sad. The hostess, who was holding menus, asked if we were here for dinner. I said yes. She told us to seat ourselves and never gave us menus. I thought she might follow behind us with menus, but they never came until we requested them. The service was incredibly slow even though the restaurant was mostly empty. It took us 20 minutes just to get water and we only received it after we asked for it. The drinks took nearly 30 minutes to arrive. I watched two people hold our meals and look around at tables for at least 10 minutes. They put the meals down, walked away, walked back, looked at tables, looked at the computer. I tried to make eye contact, and indicate that they were looking for my table, but it was useless. The food eventually made it to my table cold. I knew we couldn't expect to keep drinking at this place, and we were too tired to find someplace else on a Friday night, so I decided to go to the room, and invite a few friends over for drinks. I thought just one friend was coming, so I ordered 2 bottles of cava and 3 glasses. My friend called, and said she would bring her boyfriend, so I called room service back to see if I could add an additional glass to my order. I was told that it had not left yet, so the extra glass would be added. About 15 minutes later, my cava arrived with only 3 glasses. The person who brought it said that she would be right back because she forgot a wine bottle opener. I told her we don't need a wine bottle opener for cava, but that we had ordered 1 extra glass. She told me she would bring it right up. My friends arrived and started drinking. Over 20 minutes later, I still had no fourth glass. I called room service, who told me it would be there right away. 15 minutes later, I still had no glass. I called guest services, who told me they would send me a glass. 15 minutes later, there was no glass. I called the night manager, who told me they would send a glass. 15 minutes later, after an entire bottle was finished, a man knocked on my door, shoved a glass into my hand so quickly that I almost didn't catch it, and took off without a smile or even a glance in my direction. I called the night manager to say that it had arrived, but that I was entirely disappointed with the service this evening. The manager said that there was nothing she could do, but that she would have someone call me and apologize the next day. I never received any sort of apology for this horrible evening. The next morning, I had forgotten to put the privacy sign on the door, so when housekeeping came around and knocked, it was no surprise. We were already up and getting ready for brunch, so it was not an inconvenience. My companion answered the door and said that we were not quite ready to leave. The housekeeper rolled her eyes, and asked when we would be gone. I was shocked. It wasn't like we were staying over check out time, I had two more nights here. I started to wonder if we had been blacklisted for complaining the night before. After this, I decided to limit my use of the hotel services as much as possible. I ordered breakfast the next morning. It arrived, and I was setting it up, when the server returned to my room because he had given me a plate that belonged to another hotel guest. So I suppose he just exchanged the plates because my eggs were returned to me cold and overcooked. I just ate them because I came to realize that a request to correct a problem is of no use here. The next morning, I stuck to a continental breakfast, which arrived on time and warranted no complaints. As for other issues, I really donâ€™t think they are worth commenting on after all the service concerns, but Iâ€™ll mention them quickly. The dÃ©cor was pleasant. The bedding was comfortable, but I found the pillows to be too tough. The comforter was shedding feathers, but they were very soft feathers. The restaurant menu was unappealing. In general, the food is named by the method of cooking and the protein. I would normally have cared that I was eating at a place with a menu that you might find at a truck stop, but I couldnâ€™t even care about that with the service issues. If I had even had mediocre service, or if management had made any effort to correct this horrible experience, I would have given them a higher rating, and I would have felt like I could recommend them to others. However, it was horrible to be committed to staying in this hotel, and I will never put myself in that situation again, and I certainly would never advise a friend to be stuck there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jasejase
Reviews.Content: After securing this room on priceline, i was a bit nervous after reading some of the TA reviews! However, we had NO problems at the Hyatt! First of all, there is an elevator that takes you from the street level to the lobby. Then another elevator that takes you up to the rooms. Some people were complaining about this feature, but this is becoming more and more common in larger hotels. It also adds an element of security to your stay. One evening as we were walking from the main elevator to the guest elevator, a stationed Hyatt employee stopped us, and asked to see our room card before boarding the guest elevator. A comforting touch nonetheless. Check in was a breeze. Got the room we requested, and everything was smooth. Julia at the desk was extremely nice and courteous. When we got up to the room (10th floor), the room halls were very cool. Its interesting how they designed it. Blocks of 4 or 5 floors are kind of exposed.. you can look up once you get off the elevator and see the other floors (or down). it has a eurpoean/bavarian forest type of feel in a way! it was kind cool, and unexpected. The room was very clean. The bed was VERY soft. the LCD tv was brand new. the view was even decent. we self parked ourselves... (i believe this was $32 for the single weekend day/night we stayed for). From what i read on the website, i think valet at the hotel, was $42. the parking garage is extremely convenient. at about midnight we ventured to the bar at the hotel.. not a seat remaining. There are tables that are seat yourself to the right of the bar, that are staffed by waiters. we sat and looked at a menu for a late snakc as we just had gotten back from fenway, and decided the late night menu wasnt exactly what we were looking for. Not to mention in the 10 minutes we were there, no one approached us. So we went to Dylan and Max's... about 3-4 minutes down the street. cool, low key bar. Great bar food! The location of the hyatt is interesting. It's suprisingly convenient. The T is really close. The Common is a block away. You are just a block or two from Chinatown section, and you are 'in' the financial district. In my opinion, this isnt really the financial district. We usually stay at Club Quarters. IMO, THAT is the financial district. The Hyatt is more on the fringe i would say. it took about 10-12 minutes to get to fanuiel hall, etc. not too bad. There are stores very close by (dunkin donuts, cvs, tons of retail). I must add that they were SOLD OUT (overbooked actually) the night we stayed... And we had no service issues, nor did we hear anyone else through the walls, floors, ceilings, etc. we had no complaints! The Hyatt's reputation here MAY BE what's hurting it the most. The hyatt is known for its plush accomodations and catering to the higher end. Im thinking this could be it's downfall on the review boards in many instances. We rated the hyatt as very comparable to the other 3.5 to 4 star hotels we have stayed at in Boston and NYC... Clean. Comfy, and conveneint. We really saw no issues!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay here - concierge and bellboy staff make it standout”
Reviews.Author: roos1ter
Reviews.Content: Considering I was alone on business I wasn't expecting much, but the concierge and bellboy staff really made this standout - friendly, helpful, polite, down-to-earh - they should all be rewarded highly by the management staff - front of house are so important! Other pluses were the location - great for Chinatown and a short stroll into central Boston. Room also fine, and very quiet, with no intrusion from staff or other visitors. I agree, however, it is a pain to get 2 elevators to get to your room, especially when in a hurry! Free cookies in the lobby a nice touch - recommended - no need to go anywhere more swanky.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danaby2612
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice location with lots of attractions in walking distance such as the Freedom trail. The beds are extremely comfortable and got 2 good sleeps in the 2 nights I got in the hotel. The hotel has a good swimming pool and gym and also a sauna and steam room. The hotel has an outdoor deck which is lovely for sun-bathing. Breakfast was very good and it also has kind staff. The rooms are large but also cozy at the same time, and the bathroom is nice aswell. Great hotel! Keeping up the Hyatt reputation for me.

Reviews.Title: “horible service no help at all from the staff”
Reviews.Author: bb0880
Reviews.Content: I was excited at first then after spending a few hours here the whole thing changed. First of all the walls are super thin. You can hear everything,from ice machine to your neighbor. Also there is no free internet. I needed to do my work so had to pay for it. After paying realized signal is to weak and making work impossible. Front desk was of no help and did not offer any solution. I asked for a different room, but no luck. I spent all night in the lobby working. This is a very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not Hyatt Standard”
Reviews.Author: lovemustang
Reviews.Content: Beds were terrible, mattress sagged. Room needed lightbulb. Housekeeping fair. The public space are lacking, the Ave One is a joke-hot, poorly decorated. A big disappointment

Reviews.Title: “Everything went well until the day we left”
Reviews.Author: Reservationless
Reviews.Content: I just joined Trip Advisor and felt strongly enough to go back to last fall to comment on a disappointing experience at this hotel. As a Platinum awards member, I used points to get a free night and then paid out of pocket for second night to make an inexpensive get away weekend to Boston. In our rush to check out Sunday, we left four nice articles of clothing in the closet, including a leather jacket and a $250 pair of women's slacks purchased the day before on Newbury Street. The tags were still on. (You know where this story is going...) Anyway, we were literally on the Mass Pike westbound not even at I-84 when we called the front desk. We were immediately transferred to Housekeeping and begged the supervisor to go to the room herself and grab the items. She called us right back to say that the room had already been serviced and that no items were reported in the room and there was nothing in lost and found. We were so mad we almost drove the car into a ditch, and if we didn't have a time commitment we would have turned around and created a scene in the lobby to be remembered for the ages. So we went through the machinations of dealing with hotel security, filing reports, etc. etc. all for naught. They dealt with us politely but corporately like they were reading responses to our pleas off of well worn index cards. For them you know this sort of thing happens everyday, but for us we just felt burned so badly. Oh - so you want to know about the hotel? Yes, great location, easy access, tired rooms and amenities, forgettable decor, robotic staff. But congratulations to the Hyatt employee who is walking around with a great pair of designer slacks and my leather jacket!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, filthy room, cockroach in bathroom, terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: femalenomadtraveler
Reviews.Content: This was a shocking experience for a hyatt, or any other hotel for that matter. I had rude encounters with the staff on check in, checked into my room, the carpet was soaking wet, I changed rooms, the new room didn't have towels in it, there was a live cockroach in the bathroom, I had to wait longer than 30 minutes to have towels brought to my room, all this with no apologies from staff, I was exhausted from my travels, and to tolerate this at over 200.00 a night, I expected so much more from Hyatt, but I guess the name doesn;t really mean much, not like the Four Seasons name, etc. Unbelieveable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Below average for the price range and not stretching to improve”
Reviews.Author: RhysA
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be below average for the price range. One particularly annoying part is they have no safes in the rooms, yet their front desk safes seem to be designed for jewelery or something and cannot even fit a laptop or iPad. So if you have valuables, you have no option except to carry them with you or leave them with the Concierge (including typical wait to drop and to pick up). You need to take an elevator to get to the lobby off the street, and there are steps in between the city and this lift but not always a bellman. So the hotel is nothing terrible but I definitely cannot recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing. What does 'four star' count for nowadays?”
Reviews.Author: boyfromhungry
Reviews.Content: We got the Hyatt for around $200/night via Priceline's bidding system. We thought it would be terrific as it was rated four star and was located right next to the Boston Opera House (we only went to Boston to see a performance there). I should also mention we'd never been to one of the big chains of hotels. The lobby was clean, the room was kept neat, the front desk was efficient, the doormen were great. Three strikes for us: No free internet. We're budget travellers, and have yet to find a budget hotel, B&B or hostel that does not provide either a dataport, in-room or lobby wifi, or even a ratty old PC in the corner with communal web access. The Hyatt wanted $10 per day to access the internet. At $200/night, we felt we'd paid enough. The Concierge was brusque and not very helpful with our dining enquiries. Perhaps we caught her on a bad night. Perhaps she just did not understand that, unlike some, we wanted to have a say in the cuisine offered by the restaurant rather than 'just anywhere with seats'. The Financial District is dead at night. It's good for some, as it's close to touristy things during the day (Boston Common etc) but it was not for us. After our first night there, we went back online and found the nearest budget hotel. Hotel 140, in the Copley Square district, turned up for about $150/night including taxes. My god what a difference that made. All the cleanliness and great front desk of the Hyatt, with rooms that were just as functional and comfortable (the lack of a minibar and a desk covered with ads for additional fee services did not phase us) plus a coin operated laundry, much faster elevator service and, oh, FREE INTERNET. The Hyatt appeared to us to represent the standard of large chain hotels. We've learnt that we are not chain hotel people, and will look elsewhere from now on. It hit average right on the button. I would recommend this for the larger group that can get a discount, the business traveller who sleeps from 1800-0800 or anyone on a tour. For the self-guided, you can find the essential 'four star' amenities for a much better price elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - Hotel a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: WhirlwindTravel
Reviews.Content: It's a 4 star hotel, which really should be 3 stars. The hotel is located very well; a short walk to just about every site in Boston. The rooms are a bit dated and in need of refurbishment. But comfortable. Nice views from the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: johnniewalker83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2009 for a 3-day weekend trip. The hotel itself is built in 4-floor sections, so every floor is part of a 4-floor open mezzanine concept. This definitely adds to the charm of the place. The room is very clean, the bed very comfortable, the bathroom clean and adequate. Our room was high up and offered a view onto the bay. The hotel concierge was very helpful in suggesting things and places to visit, as well as giving us an idea of what could be done in a short amount of time, and where the best places to visit were. Very helpful especially with a city map and pointing out for us all the places we wanted to visit on the map. The hotel's location was much better than we first expected. Its just a couple of blocks away from Boston Common, about a 20 minute walk from Faneuil Hall and Quincy Marketplace, and 20 minutes the opposite way towards the Prudential Tower and the Back Bay area. Parking on-site was adequate and safe, and more reasonable than other hotels we consulted in the area. The pool was alright, though the water was a bit cold to my liking. The best suprise was the breakfast at the restaurant. The buffet selection had everything you could expect, fruit, cereals, omelettes made to order in front of you, french toast, meats etc. The service was impeccable, and the waitress even gave us a container to take a few things for the road as we were returning home that day. All in all, this hotel was a great place and made our first stay in Boston that much more memorable. It deserves much better ratings than offered here, and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and shabby”
Reviews.Author: Tayt0
Reviews.Content: We stopped two nights in Boston at the end of a US trip and picked a Hyatt hotel at random as I expect them to be of a good standard. We found the Hyatt Regency Boston to be shabby and run down and not a good advertisement for the brand. Our room was cramped and basic - bits of woodwork chipped, walls marked. Our view out the window was out the back over a rooftop (can't have the good one all the time I guess!). The sports centre was a big let down. The changing facilities are grubby and dated. The changing room shower did not work, the sauna was not hot. And the pool was freezing. My young son had blue lips after 5 minutes in it. Interestingly, there is a van parked across the road from the hotel entrance with a big sign on it denouncing Hyatt hotels. Also not good advertising. Don't think we'll be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for downtown but you can't sleep past 9am”
Reviews.Author: bustedchucks
Reviews.Content: I had previously lived in Boston and this trip was to meet up with some friends from that time frame. I opted to stay at a hotel as, when booking through Travelocity, the cost of some of the flights to Boston from DC was the same as the flight and a few nights hotel stay as I was only there for 2 nights. That being said, I was already family with the area. One of the first things I noticed and really appreciated was the travel sized toothpaste that was in the bathroom. Sure, this is small detail but most places just seem to give you shampoo, lotion and soap and I had forgotten toothpaste so this was a nice convenience. I was also able to check in a few hours early which was nice since the trip was so short. The bed was nice and comfortable. I could have sleep forever but this did not happen as it seemed every morning nearby rooms were being vacuumed before/right around 9am. The AC rattled a lot and the pipes were noisy when the shower was going in neighboring rooms but other than that, the room was very quiet at night. I had a few drinks one night at the restaurant in the hotel as it was a Sunday night and no other restaurant in the vicinity of the hotel was going to stay open as late. The lobby area is weird but not that inconvenient as its just two elevators to get to your room not too sets of stairs. The area is right in the Downtown Crossing/Theater District area so you will see interesting characters if you return to your hotel late at night but I never felt unsafe and knew before hand that the area is not the worst area that a young female could find herself in. The location actually worked quite well as it won't take you long to get to the airport, shopping, Faneuil Hall, Cambridge and any other popular touristy spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: OrangeSquirrel
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here due to the fact that we found a great deal and it was in a good location. Check-in was quick and smooth. We were there early, so we had to store our bags and took a short walk to Faneuil Hall for lunch. Our room was ready when we got back -- an upgrade to a nice suite (thanks to my friend's status with the hotel chain). Everything was clean and comfortable. The next morning we walked to the Common area for brunch. All in all a great stay. The only drawback is the price to park, although its virtually impossible to find any affordable parking in the city.

Reviews.Title: “There are better alternatives”
Reviews.Author: BixUS
Reviews.Content: Went for an overnight stay this week. Staff is very friendly. Food was interesting but not spectacular during meeting. The room is tired. No outlets for computer - had to unplug wall lamp - room becomes very dark. Bathroom not completely cleaned - stains on counter. Went to use public bathroom on meeting level and it was worse than a baseball stadium or beach bathroom. No soap in dispenser.. Clearly not cleaned or checked.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Leeras
Reviews.Content: Good location and service. Room was very clean. Elevators were a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 7Asports
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 16 through 18 and enjoyed Boston and the Hyatt. Location is perfect - just a short walk from many sites and the trains. Not the most grandious of Hyatt's, and it does show its age somewhat. We were fortunate in that we didn't have loud neighbors, but I echo other reviews in that noise can be a problem. Management must be aware, since the television has a maximum volume of 17. That's fine for most all channels, but I sense they had trouble with tv noise complaints in the past. Staff is pleasant and breakfast was enjoyable. I'd stay here again, but would always bring the white-noise maker to help drown out objectionable noises from neighbors!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs”
Reviews.Author: TMR190862
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from july 15 to 17, 2010. the walls are made out of paper. We could hear the neibourgh flush the toilet. We had the unfirtunate opportunitues to stay next to a bunch of drunk people whow screamed and yelled all night he first night. When the morning came they got the wake-up calls but wouldn't answer. We heard at least 7 calls coming in. When you pay over $300 a night you expect more. I travelled the world and never found anything like that. I will never stay in a Hyatt for the rest of my life. The following night, a bunch of ignorant drunks were arguing in front of our door and kept us awarke for awhile until they move to a romm where we could hear them. Frankly, i have been to Boston before and never found so many loud ignorant drunks. The quality of the insulation between room is non-existent.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: explorer1972
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at this Hyatt Boston at the start of our 3 week usa holiday and it was an excellent way to begin. Hotel is well located in the Centre of Boston just beside the park with easy reach of everything by foot. The service was friendly, room and hotel was very clean. The only thing I would question is why is this hotel is the only hotel in the US that charges you an extra $10 a day to use their wi-fi, a small thing but really sticks in your throat. The indoor pool and other sporting facilities are excellent also. I would certainly recommend this hotel. You must do the duc tour and whale watching.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location and hotel - Stay if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: DonFTL
Reviews.Content: I'm a Hyatt Diamond member and decided to stay here to get points, etc. I agree with some of the other comments - the hotel is dated (ESPECIALLY the entrance lobby) but not enough to make it a bad place to stay. I didn't think the entrance was that big of a deal - I find it very common to have to take a separate elevator to the lobby in any big city hotel. If you arrive by car you go right in (without stairs) into initial elevator lobby. Location is very good - just off of Washington near lots of shopping, Macys and just on the main downtown subway station. Easy to get to from the Airport if using public transportation (From Airport - Silver Line Bus to Red Line Subway then exit Downtown Crossing station) 1 1/2 blocks to Boston Commons and area attractions - 15 min walk to the wharf area, etc. We were upgraded to a corner room which had a king bed and separate sitting area. There were some stray hairs in the sink but otherwise the room seemed clean. Staff was ok - not great but ok and friendly enough. Ate breakfast in Avenue One which was tasty and worth the 20 bucks. Although the servers weren't all that friendly but the people working the omelet and waffle stations were super nice and the food was great. There was a bit of a heat wave over July 4th weekend and the room a/c just did not keep up - hard to sleep when it's that warm. I didn't complain but probably should have. I also noticed loud beeping noises in the hallway throughout the day - very strange. All in all I would stay here if you could get a great rate but otherwise I probably will try another hotel. I also noticed a "Boycott Hyatt" trailer across the street from the entrance - that could explain some of the things we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “OK, Lower End of Hyatt Spectrum”
Reviews.Author: newjerseycommentator
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Regency Boston, as has been noted, is saddled with an unimposing entrance sequence. Streetside, there isn't anymuch visible but a door way that leads down steps into a mini-lobby. (There are also some weird blue lights along the street). Guests are then required to elevator up to the 3rd floor to the actual lobby, which unlike many Hyatts, is uninspiring and rather conventional. The rooms themselves are conventional for a property of the Hyatt level; not particularly large or exceptional. Soundproofing is not particularly good. The activities of the people next door to my room where clearly audible. Management at this property on the weekend i was there had clearly made the decision to maximize volume with discounts and arrangements with various sites and organizations. It was an international bazaar with travelers/tourists from all over the world. This suggests that a good price for a room can be had for the diligent. Location is on the edge of being excellent. It's about two blocks off the Boston Commons, which is good, but its precise location is a little fringy, across from a forlorn lookinng parking lot and not precisely in the middle of bustling activity. Breakfast buffet is $20. Parking is $33 self-park. Valet parking is over $40. Internet is $10. My room had only one "coffee basket" for the coffee maker. There is a charge for coffee in the lobby. This is certainly a servicable hotel but certainly one at the lower spectrum of Hyatt properties. I imagine management spends long hours trying to figure out how to manage room bookings and revenue given that the hotel probably won't pass as an upscale business hotel or a highly upscale hotel for tourists/Boston area visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, inconvenient lobby access”
Reviews.Author: travelingtuboo
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was fairly clean, though a bit small for American standards. The location was central, close to Boston Commons, Legal Seafood, and in the theater district around the corner from Macy's and Chinatown. I had a nice view from an upper floor of downtown Boston and one of the windows opened slightly for ventilation which was a plus. My biggest surprise (dislike) was the fact that there were price tags all around the room, e.g. $250 cleaning fee if there was smoking in the room (not that I had plans to do this), if even a thing was moved (not consumed) from the mini-bar/fridge I would be charged for that item, $25 cleaning fee for storing any of my own drinks/food in the fridge -- ridiculous! The A/C was a bit noisy and old, the bathroom clean, but somewhat dated. Also, as other reviewers have noted, the separate elevators for the lobby (not at street level) and the rooms was slightly inconvenient. Internet is $10/day in room, much better price than the business center which was kindly pointed out to me at the front desk. The staff were friendly, but almost erring on the side of too casual. I read that the hotel had laid off a bunch of their housekeeping staff a short while before my stay by replacing them with non-union outsourced cheap labor... so this might explain some of the behavior/attitude of the staff. Though, I got a nice deal from the hotel to the Boston Logan via a private car (Escalade) from one of the senior bellmen, $25.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice place”
Reviews.Author: artemis021
Reviews.Content: I had no trouble with noise from other rooms, but then again, I was in a corner room. I was surprised to see that the TV wasn't a flat panel. I was excited to get a "state house view" but found out that just meant I could see the gold dome, so that was a let-down. The breakfast buffett was very good, especially with the cooking station. I had them make me a pancake with raspberry and chocolate chips-fantastic! This was included in my room rate; I'm not sure if it would otherwise be worth the value-for-money. I ordered room service and asked for a glass of water. They gave me a juice glass. Pathetic. This is why I hate mandatory tips (in this case, 18%) and the $4 delivery fee. The location was good, but I'm not sure how many hotels in Boston proper have "bad" locations.

Reviews.Title: “What a View”
Reviews.Author: Plano_TexasCruiser
Reviews.Content: Free shuttle from airport. Facing Inner Boston Harbor - fantastic views of the city, sail boats, sunset. Excellent food on site. Water taxi to downtown giving easy access to sights, restaurants,shooping. Great value for holiday or business. Next to airport, but absolutely no outside noise in rooms or hotel in general.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for exploring Boston”
Reviews.Author: Tobesk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights having booked the hotel as part of a package through British Airways. The price was a major influence in our selection, it was the cheapest central hotel they offered. It was only after that we read more of the reviews and began to get worried. We took a taxi from the airport and the doorman offered to help us with the bags on arrival but we declined. The entrance is strange, the lobby is on the third floor so you need to take a lift (there are 3) from the ground. However, to get to these from the street entrance you need to go down a small flight of stairs which was a pain with the luggage (we wished we had used the bellboy)! Also these doors don't really open properly, they are stuck open at an angle which you can walk through without luggage. If the doorman is there they manage to force them open. Check in was a breeze there was no queue and the agent Rosario, was so helpful making sure that our requests had been fulfilled and offering further help and information. It was then, however, we found out that the pool was shut for renovations which had overrun. This was disappointing for us as we do like to chill in the pool normally. However, Rosario explained they had an agreement with the Langham should we wish to use a pool although as it happened, Boston kept us so occupied we didn't have time. We were on the 19th floor which pleased us and there were four lifts, which although were a bit creaky, were always working and we never had a situation where we had a long wait. The room was very spacious and clean and well maintained. It was, however, a little dated and this is reflected throughout the hotel but not to any extent that disappointed us. We had absolutely no issues with noise at all. Every member of staff we met was always friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make sure we were happy. Even after we had checked out the staff on the front desk were more than happy to give us a key to use the sauna and fitness suite so we could shower before our flight home. We found the location to be ideal. It is on top of Downtown Crossing subway station and Boylston was only a couple of minutes walk too. So many of the attractions were such a short distance anyway that sometimes it was just quicker just to walk. There is also an alternate entrance through Macy's (an alternate set of 3 lifts take you down to there). All in all we had a very good time in Boston and was very pleased with the Hyatt as a choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “quirky”
Reviews.Author: M500
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in many ways. My room was gorgeous clean and quiet. But service was on again, off again. Bar not very friendly. Room service pretty good. Front desk great. Coffee maker only had decaf coffee despite several requests. Maid service was dicey. If you are in your room in the AM you may or may not get your room cleaned. Housekeeping does weird things. I left the robe on the bed. They took it away and didn't replace it. Cleaned room but left used cups and glasses laying about. All in all it's now awful--just odd quirks not up to usual hotel service. The big downside of this hotel is the dual elevator system. You must take an elevator from the entrance to the lobby on the third floor and then a different elevator to your room. The lobby elevator often has long lines and long waits. I was willing to take the stairs but this seems to be impossible. They could easily fix this problem by making stairs accessible. Some would take the stairs, clearing the elevators for those with luggage and those who don't want to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience-perfect location for Tufts visit and sightseeing...”
Reviews.Author: bamacamper
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Hyatt was a good one. Location was perfect. We went to visit Tufts University which was a 6 minute, easy walk from the hotel. In the other direction, many of the historical attractions, shopping, and the waterfront were all within 10-15 minute walking distance. The rooms were definitely not 4 star in my opinion(old...ordinary), but they were clean and the beds were EXTREMELY comfortable. We had to stay in King rooms because no doubles were available but we got a great rate through the University. While our end room was very quiet, others in our party had issues with "thin walls" and difficulty sleeping due to an arguing couple next door. The elevators were an issue on more than one occasion over the 5 days, one got "stuck" and several were out of commission but all were fixed in a reasonable amount of time. (This did not affect my stay but I would be rating a lot lower if I or anyone in my party had gotten stuck. :-)) We did not eat in the restaurant (too many other choices within walking distance) and we did not order any room service. Anthony at the concierge desk was WONDERFUL and hooked us up with a great restaurant on the waterfront. My only complaint is the $9.99 per day charge for Internet access. I highly recommend this hotel for Tufts visitors and those who value cleanliness and comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-Amentities not up to rating”
Reviews.Author: gpatton995
Reviews.Content: Only plus-concierge was excellent! Two elevators to get to your room. Service and entertainment at terrace bar was awful. Breakfast room service was horrendous. In room coffee maker didn't work. Coffee in lobby was $2 for 8 oz and it was burnt. Front door to hotel needed assistance to open. Hotel store was highway robbery. Did I mention? Sign out front on mobile trailer.....Boycott Hyatt! This is by no means a 3 or 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Showing Signs of Age”
Reviews.Author: TourDoctor
Reviews.Content: This is a good but not great hotel. It shows signs of age. Rooms are large but they would need an update, particularly the bathrooms,. still with a shower curtain, as in the 80s! In case you are a light sleeper, ask for a room on a higher floor; I had room 2211 on their highest floor (22 - not a club floor, they do not have a club floor), View was stunning, room was absolutely quiet at night. Breakfast in the restaurant in the lobby floor was very good (try their omlette), prices reasonable. Roomservice good, quick and efficient. Housekeeping spotles. Minibar/fridge in the room. In the minibar was a sign stating that guests have to pay a "$ 25 cleaning and restocking fee" in case they use the fridge for their own products. It did not bother me personally but I guess it is annoying for families with babies if they are just charged for nothing but putting a few baby products (milk, food) in the fridge. Internet charge is $ 10 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: JBlack716
Reviews.Content: I don't normally take the time to write these things but this property deserves it. Hands down this was the best experience I have had at a Hyatt year to date. The staff was amazing with this customer service and killed me with kindness during every interaction. They also have an awesome Terrace bar outside which I recommend everyone checks out...very cool!! I hope everyone can take the time to enjoy their stay here as I have!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kim33941
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel primarily for it's location, in the middle of downtown, The hotel is a different setup, you enter in the street level, and the lobby is on the second floor. The check in was efficient and friendly. Room was comfortable,huge bed, with a great view of the city. We ate in the Hotel restaurant, food was suprisingly excellent. I would definetly recommend to anyone who would like to stay ion the heart of downtown. It seems that prevous reviews, one incident was written about over and over again. My experience was wonderful and I will be back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay Here Again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: halio_susan
Reviews.Content: After a long flight and a taxi ride later my husband and I were gracious to arrive to an awaiting doorman with a smile on his face and pleasant welcome. The front desk clerk was even more courteous and answered my million questions (which really annoyed my husband, lol) about the city. I liked the closeness of the T and tour bus as I am one of those sightseeing individuals. The room was clean, inviting, and relaxing! The restaurant had great food (we ate a buffet in the morning, I loved the egg white omelette). I would recommend this hotel to any traveler or business person.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service for a name such as Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Philyeo
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was located in a strategic location downtown of Boston and was "Hyatt", we were surprised by the quality of service. Namely: 1) Wet carpet on DAY 1 When we arrived on our first night, we realized that the carpet was wet. Having doing alot of walking earlier and being quite tired we just told the hotel reception via the phone that if they could do anything first the same night it would be fine otherwise, we're ok that they settle it the next day. To our suprise one of the room service attendant (a guy) told us not to walk there at all if we're not happy with the wetness! I simply cannot accept that since the region that was wet was next to where we put our baggage. 2) NO verbal pre-warning and obscured notices for the use of the fridge. Having bought some fruits from the Haymarket, we wanted to keep them fresh but the fridge that they have was fully occupied. Personally, of all the hotels we've been (even Hyatt in other countries) doesn't do it like the Hyatt we stayed here in Downtown Boston - we were not told that the fridge was not meant for storage and that there were an automatic inventory notification should we remove any items out from it. The notice that they pasted was obscured and hardly noticeable!!!! And worth to point out was really meant to mislead their customers into the same situation we faced - whereby we were then billed $99 for things we removed to make room for the fruits. Although they did a courtesy waiver for the billing, the experience was enough to classify it as an unacceptable experience. 3) Baggage handling @ Hotel's Concierge Last and worst service ever was the bell man of the Hotel who's name is Willie. Poorest of poorest of service. He purposely ignored my initial warning telling him that our bag cannot be lifted from the topside and later on rudely said that I didn't give any pre-warning. He didn't write my name correctly and as I mentioned to him the correct spelling "again", insisted that I didn't. We thought, he could be rather old therefore the grumpyness but to our surprise when we pass the Lobby again, saw him treating other hotel guest differently with smiles and all that. I hate to say it, but its almost feel like racial tension as he may have treated us that way because we are asians and the other guest aren't.

Reviews.Title: “YUK.”
Reviews.Author: eileend10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 3 hotels on this trip to Boston. Hyatt was just awful. From the moment I arrived in the pouring rain, no bellman in sight. I dragged in 4 suitcases (I was moving my son out of his university) and when i got to the front desk (stairs and an elevator ride away) the bellman had the nerve to try to load up my suitcases on a cart to take to the rm. No way i was going to top a bellman AFTER I had to drag them down stairs and elevator. When was leaving hotel to go out to eat, bellman SCREAMED down the hall at me, "WHERE YA GOIN?" - I guess that was his way of asking if I needed a cab. No greeting, just screaming at me down the hall. Hotel looks like 1970s, dark carpet, not luxurious at all. TV is an old clunker, no flatscreens, worst TV I have ever had in a hotel in yrs, terrible picture w/lines in it. I am at the hotel now and dreading having to leave because I have to deal w/the bellmen again. The Omni Parker House is close by and is a wonderful hotel- STAY THERE. The only thing I liked about the Hyatt was it is right on edge of a nice Chinatown for dinner. A couple of nice shabu shabu Japanese places in Chinatown also. Oh, and they charge for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Awful night's sleep - NOT a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christie1233
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a weekend at the Hyatt Regency with our 2 small children. We got a great deal on the room using Priceline, so price was not an issue. However, for a hotel listed as a 4-star property it was not what we were expecting. In general, the hotel needs updating. The lobby and elevators are very dark and tired looking. Location - while it is within walking distance to Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market and other attractions, the hotel is virtually in Chinatown and right on the edge of Downtown Crossing. We were not comfortable walking back to the hotel after dark with our small children. Inconvenient for parents traveling with kids - it is not easy to get in and out of the hotel, especially if you are using a stroller. You have to take a roundabout route and 2 separate elevators to get from the street level to your room. The rooms are not very big - we could barely maneuver around the 2 double beds and had to move furniture around in order to set up the Pack N Play for our youngest to sleep in. Also of concern: our room was on the 21st floor and when you get off the elevator there is an open walkway to the guest rooms that looks down to several floors below. The railing had gaps large enough for a child to squeeze through, very dangerous! Paperthin walls - this was our biggest complaint! All of the rooms are adjoining, and there is no soundproofing. We did not sleep a wink thanks to the foot stomping going on us above us, the gentleman next door blaring ESPN Sportcenter at midnight, and the drunken couple in the other room next to us having very loud intercourse at 3am! Maybe this hotel is sufficient for business travelers during the week, but we did not have a pleasant stay and will be staying somewhere else on our next visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: gg6868
Reviews.Content: We used Priceline to bid on the hotel. Paid only $70 per night for a standard queen room. You would think the Front Desk should be the "FIRST LINE OF DEFENSE" for the hotel. The staffs barely greeted you. I was standing there for almost 5 mins & only one person in front of me. Front desk staffs stared at me for a little while before he said anything. ****Check in was for bad.**** Arrived early & the room was not ready. Front desk told us they would call once the room is available. Check in time was 4PM. No phone called from them, called the hotel ourselves at 4:30PM was told the room now available. We arrrive at 6PM. Guessed what?!! NO ROOM STILL. Waited another 30mins. WATCH OUT. We got the bill for all the charges everything looked fine. When tried to pay we were told THERE AND THEN. there were a $35 charges per night for upgrade. WOO HOO. What a surprise??? We were not even told when we waited 4 hours for our room. SWEEEEEEEEEEEETTTTTTTTTTTTT!!! After all the compliants NOW here are the good sides of the hotel: Room was fine. Roomservices were very warm & professional. But setting is old. It was a very old building. Great location for first time traveller. It is only worth for 4 stars for the "Hyatt" name. Front desk services are barely there. Amenties were just average. From my world travel experience I would give it a 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: elschoen
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel is refusing to take responsibility for stolen items under the valets care. The bed was uncomfortable, the air condition didnt work, poor water pressure in the shower, and terrible food. Save yourself some sanity and stay around the corner at the Ritz..

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: MarchMob
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at this hotel it was a disaster. Upon arrival we were supposed to be given a suite for our weekend stay with family and friends to celebrate a wedding. The rude clerk at the front desk told us there were no suites available for that weekend. My son arrived an hour later and the same clerk gave him a suite! The dingy, dark room we were given had a faulty shower, the water could not be regulated, and was so hot it scalded us! The walls were paper thin and the noise level pretty high. The hotel worker's union had picket signs plastered outside the entrance of the hotel. The exercise facility was poorly equipped with broken machines. The lobby is located on the lower level of the parking garage with no sitting area and the front desk is on an entirely different level, very inconvenient for large groups staying together. The customer service at this hotel was extremely poor, we travel extensively for business and pleasure and have stayed at many hotels, we would never stay at a Hyatt again, nor would we recommend the Hyatt to family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “don't leave your valuables with the valet”
Reviews.Author: BMP1959
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with family to celebrate my niece's wedding being held at a nearby restaurant. My niece, the bride, had her laptop stolen while it was being loaded in a car by the valets & did not receive any compensation from the hotel. I found David who works at the front desk to be extremely rude. We went to the hotel bar after the wedding reception & a hotel employee had to take down a hotel guest, the situation could have been handled better!

Reviews.Title: “Sooooo many problems”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlATC
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we should have known that karma would win out when we heard that there was a boycott/protest going on over the recent firings of the entire housekeeping staff. But the location was perfect for what we needed, so we stayed. I stayed there for 2 weeks. I'm not really sure where to start, but there were so many little annoyances. The concierge was just rude, no other way to say it - very uppity. I only had housekeeping service my room a couple of times during my stay, but I called for random items (towels, extra coffee, etc) probably 5 or 6 times during the 2 weeks, and not once did we actually get what we asked for. I had a couple of friends visit for 3 days, and every single morning we were woken up very early for unneccessary reasons. The first day was by a wake-up call that we didn't place. The second day was by someone knocking on the door asking for the room service tray that we had ordered the night before. (with the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door, btw) The third day was by an alarm going off because the hot water pipes had burst on our floor and there was an evacuation -which I fully realize is out of anyone's hands and is nobody's fault...cut to later that night when a woman in the elevator overheard us talking about it and said the same thing had happened a few months prior when she was there before. And speaking of elevators, they were broken for about 3 of the days we were staying at the hotel. I don't mind taking the stairs occasionally, even if I was on the 11th floor, it was better than waiting for the 1 working elevator to make it's way down all 20 flights. Oh, and 2 people in our party got stuck in an elevator for prolonged periods of time, on 2 separate occasions...On the plus side, the location is fantastic - it's really close to the T and within walking distance of almost everything on the Freedom Trail. And the beds were really comfortable. I just doubt I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service...which is everything in this industry.”
Reviews.Author: petegriffin
Reviews.Content: I am really shocked at some of the treatment we received while staying at the hotel for a wedding. You'd think that hotel management would make sure it's staff treats everyone with respect, but especially when someone picked their hotel as the recommended place to stay for a wedding. Hotel staff was generally uninformed about event details even though the bride provided them with all the information and travel gifts for her guests (which weren't delivered in a timely fashion). Hotel security was lacking. Guests with the wedding had to actually leave the bar area one night and go somewhere else to avoid some rude random customer who eventually started a fight and was arrested. I can't say for a fact, but I don't think he was even a hotel guest. Regardless, is this a Hyatt Regency or Moe's Tavern? And the icing on the cake was when the bride's computer was stolen while in possession of hotel staff. As if that wasn't bad enough, hotel management has not offered to reimburse her for her stolen property or done anything more than offer an apology. Unfortunately service and value are everything in the hotel industry, especially in this economy. If all you care about is a comfortable bed then I guess this will do. For me I demand more for my money. The value is just not there for Hyatt Regency Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The location is great situated near...”
Reviews.Author: Marblerye
Reviews.Content: The location is great situated near downtown crossing and just behind Boston common, great walks. Except near Chinatown with the kids. Stay to the right of hotel on exit. The boycott the hyatt signs were a bit distracting...told my son that's what boys in the hotel sleep on. This hotel bathrooms need renovation. Fit and finish and painting and caulking are in need. The towels are stored in the shower stall???? The shower curtain did not work. Parking is not cheap at the hotel, you pay in some both before you get in your car. If you forget, you are made to feel the fool by security while impatient people wait behind you. Security was great at the bar. I watched a guy spit on someones leg. Then he was wrestled to the ground until the cops arrived. Hotel was akward to enter. Down steps off street then two sets of elevators . Room could

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay, great staff shame about the pool”
Reviews.Author: SB_Sheppard
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hyatt Regency Boston was excellent. The bed was huge and amazingly comfortable. The rooms were well appointed and had lots of high quality toiletries provided. The staff were very helpful and the concierge knew more about some tours than the Tourist Information Offices did! The only disappointment was the swimming pool which was small and did not have a separate Adults only area as advertised on their website. I would definitely stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Property stolen during my wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: schoenadonna
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt the weekend of my wedding. The morning after my wedding my laptop was stolen. It was left with the valet's and when the car was loaded up the laptop was "mysteriously" missing. Of course it was brought to the attention of the security and management staff. We have been trying for a week to at least get compensated for the laptop and of course the Hyatt's insurance carrier is denying the claim saying there is no conclusive proof that it's the Hyatt's fault. Also, the hotel failed to inform me of the charge for delivering gift bags to my guests. It's $3/bag, if I had known about it ahead of time I would have made sure that they were at the hotel days in advance of the weekend. As it was all the guests did not receive bags. Also, the hotel has a website called passkey portal that is supposed to help keep track of your hotel guests. It lets you see who checks in for how long, etc. This didn't really do a great job. If guests made reservations by phone or in person it didn't track them even if they clearly stated they were there for a wedding and part of a group.

Reviews.Title: “unsatisfactory”
Reviews.Author: avgnj
Reviews.Content: It"s not 4 stars hotel: not friendly stuff, very noisy aircondition in the room, not working hair dryer, not quility food., the lockers without keys in the swimming pool .

Reviews.Title: “hyatt boston”
Reviews.Author: TanyaW2
Reviews.Content: bar closed too early,hotel stay not helpful,security rude and uninformed.at 5 am they let some strang guy that got my name at the bar into my room cause he said he knew me and then they denied it was their fault. not enough food menu choices.location good and gift shoppe personal was nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, clean, and cheap”
Reviews.Author: tajraz
Reviews.Content: I can't complain about price because I booked it for $70/night on priceline, but I'll cut to the chase with the positives and negatives of the Hyatt Regency Boston Pros: - clean - fairly inexpensive - very spacious bathtubs and showers - soft beds - nice toiletries - let me check in about an hour before regular check-in time Cons - LOUD - conjoined rooms have little sound proofing, especially in the doors - I could hear all the giggling and phone ringing of the people next door to me. Plus, situated next to the ice machine and maid's closet (seems to be common if you book on priceline). Additionally, kids stomping and running up and down the hallway constantly - though this is not the hotel's fault (maybe if they put families with kids on the same floor) and more the fault of lazy parents - Additional charge for internet - kind of ridiculous in this day and age - Could not find the entrance - enter on the side of Lafyette, take the stairs down, elevator up, cross the lobby, find main elevators, and go up to your room - very odd layout of hotel - No mugs in the room - the paper cups are wasteful, mugs would be nice - Old-school TV that did not rotate - would have been nice to turn it towards the desk or chair - no bathrobes, but the website indicated bathrobes. minor, but would have been nice!

Reviews.Title: “In Need of Renovations”
Reviews.Author: colleencass
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short jaunt to Boston. We had two rooms located on the 10th floor. The set up of the hotel is odd, but nice. The valet parking ($43) is ridiculous and much more than other hotels located only blocks away. Rooms were nice but very tired looking, exception given to the beds which were extremely comfortable. The furniture and the bathroom are showing their age. Most noticeable was the carpet. This is not, of course,. something to ruin a stay, but noticeable in what's known as a 4 star hotel. Views were great as was the location of the hotel; walking distance to most spots or a quick jaunt on the T. Pool was okay. Small, but fine for a city hotel. Definitely about half the size of the photos. Service was okay. I jokingly asked the woman in "gift shop" what the markup on the gatorade was (@ $4/bottle) and she was extemely vicious in her reply. I truly was just kidding but she apparently didn't think it was funny. We were given connecting king rooms which obviously doesn't work with 2 adults and four children. This took quite some time to get resolved and the front desk person was not too helpful. The concierge was always helpful and gave us pretty good recommendations. The biggest plus is the location. Comparing the hotel to other Hyatt properties, the Boston prpoerty doesn't come close. They really do need to refresh the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: beauxl2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights over Valentines and turned out we picked really well for a first stay in Boston. The location was superb, as its fairly quiet around the property but its still 3 minutes from all the action. State in one direction, Boston Common in the other. Both Downtown Crossing and Chinatown `T` stops are less than 5 minutes away. The staff were also very helpful and in good spirits, and in the room the view over the common to the Massachussets Sate House was outstanding. But the best thing about the place is the amazing king size bed. The mattress is about 2 foot thick!. Combine this with the excellent rate we got from Expedia and it was a 5 star trip for a 3 star price. Stay here when in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Boston - Fab place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tgreeny
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with great location close to the 'T' station which is part of the MBTA. Great transport links. A $15.00 ticket gets you 7 days of 'T' travel and silver line buses which get you to the Airport too. The hotel smelt lovely as you walked in, great huge big comfy bed, with great view of State House, tea / coffe / hairdryer/ toiletries etc. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: suzyjacuzzi
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our one Saturday night stay at this property. Staff was exceptionally pleasant and our king room was clean, spacious and modern. We did not experience any issue of noise in the hallways. Our king bed was perfect with a pillow top and lots of fluffy pillows. The health club and pool area is one of the best I have encountered in Boston. We took full advantage of the new cardio equipment and weight room. The indoor pool area was next to the workout area and was full of families and children enjoying the warmth on a cold February day. The hotel is close to the movie theater, Boston Opera House, Boston Common and many other Boston attractions. This hotel is a good deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Ruins your stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeFMarkhamON
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency is in a bad location; the area is being "gentrified". Best to come back in 20 years or so. Security is tight at every level. The hotel is tired, very tired. The Hyatt beds are so high that you require a step-stool just to get into bed. On the other hand the baths are low; no more than 8 inches of water possible. The staff are pleasant enough, but cannot be heard over the monstrously loud elevator music that pevades the lobby. The temperature controls in my room did not work, but the hotel service desk reassured me that this was not unusual; none of the controls work. It was freezing!!! Pick anoter hotel until they renovate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Springercrazy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and found the hotel within walking distance of quite a few sights! It's in a good location. The room was very clean and the staff helpful. The concierge recommended a nice place for dinner that was close to the hotel. They also gave us a $5 off coupon, not much, but it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: UkSand
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel late after arriving in boston, we had pre booked and was given a lovely room over looking the river. Parking was easy. Room was very comfy, I cant say much about the hotel other than that as we lefy around 8am next morning for Stowe, However early morning i needed some info from the main desk, and the night desk man went on the internet and got me the telephone no i wanted. Not sure I wouls stay here if visiting Boston for a extended lengh of time but it was great for a over night stay.

Reviews.Title: “What Noise? Why the bad reviews??”
Reviews.Author: 500PlacestoSee
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old son and I just returned from Boston. I was worrried about the comments posted and our visit. I was taking him for his 15th birthday and I wanted everything to be great! The hotel was PERFECT!! It was quite, clean, and above all, the staff was fantastic! Anthony, the Conceirge, was amazing. Amanda at the front desk was helpful and courteous. The rooms were a nice size and very clean. We had breakfast at Avenue One and the service was no. 1. Thank you you Hyatt for making this trip PERFECT!!

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: JMX2016
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel. nice staff, nice beds, very good location on the less good side : i stayed for 2 nights. you have the "privacy" sign to hang on the door but no "service needed" sign. i left my room at 1pm removing the "privacy" from my door. when i came back at 8pm, my room was not done. this is IMO unnacceptable for a Hyatt. the wi-fi cost also 9,99$ per 24h, not too expensive but i would expect to have free wi-fi in hotels like Hyatt. free wi-fi is one of the most important item i look when i book an hotel. didn't chose to stay there myself, my company did. overall good experience though

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: purplevicki
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate off Priceline, but the hotel was still nice. A good location right by Boston Common and close to T stops. Room was big and comfortable with a view across the city. They also let us check in at 12pm. The concierge was helpful and friendly. We enjoyed the steam room although the sauna could have been multisex. It's a bit bland, but still 4* and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: s930
Reviews.Content: The room we had on 17th floor was very large with pretty city views. The hotel has easy access to Macy's, Chinatown and metro station. The concierge staff is so helpful and friendly. It has a computer next to the concierge where you can print the boarding pass in advance, which is really handy. We enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Restaurant. Undercook white meat gross”
Reviews.Author: kiki825
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the holidays.. What an awful mistake to stay at the Hyatt Regency Boston. The room service food was just plain bland tasteless raw chicken.. The chicken sandwich about the only decent item on the hotel menus unless you specify burn the chicken cook it throughly it will come raw cold and white with sprinkle black pepper and to top if off kinda expensive two chicken sandiwh with one clam chouder soup about $50 .. The only good thing is the Breakfast in the restaurant the food is fresh and for $5 extra you can have it cooked in front of you egg whites, pancakes. etc. If you ever in Columbus , Ohio The Hyatt in capital is the best of its kind. The Regency room serves fresh fruits, crossants. you name it they have it.. The rooms at the Columbus Hyatt are so spacious .. It is a shame to even be compare this the Boston Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasLacey
Reviews.Content: We flew to Boston for the weekend just for relaxation and to see the historical sights. We arrived at the Hyatt by taxi from the airport. The Doorman was extremely friendly and wanted to help us right away. The front desk checked us in very quickly and we went up to the 19th floor to our room. Our room was comfortable and cozy. We had a wonderful view of the city of Boston. The king bed was outstanding and probably the most comfortable bed that I have ever slept in. The decor of the room looked new and modern. There was a small chair in the room that I used a lot to read my Boston maps in. It was very comfortable for the size of that chair. We used the concierge several times while we were in Boston to find restaurants and trolley stops and tours. The concierge told us about a restaurant called "Kennedys." We ate at the restaurant and we loved the food and the service was great! My husband used the workout room about 4 times while we were there and he said it was the best one that he had seen in any hotel. One thing that we found convenient while we were at the Hyatt was that you could enter Macy's store and walk through it to get to our hotel. It was 26 degrees outside and we were thrilled to be able to stay inside instead of braving the cold wind. My husband had left his gloves at home so he bought a pair at that Macy's. All of the people working at the Hyatt went out of their way to be helpful and friendly! Our floor was very quiet and we never heard any noises outside our door in the hallway. This hotel was a real joy to stay in and I would love to stay there again on our next visit. One last thing, we loved the fact that Christmas carols were playing all of the time by the elevators which put us in a festive mood. Thank you for that!!

Reviews.Title: “great location and nice price”
Reviews.Author: spartan14
Reviews.Content: Hyatt was offering a 30% discount from the best available rate on their website, which made booking here very attractive. It's only a few blocks from the Boston Common and right next to the theater district. It's walking distance to the Back Bay and Beacon Hill. The Boston Ballet (at the Opera House) is right across the street, which was very convienent. The room itself was nice, with very comfortable beds (my friend said they were a little too soft though, but I thought they were great). Their fitness center is also decent, with a selection of cardio equipment (4 treadmills, a few ellipticals, bikes and rowing machines), as well as weights and weight machines. There is a small pool, designed for laps (not very children-friendly if that's what you're looking for). Overall, it was a great experience for the weekend and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very courteous staff and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: pjones04
Reviews.Content: We wanted to see some of the great historical sites in Boston. We wanted to be in a central "walk only" location. We wanted a clean, comfortable, "customer is right" hotel. We wanted a quiet private room in which to visit with friends and get a quiet night sleep. This hotel delivered on all the above accept the last. The staff was exceptional. The doormen, lobby staff, concierge and dining staff were all professional, customer oriented and made our stay memorable. I recommend using the parking lot just outside the hotel basement entrance. It was $32.00 for 24 hours instead of the hotel's valet parking off-site which was $44.00. Although we did not use our vehicle, we had total access to it. If you are going in and out anytime during the night, use the valet service. Like I said above, the rooms were very nice but the noise was unbelieveable. We had a two couples next to us who were very loud and truly sounded like they were in our room instead of theirs. The people in the hallway might as well have been in our room too. I heard two females who joined the party brag how they got past the lobby attendants with a false story about leaving their husbands upstairs and forgetting their room keys. I have never been in a hotel where the walls and doors were that thin. So if you are fortunate and do not have loud neighbors, it's a great package. But if you have loud guests next door and in the hallway, the stay is drastically diminished. Perhaps it could be addressed at check-in. I would recommend this hotel but only with the noise warning. But other than the noise, it is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have a better experience”
Reviews.Author: skye9229
Reviews.Content: Staff is unfailingly polite and welcoming at all times. Upon check-in our family was given a delightful complimentary upgrade to a larger corner room which was quite generously sized and very comfortable. I have to single out a front desk manager named Siham who immediately remedied the few minor issues that did surface. We were experiencing some problems staying connected to the in-room wireless internet, and also I wasn't thrilled with the power of the attached bathroom wall hairdryer. The internet charge was promptly removed, we were offered a similar room with an ethernet connection, and a more powerful hair dryer was promptly delivered to our room along with complimentary breakfast vouchers for the whole family. Now that is what I call service. Such a pleasure to have a competant staff ensuring that your stay is pleasurable and hassle free. We will undoubtingly be staying here any time we visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Do not pass this property up”
Reviews.Author: Jfalkingham
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that the service at this hotel is top notch. They are right up there with Marriott and far ahead of Hilton & Starwood. This hotel location is right on top of the Red & Orange line T station (downtown crossing), its an easy walk to South Station or Boston Common. The AMC movie theatre is a short walk and you can easily get over to the Fanuiel hall/Quincy market location. The rooms are spacious, comfortable beds, and plenty of hot water in the morning. The TV's are not flat panels and dated, however they are planning on upgrading those in 2010. The hotel provided a daily wall street journal and in the bathroom there was toothpaste, toothbrush, scope, slippers and the usually variety of shampoo/soaps. The towels were soft and comfortable. Pillows were a firm down feel, which was perfect for me. If you like real squishy pillows, might want to ask the front desk. Breakfast was great, buffet is definitely the way to go. Speedy & efficient service throughout. Room service was fast and the food arrived hot and cooked perfectly. The rooms were clean and kept clean by a staff that is uber-efficient. They are in and out of a room in record time. Overall, I can't find a negative. Yes, as others have said, the take an elevator to check-in to take another elevator to your room is a bit akward (there are no stairs for this leg) but what I thought would be a hassle was not a problem. A lot of in-city locations are set like this. If you are on a business trip or want to get away for a bit, you will not be disappointed by this property! I definitely recommend it over the Radisson & Hilton in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Another Hyatt, another treat.”
Reviews.Author: john fegan
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 19th floor with wonderful views over the city of Boston. The staff were very friendy and efficient. I appreciate it when the staff make time for a friendly chat .Our Scottish accents seem to bring out this aspect in Americans nature and it is always very welcome. We will be returning to Boston and the Hyatt in April 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: tedlor32
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel for our planned overnight in Boston, Friday night into Saturday. We wanted to be in Boston proper and this was a great location and for $89 a night with my wife's travel agent's discount the price was right. We arrived and went straight to the $38 a night valet parking, a lot of dough but really worth ot overall. You drive underground and park, you walk right in and take the elevator to the lobby on the 3rd floor. While some criticize the having to take two elevators, it didn't bother us. It seemed to flow just fine, and provides some separation from the bustling streets. The best part of the stay for us was the staff. They were all great, warm and friendly. Paul remembered our names the next morning and was great with our 16 month old son. The room was nice, a standard room, pretty small as you would expect but not bad for a big city hotel. I would say the room has been partially updated. The bed and decor was updated for sure. iPod dock on the alarm clock was a nice touch. The rest of the room, not so much. The tub yelled out 1980, but it gave a great shower. The hotel web site says "robes in every room" which was not true. It also says "flat screen tv's in every room." This is only partially true. The screen is flat, but it is still a large TV that would have been state of the art in 1993. Only 24 channels on the TV, not including Hyatt promo stuff. Minibar was one of those "sensor" types where if you take anything out, you are charged for it. High prices, $4.50 for bottled Dasini water and soared from there. People in the room next to us were partying hard, and it sounded like they were partying in our room. Fortunately they lefty, but made another huge racked when returing at 3:30 a.m. I slept through it, my wife woke up. We were with our baby, and the crib brought to the room was quite nice. They provided a "baby kit" of products in the crib, which my wife was very impressed by. Checked out the pool, found the water to be a little cold. It's attached to the exercise room, which was pretty impressive. The first time I've ever seen free weights at a hotel gym. The bar, we had a drink while waiting for our friends. I had a Stella ($6) and my wife a glass of sauvignon blanc ($8.75). Went to the lobby restaurant "Avenue One" for breakfast and found it to be grossly overpriced. Continental breakfast buffet $14, full breakfast buffet $20. Coffee by itself $4. I guess it's par for the course for a big city hotel, but looking at the menu I wanted to walk right out. But we stayed and it was fine, and the staff were really great as had been the case our entire stay. Overall it was pretty much what we expected, but the staff clearly made it extremely enjoyable. We left the hotel feeling really good about our stay. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to review”
Reviews.Author: nycthing
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult hotel to review - the rooms are nice but the entrance on the second floor is awkward. The location is convenient to everything and yet hard to find and out of the way unless you know where you are going. Service is solid for a Hyatt - it doesn't overwhelm but it doesn't disappoint either. I love Boston and have found that you can often find deals on rooms here - the location works for me since I know the city but not sure everyone else will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality big-box hotel, no surprises”
Reviews.Author: hoboesque
Reviews.Content: This is a big hotel, central, and civilized - prime convention territory! But no surprises. Big, comfortable rooms, nice bed (with a futon between the bottom sheet and the mattress - novel - but comfortable), well appointed bathrooms, the food's good, staff are well-trained-polite, if a little try-too-hard friendly (when I told the check-out clerk I was flying to Boston, she said "oh, send me a postcard!". Yes, of course, what was I thinking...). But this hotel is just what you'd expect from a big Hyatt in a big city, and there's nothing wrong with it. I paid about $300 which was a bit expensive for what I got, but not by much. My Hyatt status gets me free internet, tho' I'd guess it 's probably not cheap otherwise, and it worked generally ok. Tea/coffee and ipod player in the room gets plus marks, as does a big bathtub. The negatives weren't life-threatening.
