The hotel's been well renovated, but it's nevertheless an old big-box hotel, "mutton dressed up as lamb". The one major niggle wouldn't be a problem for most travellers. I checked before I booked that there was a pool, and what the opening hours were (from 5am). I checked again when I got to the hotel, with the front desk. And I checked once more in the hotel services booklet. Jetlag, an early flight, and a training programme, meant I was at the door of the pool at 5:00 sharp in the morning. Locked door. 5:05 still locked. I called reception, who said they'd get someone from security to come, which they did... at 5:30. So my long workout turned into a short workout and I could have stayed in bed another half an hour. And neither the receptionist nor the security guard attempted an apology. So any other lunatic early morning athletes beware. The rest of you... ignore that whinge! But more of you might be unimpressed with the "business centre" that consisted of a room of machines, all self-service with a credit card. No staff in sight and you can't charge faxes, etc, to your room - credit card swipe only. Now THAT's pissy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Management and Customer Relations Experienced Anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Overlandparkers
Reviews.Content: I am an extremely detailed trip- planner for our family. Our last plan was for a long Oct. weekend in Boston. I called at least 20 different places, condo rentals and hotels in Boston for two days almost solid. I received the absolute best service from each person I needed to speak with at the Boston Hyatt Regency--even nationwide #--in planning and unfortunately cancelling due to the flu in our home. We will not even consider staying anywhere else in Boston when we reschedule.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: travellingrealtor
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews (many negative ones) about this hotel, I was a bit skeptical about staying there. I stayed there with my family for 2 nights last weekend and it was wonderful. The location could not have been more ideal, the staff was very accommodating and the hotel itself was perfectly fine. I think there are a lot of grumpy folks out there that enjoy complaining. We loved it and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Moxsd
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience here the past week. The hotel was spotless and the staff from the doorman to housekeeping seemed to be friendly and willing to help. I stay in Hyatt Hotels a lot and this was as good if not better than many. The hotel is great for anyone on business or just for leisure. The rooms were just your standard Hyatt rooms, its not the Ritz but its a solid 3.5 star hotel that's clean safe and a good experience. The hotel bar is actually priced very well at 6 bucks a 16 ounce beer and the bartenders were happy and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: TexasTwin
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Parents Weekend at Berklee. The hotel lobby is not great, but the location is good (near Boston Commons and the start of the Freedom Trail). The concierge was very helpful. The pool and workout area are very good for a hotel. I found the pool temp great, but I used it for swimming laps. We had a drink in the bar each night after returning from dinner. Not a very exciting lobby bar, but lots of good places closeby. The room was clean, bed too soft for my taste. All in all, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Singularly Unimpressed and Quite Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 1nycnative
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Boston and stayed at the Hyatt Regency from September 25th, 2009 to September 27th 2009. You enter the hotel on street level, then there are 3 steps down (even though a sign besides the sliding glass doors states Handicapped Accessible???) to a lower elevator level and then you have to take an elevator to go up to the 3rd floor for the Reception Area and then another set of elevators to get you to your room.YIkes!!!! Decor is dated, rooms are quite standard and for some inexplicable reason- I was put in a handicapped room. Furntiure in the room is definitely showing wear and tear and whatever they put on the top of their mattresses, some sort of padding, does not even extend the whole length of the mattress. To boot, I could not get the phone in my room to work properly as I could only manage to work it with the speaker micro on. Additonally, their minibar bar prices are stratospheric. The bar and resutrant in the Hotel Lobby is quite generic with nothing to make it stand out in one's mind. I stayed there because when I think Hyatt- I hink of a pleasant Atrium Area but, if there was one, I did not find it. The exterior of the buuilding is also quite ugly- like a grey concrete fortrress- nothing charming or elegant about it whatsoever. I ewill definitely NOT stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Excellance Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: calabasas3
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay with amazing, friendly staff, clean and comfortable room. We have a very enjoyable vacation and thanks the entire team as the door men, the driver-shuttle service, housekeeping, also thanks the assistance front desk manage with her excellent customer service. We were never forget our first trip to visit the Bostom. We will stay here again. Keep up the good work. A family from Calabasas.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value, but there are better options”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireLass42
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, the room was clean and the location was convenient for the Freedom Trail and main tourist attractions. There was a spa too - though the pool water was freezing! The rooms are looking a little dated in terms of decor now and if we go to Boston again we will be looking to stay in the seafront area.

Reviews.Title: “Only ok”
Reviews.Author: ilovepeaches
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Hyatts and I have to say this one in Boston was only ok. Don't get me wrong, it is a fine hotel but there were a few important things that were not so great. I'm not a very picky traveller - comfort and location is key. Location of the hotel was great, close to the T train - and all the sites. However, even thought the room was big and clean, the air conditioning was terrible. The room remained at 72 degrees even though we set it to cool down as much as possible. There was only one little vent that blew out a little cool air. That being said, the room was stuffy and we were not able to get a good night's sleep. The majority of the staff was very kind (especially the bellmen and concierge), the check in agent was cold. She made it seem like she was doing us a big favor with an early check-in when we were checking in at 3:00pm. 3:00pm check in isn't that early if you ask me. Anyway, all in all, it was fine. But the rating sure goes down when the room you're in makes you sweat all night from lack of AC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: JessNY
Reviews.Content: I consider myself to be fairly picky when it comes to hotels. Are the staff welcoming? Are the rooms clean? What about value? I'd say the Hyatt Regency in Boston has most everything covered. We traveled in late August, having booked our room as part of a wedding block. When we arrived, the valet parking staff was very accomodating. A bellhop assisted us with our huge collection of luggage (you never travel light with children!). The woman at the front desk was very friendly. Our room was in a great corner location. You could tell that the housekeeping staff had really cleaned prior to our arrival. I've stayed plenty of times in hotels where you could tell housekeeping had barely given the room a once-over, but this wasn't the case here. The only downside to the hotel were some of the charges that seem to go along with lodging in downtown Boston. Parking was $43 a day -- now, I gladly opted for valet since it allowed us to come in and out as we pleased. But the price hurt. Also, with tip, it cost us $50 for two to eat at the breakfast buffet...ouch. Fortunately the food was excellent. Also, for what we paid, I'd expect free wi-fi. I'm not sure why some of the budget chain hotels offer this service for free, but an upscale chain such as Hyatt doesn't. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again. The staff couldn't have been nicer and the room was very comfortable. The location, steps away from Boston Common and Boston Public Garden, Macy's, Chinatown, and the Theater District, make the price of staying downtown worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: MWHE
Reviews.Content: I use this hotel for business and thought it would be a good place to stay with my family during a trip to New England. At best its average... rooms ok, service ok just, breakfast poor, location poor as well. Booking again I'd go down by the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: love2travel1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Boston for 7 days. The hotel was clean and elegant and the staff was friendly and helpful. We had a standard room and the bed was really soft. The location was convenient to everywhere in the city. I would definitely come back to this Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Hyatt Regency Boston”
Reviews.Author: ItsmeDanielle
Reviews.Content: Came here on a spur of the moment "girls weekend" road trip. Check-in was a breeze. I found the staff very friendly and the hotel spotless. My ONLY complaint would be that we found the men who work the valet parking to be sort of rude and really hard to understand. Good location. Close to bars, restaurants, cafes, and Boston Commons. We only stayed for one night and spent very little time in the room, but when we did we were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: dh8_1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Boston on 07/31/09 for 3 days and I have to tell you that this was by far the best Hyatt ever. The staff was amazing and the location is absolutely the best. You can walk pretty much everywhere and it is connected to a Macy's (wife had a little too much shopping done). The food and service in the restaurant was also great. I would totally come back to this Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, smart, bland, safe, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AnotherEnglishman
Reviews.Content: Just another typical high end hotel in the Hyatt chain. Comfortable, smart, good service, and a really great location - 2 blocks to Chinatown, one block to the Common. Having negotiated the rates for a small Corporate event, they upgraded me to small suite (no bribery and corruption involved, I didn't know they were going to!) so I can't comment on the bulk of the rooms - but the view from the 21st floor is great and the suite was comfortable (though the bathroom surprisingly small). Great gym and pool! My real complaint against the higher end chain hotels is that you get nickel-and-dimed on stuff I take for granted in "Business-class". Courtyard By Marriott has free coffee on tap and free wi-fi, so why does a "better" hotel charge for this?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: flycake99
Reviews.Content: We visited Boston during Thanksgiving weekend in 2008. We got a good deal from Priceline for $64. The location was great, close to everything. Easy walk from the bus\train station. Chinatown was just right next to the hotel and we loved going to China town to get something to eat at late night. The room was nice for the price we paid. The city view from our window was just excellent. The front desk staff was friendly but the concierge was cold. I will definitely stay here again is the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Business Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hernfam
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hyatt. Great location - close to Commons, T, museums and historical sites. Used points for the room. The room was comfortable but with 2 kids it got a little crowded. We spent most of the time sightseeing. The pool and workout facilities were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: courtlady
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hyatt using Priceline & got it for $63 a night! This hotel was probably 3 1/2 star hotel, but for the price... We got there early & the room was ready so we checked in before noon & had the day to start sightseeing. We were on the floor w/ the pool so sometimes it was a little noisy in the room. The room was clean, nothing fancy. The staff were quite friendly but the concierge was not so helpful when we asked about difference restaurants. Other than that, it was in a convenient location & great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Service, Super Value, Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelation3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel at the last minute when we decided to celebrate the 4th July in Boston. I had never been to the city before and this seemed like a good location - in fact it could not have been better. So close to everything that we walked almost everywhere and having the T stations (metro/subway) a short walk away was a bonus - we used it to get to and from the airport and found it efficient, safe, easy and cheap. The hotel staff were wonderful throughout - very friendly, professional and helpful. The hotel was full due to the holiday and we saw no signs of stress from that, except for the elevators which had some maintenance issues. No big deal really. The rooms were spacious and nicely furnished with a comfortable bed. It was a hot weekend and the A/C worked sufficiently well. Breakfast was inlcuded in our rate and we enjoyed the buffet and service. The pool was indoor and unattractive but the fitness center looked OK. As tourists only there for a few days, we were more focused on accessibility to the city and room comfort than hotel amenities, so what they had was more than adequate for us. We found no fault with housekeeping or cleanliness. It was super value and a pleasant stay in every way. We recommend the restaurants/bars Kingston Station and Max & Dylan's which were both close by. All in all, a great trip and a very enjoyable stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One night stopover”
Reviews.Author: MosesGloucestershire
Reviews.Content: Thia was just a one night stop, selected by our agent. A very comfortable hotel, we had a standard room and the bed was brilliantly soft. All usual amenities, helpful staff. pleasant bar staff etc. Only downer is the area, which seems a bit neglected and we couldn't see any restaurants (other than a few Chinese) in the area.

Reviews.Title: “def would return!”
Reviews.Author: babieblue5254086
Reviews.Content: hi, i have read all the reviews and they are a bit mixed.We have just stayed there n i have to say it 's great.Its a central location - we hired a car and left it back 4 days early as parking is so expensive-unless u have to dont hire a car-otherwise park it in the place out in front of the hotel its the cheapest we checked them all i have the sore feet to prove it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bluebirds277
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here for 4 nights. It's in a great location for first-time visitors to Boston like us. It's only a two-block walk to Boston Commons and 2 or 3 subway stations. We were able to walk or ride to all the sights we wanted to see. We had a corner king room on the 21st floor. It was spacious, clean and quiet. We also had the "Awaken Package" which included a full buffet breakfast each morning. I don't know what the hotel was charging for the buffet, but the selection and quality of food were pretty good and service was very good. We had dinner at the hotel one night and had the opposite experience - poor service and so-so food. In general, we found the hotel staff to be helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel30
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on this hotel via expedia and only stayed one night. This hotel is too large and claustrophobic as well as tatty around the edges. We got a room with a faulty shower and had to switch rooms. I took forever for someone to come with the key for the new room and after we had hike down the endless corridorss and up two floors we discoverde that the key did not work. Wwe never really got an apology from anyone and were late going out for dinner which was irritating. The room appeared to be clean enough but very dark and dingey, not at all inviting. I wouldn't stay again and much preferred the Hilton on our last visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Paper Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: cmatthewr
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to write reviews on travel sites so I'll keep it brief. 1. The walls at this hotel are paper thin. The people in the room next to us were talking at normal levels and we could hear their entire conversations. 2. Air conditioning - The air conditioning can only be set down to 67 degrees. We set it at 67 in the room but the room still felt like it was 75. It was an early summer 75 degree day. I was so uncomfortable I slept without any blankets. What's worse is that when the AC kicks in it make a loud sound so it wakes you up every time it blows air. 3. TV - The TV is set to only go up to a certain volume level (my guess is due to the thin walls). This was a minor annoyance. 4. If you like elevators, you'll love this hotel - In order to get to the ground level you have to take two sets of elevators. It's a pain because you often have to wait for the lower level elevators. They have stairs but when we asked we were told they were for "emergency use only".

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: chrissyMarie2981
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel this past Saturday... The service was awful! We had a bachelorette party and rented 4 rooms and a Suite. So needless to say we were spending a lot of money here. We all met in the Suite before going out. The hotel came to our room at 9:30 pm with a noise complaint. Everyone immediately left the room and went back to there own room. We decided we could meet out front. I was very nice to the hotel staff that came up to give the complaint. I apologized for this and let them know this would not happen again. We got ready and went out. When we came back we saw that they had come into our room and took the alcohol we had. That's stealing. We are all in our 30's not 12 years old. Then when checking out they charged us to comp the room next to us.. We only got one complaint and then left. There were not multiple complaints.. We were guests also. If there had been multiple complaints I totally would understand! Besides all of this the people working here were extremely rude all over. There are way to many hotels to stay at in the city to be treated like this. NOT WORTH STAYING HERE!

Reviews.Title: “misrepresented”
Reviews.Author: KPaCanada
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have written a review- because I am so disappointed with this room. I am in Boston for a short business trip and was looking forward to a couple of nights in a hotel. I generally stay in nice hotels when on business, with a little touch of luxury especially in the bath amenities, and I like a good gym. The Hyatt website describes their "elegant granite bath" in each room as well as pointing out the presence of a large flat screen tv in each room. Well, the flat screen tv is any old regular tv with a screen that happens to be flat. do not think that it will be LCD or a thin flat screen. And the bath is NOT granite. It is a regular, smallish bath with a granite COUNTER next to it. The mini bar seems to be quite hostile- there are sensors on each item and the room is charged as soon as an item is moved. Internet is available but at cost via T-mobile. AND- there is no safe in the room, which for a 4 star hotel that charges 200$/night is unacceptable. I am worried about going to see the gym. All in all a very ordinary room that is probably fine to sleep in but not 4 star, and not as described on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VenturaTraveler13
Reviews.Content: This is a "nothing special" (especially for a Hyatt) but very serviceable hotel. The lobby is several floors above street level and serviced by only three elevators. We usually had to wait to enter or leave the hotel. The location is a couple of blocks from Boston Commons, a 15 minute walk to Quincy market in one direction or the theater district in the other. The concierge staff was very friendly and helpful especially with baggage before check in and after check out. The room was average size and very clean. Comfortable bed. Very good views. A small amount of black mold in the shower and the bathroom ceiling was cracked. Minor cosmetic problems. We were on the 19th floor which has an atrium like opening to the 20th floor. Nice design element, but results in noise from two floors. And, for some reason, the room doors closed with an almost explosion like noise. Enough to be bothersome. The in-room internet was intermittent at best. All in all, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and room for the price”
Reviews.Author: srauhala
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in Boston overnight as part of our anniversary. I was just looking for something in a decent location at a resonable price. We didn't want to spend a lot, it was more of a place to sleep so we didn't have to worry about driving home after a few cocktails. So I tried Priceline and got the Hyatt Regency for $75 on my first bid. For the money I could not complain. The hotel is in a good location. It is about a 15-20 min walk to Faneuil Hall and a couple blocks over from the Boston Common. It is also not far from multiple T stops and the Back Bay area. It is in a really convenient area for those looking to visit both areas. Like everyone has said in past reviews it does have an odd setup. You take an elevator to the lobby and then a different elevator to your room. We never found this to be a real issue and it only added an extra 30 seconds or so to getting to street level. Check-in was easy and fast. We were able to check-in when we got there at 2pm with no problem. We were off to our room in less than 5 mins. The room was a very nice, standard hotel room. We had a king size bed that had nice sheets and a feather mattress topper. Overall the room was very clean, except for some hair my wife found in the shower later. The TV could of used a few more channels but it sufficed. Our view was pretty much the roof of buildings next door but it wasn't bad. The next morning there were some slamming doors but other than that it was nice and quiet. Overall, for $75 ($92 after fees/taxes) it was great!! For that price in Boston just about any room would be worth it. So for what we wanted and for the price it was great. If you can get the price we did, or close to it, I would definitley recommend it. One tip for those with a car, park in the Boston Common parking garage. We got there just before 2pm and left around 10am the next day. Total price = $22. It was a good 15 min walk back to our car but it was half the price of what the hotel charged.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice location, quiet on the weekends”
Reviews.Author: Angelinas74
Reviews.Content: If you can get a deal on Priceline, then this is a great hotel to stay in. It's not a 4-star hotel by any means, but the fitness center and pool are top notch. Rooms are clean, service is nice and the entire place smells like gardenia (which got to be disconcerting after 3 days). Here's the biggest complaint - the elevators. You have to take two different elevators to get to your room. There's the one that gets you to the lobby, then the one that takes you to the rooms. When it's dinner time and everyone's trying to make their reservations in time, it's quite annoying trying to escape the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: USO2000
Reviews.Content: Old, but nice hotel. Very clean comfortable rooms. I loved thier shamoo/soap with honey/ginger flavor. We were staying with 2 kids for 2 nights in a room with included 2 continental breakfasts. They gave us 4 breakfast vouchers for duration of our stay during check-in. We asked if they coudl give two more vouchers for kids, they said no. Well, fair enough, we knew about it when booked the hotel, but gave it a shot and though it woudl be nice for them to add vouchers for entire family. Next morning, we went to have breakfast and waiter actually let us have 4 full breakfasts using only use 2 contintneal vauchers , very nice. Second morning we were not that luckey, another waiter didi everything by the book and charged us two additional breakfasts. Other thatn that, hotel is in fantastic location, has nice indoor pool, sauna and gym. I woudl stay in this hotel in a future,

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay if you can get the right price”
Reviews.Author: calibear314
Reviews.Content: Pros - Got the hotel via hotwire so the price and timing was right - GREAT location in downtown Boston, next to everything - Great conference facility - Rooms were comfortable, if small Cons - On-site Parking is expensive and a pain - Rooms were a bit smallish - Service unspectacular, yet not atrocious Stayed here for a business trip recently. Got the hotel on the cheap via hotwire and for the value itself, well-worth it. First off, location is king. Next to Downtown crossing and the only challenge is it DOES get expensive because of parking. Its automated parking and it cost at least $25 for an overnight stay. While rooms up-to-date with comforters and a well-maintained marble bathroom, it was slightly smaller compared to what I'm used to. Bathrooms were adequate, not wonderful, not worn. The rooms and bathrooms were built for business travelers it seems. Hallways and public areas were well-maintained and it made me feel comfortable. I didn't use the restaurants in the hotel so cannot say much about it but considering I could walk outside and eat anywhere, not a big deal. I've stayed at the Nine-Zero (spelling?) and Westin before in the area and have to say that this one was the best value if you can get your price. I do think the Westin's location is much better but either way, I'd still recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not that Great, NO 4 Star that's for sure!”
Reviews.Author: nicksheehan
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Boston the see the Sox and were looking for a place to stay and considered Priceline as we have many times as most rooms in Boston are expensive. We won the Hyatt Regency Boston (4 star) for $77.00. The hotel is quite confusing as others have said as the lobby is not on the main level it is on the 3rd floor. Upon entering our room it was not cleaned very well, there was a Snapple bottle on the floor and a piece of paper with a woman's lipstick on it, the shower head did not work and the air conditioner did not work in the room as the room temperature skyrocketed, no one ever came to look at anything they just left us hanging. The pool is another story, it was very dirty you could not even see the bottom of the pool (very cloudy) with hair floating everywhere, the tile floor was falling apart and rust everywhere. Bottom line is for $77.00 it was not bad however the room temperature and the maintenance issues and the room being dirty I hope were just an oversight and not all are this way. Overall hotel is not too bad but not worthy of 4 stars and not in a very nice part of town. If you get a good rate and are just looking for a bed, not bad but not 4 stars! On a side not do be careful, they charge you for everything

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: mr621
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt last Memorial day weekend, 2008. I thought we had written a review, but figured better late than never. We were content with our choice of hotel, for we got a pretty good deal. After parking in the lot, pricey, but expected, we went to check in. The room was not ready at about 2:00 when we got there. No big deal, they were happy to hold our luggage as we walked around a town we hadn't been to. I knwo Boston is a walking city and we certainly made true of that. This hotel was an easy walk to Boston Commons in one direction and Fanieull Hall in the other. We certainly made our way around most of the city though. Located in downtown, at night it was a little sketchy, but we walked safely, even late. After we were able to check in, we went to a room that was occupied. Not a big deal, the front desk people took care of us. The room had a decent downtown view, and a pretty comfy bed. The fitness center was a little small for me, but an average hotel center. The pool was pretty nice, separated by glass from the fitness center. The employees were all friendly, especially the doormen. The Hyatt was very clean. We had breakfast included in our stay. It wasn't bad, but I don't know if it would be worth paying for on its own. To summarize, for the price we got, which may still have been high, the hotel was not bad. If we go back to Boston, we will probably try and stay closer to the Prudential center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but some rip-offs”
Reviews.Author: eiamjw
Reviews.Content: Big comfortable modern room (King-size), but some niggles. The bedside lamp didn't work (not plugged in and no power socket that it could reach(; a ridiculously expensive minibar with electronic monitoring; iinternat access via t-mobile is expensivel no business centre; 5-10 minutes to get outside from the rooms, via two lifts; in-house restaurant extraordinarily expensive; not much in the immediate vicinity, apart form a Macy's, and Boston Common, so it's 10-15 minutes walk to Quincy Market, or to the nearest bar or restaurant (except Chinatown). Downtown Crossing metro station is close by, so it's quite convenient to get to via public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great For City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: westinhyatt
Reviews.Content: The HYATT Regency was a very comfortable. The rooms were nice they had marble bathrooms and great views over Boston. We stay at HYATT's a lot and got a voucher for room service. We ordered it and it never came twice. In the end we got late checkout instead. Otherwise service was great. Staff were freindly.The location is in the Financial District which is good for business. It is in easy walking distance of Copley Square and Beacon Hill and 2 blocks away from Boston Common.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: BrownBalto
Reviews.Content: My 17 year old daughter and I stayed at the hotel as we searched for colleges in Boston for her. Although not near the colleges, it is near most lines of the T and was therefore very convenient to public transportation. It is also close to South Station (rail and bus). The rooms were comfortable, as were the beds. They were not huge rooms but had all the amenities that we needed. The hotel restaurant is very good. It is near the theaters, but there is not much else going on in the area at night, but that was not a problem for us. One minor quibble is that there were not many TV stations. Otherwise, we were very happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy with thin walls”
Reviews.Author: rollocst
Reviews.Content: While the Hyatt had very comfortable and clean rooms in a convenient location, I cannot recommend it. The walls are paper thin. I stayed for three nights and the first night I had a room that had a door to an adjoining room. Between the paper thin walls and the huge gap under the adjoining room door, I could hear a normal conversation clearly. Unfortunately the conversation started well after midnight. When an alarm clock went unattended at 5 AM I packed up and switched rooms immediately. I'll give the staff credit for reacting to the limitations of the hotel but nothing makes up for lost sleep. After moving to a room without adjoining doors, I once again had trouble on Saturday night with young partying guests. I'd imagine they were Priceline customers like I was but it doesn't excuse the noise in the hotel. A security sweep by the hotel quieted down a party in the room next to me at 2:30 AM. But I had to call when people from the room were loitering in from of my door. People were making noise in the halls and slamming doors all night. It didn't help that several floors have a big open atrium so you can hear the noise from all of those floors. I can't imagine someone paying full price for this noisy hotel let alone the Priceline rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: TPXB
Reviews.Content: We won this hotel on Priceline and I wasn't too sure about it, because I'm not real familiar with the brand. It was a great hotel from the check-in to the concierge. It is very much a convention style hotel and it is very typical of it's class. I have stayed in Boston at least a half a dozen times and I felt that this hotel had the most options for bars and food close by. The ability to walk to a restaurant or place to hang out really made this hotel for us. We did not use the parking garage, but parked in the Boston Commons Garage and probably saved $60.

Reviews.Title: “For the deal we got it was worth it.”
Reviews.Author: adina11486
Reviews.Content: I would first, suggest to go to priceline.com and see if you can get this hotel through their website. I would say for the price we got on this hotel i feel that we truely got a deal. Guest service was excellent. No complaints in that area. The location was ideal. However parking is expensive and would suggest public parking, it is really not much of a difference than valet parking. Public parking is 30 dollars vs. the 43 dollars plus tip for the valet parking. It's per night, so the savings does add up if you staying there for longer than a night. We order room service, which is on the expensive side also. I would suggest not to eat in the hotel. The food is not worth the price. All in all it was a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par for 4-star hotel & thin walls”
Reviews.Author: funseeker
Reviews.Content: This did not meet my expectations for a Hyatt. The biggest problem was that the walls were PAPER thin, and I could hear every throat clearing and interlude from my next door neighbor's room. The hallways reeked of cheap, toxic deodorizor. It was a rip-off that the internet cost $.50/minute in the business center, and from what I could see, there were even charges for in-room wi-fi if you had your own laptop (though I did not try it). The wallpaper was peeling in the bathroom and the sink clogged up when I brushed my teeth. Just was not up to par for a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Confusing layout, but comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: eminbk
Reviews.Content: It was the conference hotel, so I stayed there. The layout of the function rooms and lobby and elevators was confusing -- it was hard to find my way around the hotel. The restaurant in the hotel was expensive and a little iffy. We had to send seafood back because it was spoiled. There were weird lags in service in the restaurant. But there are plenty of restaurants in Boston; there's no need to eat at theirs. Wifi is $10/day. Beds and room were comfortable; bathroom was nice; everything was clean and well-organized; personnel were pleasant. Overall decor is soothing and stylish.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: travelerer
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Hyatt Downtown and thought it was great. The doorman was right there to carry my luggage all the way from the street to the lobby and asked if I would need it brought to my room. Great start! The reason for the two sets of elevators is for security purposes. The hotel wants to see who is coming and going to the rooms. One night I had to show my key to get on the second set of elevators to the rooms. This is a good thing. Check in was very pleasant and professional. I got the room through Priceline so I was expecting a view of the alley but what a pleasant surprise when I got a room on the 20th floor with a tremendous view of the financial district and the inner harbor islands. It was very nice and I was really happy to have it. The bed was super comfortable, the bathroom was fully stocked with products (even toothpaste). The best part of the hotel though is the gym. While not everyone looks for this when they travel, if you like to work out this gym had everything! This hotel was very nice. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: mdean38
Reviews.Content: Every time I use priceline's "Name your own price" I always manage to get this property. I always get it for $50-$80 range. However it says 4 star. I feel like its more of a 3 1/2 star property. The hotel is extremely convenient to MBTA (Downtown Crossing and Boylston Street Stop). The staff is extremely pleasant and helpful.This hotel always caters to my bed requests every time I book through priceline no questions asked. Rooms are always very clean and well appointed. The beds are very comfortable. Room service is always good. The breakfast buffet is definitely overpriced however pretty good. I never use the hotel parking because of how ridiculously overpriced it is. There is plenty of parking else around the property that is much cheaper. Internet unfortunately isn't complementary. Overall this a great hotel for what you pay on priceline. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, ideal location and the very best staff !”
Reviews.Author: ady111
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel very frequently, and every single time, my experience has been fabulous. The hotel is right in the downtown area and 5 min. walk from South Station which really helps me as I frequently take the train from/to New York. The rooms are really nice, bathrooms and linen really clean and above all else, the staff is some of the most friendly I have ever come across, rifht from the front desk to the concierge and housekeeping. Samir Boukhari, the front desk manager is delightfully courteous and has always gone out of his way to help and make my stay very comfortable every single time. Dianna, Aruna and Lexi at the front desk and Anthony with the concierge are wonderful as ever. I would stay here as long as business/pleasure keeps taking me into Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hyatt Regency I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at many Hyatt's in different cities/countries. This one definitely left an impression, a very bad one. Dirty carpet, really old furniture. The whole room looks like it hasn't been cleaned properly. You can find a super-8 motel that was better than this. Stay away....

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough. Good location. General complaint about "upscale" hotel charges.”
Reviews.Author: peregrino
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine has a Holiday Inn franchise and I asked him why the "upscale" hotels such as the Hyatt Regency and a Sheraton I stayed in recently don't offer the amenities such as free internet access and a decent (though in some cases limited) free breakfasts that "downscale" motels such as Super 8 do. I figure that if a place charges three or four times as much it doesn't need to add on a fee for internet access and could afford to give you at least a banana and cold cereal for breakfast. He really didn't have any explanation other than "Those are the rules of the franchisor." In my opinion, those rules will cost these chains a lot of money in the long run. For a business traveler on an expense account, four or five dollars for an internet connection might not matter, nor would paying an additional eight or ten dollars for breakfast. For someone traveling for pleasure, or with a family, then it does make a difference. Whether you're saving $12 or $15 (which is what I figure the cost for three would be for a typical "continental" breakfast of muffin, juice, coffee and cereal--such as that served by Super 8 or Days Inn) or $30 (which I figure the free hot breakfast for three that we had at a Holiday Inn Expressin St. John NB, complete with waitress service, was worth, at a minimum), those amenities add up. That general complaint aside, this was an adequate three star hotel with a weird entrance, through a parking garage and up an elevator to get to the lobby. There's no real street entrance for pedestrians. Maybe that's because parking is an additional $45 and parking rather than walking is encouraged The beds were comfortable, the room clean and the staff pleasant. The downtown area is compact enough so that you can get anywhere you want in downtown Boston from this hotel, but you could also do that from any other downtown hotel. The neighborhood the hotel is in does have theaters (it is, after all, the theater district) but the few little stores and shops around close early. We ended up here by way of one of the "we choose where you end up" online bookers, and as such were satisfied with our stay. I think that the rack rate is a bit steep, but probably nobody ever pays that anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4 stars!”
Reviews.Author: akdp
Reviews.Content: The only great thing about the hotel is the location. It is close to Chinatown, the Theater District, Boston Common and Quincy Market. However, the staff was not very accommodating, parking cost us a fortune ($35 for an overnight spot in the public lot next to the hotel - the other choice was $43 for the hotel valet), and the hotel lobby and guest rooms definitely need to be updated. All in all, this hotel definitely does not deserve its four stars... I'd only recommend it if you can get a really great rate and/or you only care about the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: slumberdudes
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is a good hotel - not a 4 star - but a solid 3 star. Location is very good, walk 2-4 blocks to theater district, 2 blocks to Boston Common, 10-15 min walk to State House, 15 min walk to Fanieul Hall. Subway stop is 5 minutes away (Green Line/Red Line). Hotel has a little age showing - but rooms were clean, comfy beds. Rooms were average city rooms (smallish). Check in was easy, staff was very good with one exception . A mix up with room service - order wasn't complete, no condiments and a call from room service that there wasn't a credit card on file??? - were ultimately resolved but unnecessary. Gym was average with 5 bikes/5 treadmills/5 elliptical and good selection of weight machines etc. Pool was average size, but shallow which worked well with kids. Not enough chairs around pool. Booked thru Priceline for $75 plus tax. The hotel was well worth it and if it weren't for the cold it would be a very good place to see the city from.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible, but not perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ZaiZaiLv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hyatt for 7 days for $100/night through Priceline. I personally think we overpaid. I wouldn't consider this specific Hyatt a four star hotel. It's nice, but not four star hotel nice. Pros: - Location, location, location. First of all, I must note that it's very easy to navigate around Boston by foot or public transportation. Hyatt is only a block away from Boston Common, and T stations, so it's very easy to get everywhere from Hyatt. It's also very close to shops, restaurants, Dunkin Donut and CVS (I don't how many of these are in Boston, but it seems like every block has at least one of these). - Customer Service. I'm going to list this under pro and also con, and I will explain why. Concierge was very helpful, and very professional. This was our first trip to Boston, so we didn't know where to go, what to do, etc. We stopped by concierge literarly every day. They were very helpful and very patient in answering all questions we had. We especially loved Mike. We had the same lady who came and cleaned our room everyday. We met her on the first day. She was always friendly. I wish I had gotten her name. - Comfy Hyatt bed. Self explanatory. - Room size is pretty good. A lot of time when we book through discount sites, we usually end up with smaller room. We were able to fit our four suitcases in the room without any problems (we don't pack light). Cons: - For the first few days we were there, the hotel was not packed, so we were in and out of elevators fast. However, as it got crowded, elevators were very very slow. I don't know what exactly can be done about this and how this complaint may help, but this was one of the annoyance we encountered, especially when we were trying to check out with our four suitcases. It took us a while to get down to the lobby. - The lobby is NOT on the first floor. This was so confusing to us. We got to the hotel at midnight due to flight delay, and there was no door man, so it took us a while before we figured out that we had to go up to the lobby to check in. Considering I live on Tripadvisor, I should probably have been aware of this fact. My only excuse is, the long flight left me exhausted to think straight. - One of the elevators broke down while we were in it. We were stuck in an elevator for good 10 mins.Picture a very close space with a bunch of people you don't know and crying children. Despite pushing the emergency button, no one came to our rescue. The elevator door opened up to a WALL. We kept on pushing the button, until it finally opened up back to the lobby, however, we had to jump up to reach the floor since it didn't actually stop on the "right" floor if you know what I mean. Only then, the service people noticed and came running to our rescue. The elevator was then closed down for repair for the rest of our stay there. - Is there a doorman? Not sure. Sometimes there's someone there, but most of the time there wasn't. We only encountered 2, neither was friendly. They seemed to be bored perhaps they're were too cold to crack a smile. I don't need anyone opening the door for me, but it'll be nice to get a "hello" at least when you walk by them instead of them pretending you don't exist. - Bathroom is on the smaller size, however, this seems to be the trend in a lot of hotels, so even though I'm listing this under con, I'm giving this one a pass. Overall, it was a good stay. It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't anything to brag about either. Will I stay there again? If the price is right, yes, sure. However, I would not pay a four star hotel price to stay here. My suggestion will be to shop around if you decide to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not up to 4-star quality”
Reviews.Author: jtolson32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed overnight at the Hyatt. I am a big Hyatt fan most of the time, but I was not impressed in this case. Check-in was a total mess. The hotel was not ready for the number of customers checking in before dinner time. We had stopped by earlier to drop of a bag, which I am glad I did since the hotel did not have rooms ready for a lot of people at 5pm even though check-in is at 4. The room was very nice. The room had an out dated TV with no remote which was the only negative I can think of. We called to get a corkscrew sent up, and it didn't come for over an hour so we left for dinner. We also got charged for something in the mini bar which we never opened. The elevators and lobby also needed some refurburishing. We did have the breakfast buffet in the morning which came free with our room package. The service was great and the food choice was excellent. However, they did not have a chef to cook things on the spot which I really like to have. Even though it was nice I don't think it would be worth the regular price someone would have to pay. Overall the location was great for the going to a show in Boston. There are a lot of hotels right in the area. I think I would try a different one next time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: Bletchingleyone
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Regency Hyatt in Downtown Boston for 5 days early this month and having read some earlier reviews I was a little wary. We absolutely loved it there. From the minute that we arrived the staff were faultless, efficient and friendly. We had a corner room on the 15th floor which was HUGE and really well decorated and spotlessly clean. The bed was the best we had ever slept in and the sheets were crisp and bright white. Very central right in the middle of the theatre district and adjoining Chinatown and just 5 minutes walk to Boston Common....Absolutely fabulous stay...DO NOT LISTEN TO ANYBODY ELSE

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: trammell
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston in November for a tradeshow. I have never been to Boston and it was quite an experience. I probably won't return unless I have to for work again, the city is a gridlock and although very beautiful and lots of history, not worth the pain of traffic. We stayed at the Hyatt, a few minor problems checking in but we survived. The rooms were clean and and spacious. I did get into a handicap room which always is a little bigger but they place the handicap rooms close to the elevators [for obvious reasons] so you could hear the elevators go up and down 24/7. The lighting in the bathroom absolutely stinks, especially for women! The bar/lounge area is decent and the waitstaff seemed very friendly and helpful. The dining area was okay, I really enjoyed the breakfast buffet. The gift shop is way overpriced although I didn't venture to any stores outside of the hotel so I don't know if that was the norm or not. We did go to Cheers and I must say it is a nice 10 minute walk and well worth it! The place is great and the people are awesome there! We also went to a oyster bar called Oceanside. I would highly recommend this place! There is a theatre within a block of the Hyatt and I really would have like to see the Nutcracker but it had not opened yet. Overall the stay was good and uneventful. I would recommend this hotel to any business/leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Bostonian29
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The location is great for the theatre district and downtown crossing. It's very centrally located for touring the rest of Boston as well. Very convenient to the T (trains) at Downtown Crossing and Park Street. It's a little bit dated in the elevators and public spaces, but the rooms are very nice, recently updated. One annoyance is that there is no outside entrance into the lobby of the hotel. From the street level, you have to take one set of elevators to the lobby, then cross the lobby and take another set of elevators to the room. The elevators are slow, so this can be annoying if you just want to get back to the room quickly. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They even gave us early check-in on Friday at noon, and a late checkout on Sunday (2pm) which is much later than most hotels allow. The bed was great...one of the more comfortable I've slept in. My only complaint is that housekeeping didn't refill the coffee supplies for us, which isn't much to complain about. Also...a parking tip. Parking at the hotel is very expensive. Post Office Square, nearby, has a weekend special, check the prices here: http://www.posquare.com/

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sonic8899
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location. The T is close by and near Boston Common and theater District. The rooms are excellent and the bed was huge and soft. The only negative is there is a fee for wireless access and parking is expensive. This is definitely a full service hotel if that is what you are looking for. If you can get a good rate, then it makes this hotel worth it for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “It was fun”
Reviews.Author: Maine1088
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Boston last weekend, to celebrate my birthday. Got a good deal on priceline, and we were not disappointed! Great location as far as being local to everything. We walked from the hotel to the aquarium, Quincy Market, the North End and the commons without any problem at all. Felt extremely safe too. While not the fanciest hotel we have stayed at, I do have to say that they have the absolute most comfortable beds I have ever slept in! Big and cushy, plenty of pillows, it was like sleeping in a cloud. Another plus was the hotel concierge. I wish I could remember his name, because he was an absolute gem! Very friendly, funny and a wealth of information. They should be proud of his service there. We love coming to Boston, and while we usually take what we find on priceline, I would be happy to recommend the Hyatt to anyone coming to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Good location”
Reviews.Author: Diannebat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt while on a business trip and decided to stay a couple of extra days and bring the family along. At the last minute, I realized I had forgotten to make arrangements for our newest family member, the little fuzzball doggie (novice dog owner). While perusing the web-site, I discovered that this is actually a pet-friendly hotel so we brought our fur-baby along. The service could not have been better! The staff were very accomodating, and even learned my dog's name so when we went out for our walks they said hello to him. (Short walk to Boston Commons = Doggie Heaven). The conceirge recommended a very nice local restaurant that we loved. Upon checkout, we forgot a couple of items (including a digital camera). When we arrived home, we contacted house-keeping and all our items were returned to us via fed-ex. (Honestly, I never thought I would see any of that stuff again)! I can't say enough about how friendly and helpful they were at this hotel. I do agree with the comments about the parking, it was $43/day which seems very steep considering the price of the rooms. One additional negative feature is the need to take multiple elevators to reach your room (first to the lobby, which try as I may, I could not locate a staircase for this one story trip) and the second from the lobby to your room.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: nickanon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a wedding in Boston. We contacted the hotel and received a GREAT rate for a two night stay. A king bed with all the works on the 15th floor with a great view. The restaurants in-house were wonderful. Walking distance to Quincy Market and all the historic sites and a block or two from the Commons. Taking the "T" was great. A very clean and efficient subway system with very friendly people. A new system which is all computerized. The BAD: their in-house parking was expensive for 24 hours. There is no need for them to charge so much when people are guests of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay over July 4th Weekend”
Reviews.Author: 345park
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spend 3 nights at the hotel over July 4th weekend. We had a great weekend and would deffinitly stay at the Hyatt again (depending on price). We received an excellent rate using AAA that was the lowest rate for any 4 star hotel in the downtown that weekend. The location is average, very close to the subway and walkable to the rest of the city. I think next time I would like to stay at the Marriott near the Warf to be closer to the north end (my favorite part of Boston). It's about a 15 minute walk to Copley and 10 minutes to the big dig. The room was above average and had a good city view. Not much noise from the adjoining room or outside the door. We kept the TV on when we were in the room so that usually drowns out most of the noise. The bathrooms are average for a four stay property. The curved shower curtain rod and upgraded shower head was a nice touch but the space is a bit small. We both paid for 60 minute massages in the Hyatt health club. I made the arrangements using the Hyatt online concierge without a problem. We both had some background noise from the pool and workout equipment during our treatments but we still really enjoyed the massages.

Reviews.Title: “There are better locations”
Reviews.Author: SEE1981
Reviews.Content: I am going to Boston again this summer and won't be staying at the Hyatt. If you are a business traveler it is a good solution, but for personal travel. The location is not as desirable as others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK for 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: skgator1
Reviews.Content: Got the hotel at a good price through priceline.com. Would not have been happy if hotel was at a rack rate or similar. The location was fantastic though, a block from the Freedom Trail. Parking is very expensive as it is Boston, $32.00 to park it yourself, $41.00 for them to valet. The rooms are small and nothing special. The amenities are nothing special either. It was an average hotel, nothing spectacular but clean and in a great location. Not worthy of 4 stars, more like a 3 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “A little less than expected”
Reviews.Author: dapfunk187
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Boston because we had enough Gold Passport points to get a free night, otherwise, we wouldn't have because the going rate of $259 per night was way beyond our budget. When we arrived, we were presented with the opportunity to either valet park with in-and-out privileges for $46 per day or just use the public parking for $36 per 24 hour period. We elected to save some money by using the public parking because we did not plan to drive around the city. Otherwise, if you do plan to, the valet parking is definitely a better deal. We had no problem finding parking, but were confused when we got off of the elevator to the hotel. There were several options of where to go but no clear directions to the hotel. Eventually we figured it out, but were a little discouraged that we had to take another set of elevators to get to your room...just a little inconvenient if your just trying to get out of the hotel. Otherwise, the entrance, lobby and hallways of the hotel were very nice. The staff was almost overly perky and actually asked the same questions more than once. Overall, good though. We ended up on the 21st floor was provided some pretty decent views. The room was nice enough but nothing spectacular. If I was actually paying the regular rate, I would have been disappointed. The most disappointing part was the bathroom. Although at first glance it looked nice, once I sat down on the toilet, I noticed that there was white paint splattered all over the dark wood portions of the sink/vanity. Then when I jumped in the shower, the grout was clearly discolored. From the ceiling to about half way down the wall, it was white grout, then all of a sudden turned dark gray. It almost appears that they started re-grouting with a different color and never finished but I'm not sure if that's the case. They have a decent bar area but the drinks (of course) are pretty over priced. In the middle of the night, it got hot in our room for some reason so I called the front desk. The offered to have engineering take a look at the unit and also provide a fan. They brought the fan up within minutes and also reset our AC which seemed to have fixed the problem. Overall, I would say that we had a good experience considering we paid nothing, but I must say the bathrooms at the Holiday Inn that we stayed at the night before were cleaner than there's. I would definitely not have paid the full price to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel- but with some problems.”
Reviews.Author: BSA126
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Boston is located in a really sleepy and quiet surrounding area- the only exception being Chinatown. It is a 22 floor building that is grey and red on the outside- not beige like one would expect when looking at the website photo. We stayed here for around 4 nights in June, and it was a OK experience. There were definitely some clear ups, while there were some downs in the experience as well. And lastly, we paid 186 per night for a standard room on the AAA S&N England rate. Check in was not a extremely good experience. However, you do need to know that we were checked in by a staff "in training", and he didn't know all the ropes yet. He didn't know that we had an AAA rate and was supposed to get free breakfast for 2 everyday. We had to make him ask his fellow staff members so that he would know. The lobby looks completely different than the photos on the Hyatt website. It is more dim, with dark brown wood and yellow/beige tones. There are two televisions explaining upgrades you can get for your room. In addition, there is a giant vase of flower arrangements. Not too far from the lobby is Avenue One and the lounge. Our room was 1714- on the 17th floor. The room was OK sized compared to some rooms we have been in, but it was definitely smaller than the norm. Entering the room, there is first a small empty area with a stone table that protrudes out of the wall, and then a closet. To the left, there is the bathroom. Again- the same wood tones (but lighter- more like a walnut) and beige tones were in the room. In addition, there were splashes of silver and blue glass- from the Sony Dream Clock as well as the outdoor label. Some features included a sitting area with a large comfy chair with legrest, a small flower arrangement, magazines on Boston and books as well, a Sony Dream Clock that had a CD player, a writing desk with a modern black, silver, and white lamp, a single cup coffee maker, and lastly a silver CRT TV- I am not sure which brand. It was overall pretty pleasant and warm. Everything functioned well until later on our stay. And also, although we did have a view, most of it was the 93 freeway and the State Street skyscraper. And some rooftops. The floors have an atrium- in which every four floors there is one. It is a weird thing though, that they didn't make the hotel floors atrium, but instead in series of 4's. In addition, near the elevators, there is a sitting area with planters, as well as a silver phone and a window with a view. The bathroom had a granite countertop, as well as a scent fragrance- a bottle, with wood things sticking out. There were the standard Portico Spa Lavender Citrus toiletries, which are always good. Like other reviewers said, the bathroom is small. The right is the sink, the door area (middle) is the toilet, and the left is the shower/tub combo. The showerhead was a Speakman Airstream head, which is also used in some other hotels. Housekeeping was very friendly too. When we asked for extra toiletries, they responded. I did have a complaint on them and that was that the put the pillows on the floor when doing housekeeping- hopefully they changed the sheets before putting them back on the bed! Their health club- the Stay Fit Gym- was also good. To start the workout, you first have to go thru three sets of stairs to the gym! You do need your room key, and once you go down the first set of stairs, you put in your key, open the door, and then there are photos of Hyatts on the east coast. It's called the Hyatt Walk. However, the photos are really old. Then, you go down another set of stairs where there are athletic photos, and then down another set of stairs to the gym. There are a ton of tools for the workout- your elliptical, treadmill, and bicycle cycling are all there. Along with that are yoga balls and weights, as well as harder, more confusing workouts. Complimentary in the gym, you can get filtered water and Koss Headphones to listen to music during your workout. The equipment is all made mainly by Life Fitness, and one Precor eliptical. There is also a pool that is 3 to 5 feet deep. In addition, there are foam boards, in which people use. The health club mainly is busy during the night time- but during noon, it is almost empty. Last but not least, they use Neutrogena toiletries for the shower, and cool, refrigerated towels are provided as well. Our breakfast was really good. It's around a 50 dollar value. There were really interesting things such as cold oatmeal along with jars of condiments such as dried fruit and raisins. In addition, there were 4 types of cereal, great fresh, ripe fruit, pastries, danishes, croissants, and milk at the continental breakfast table. At the main table, there were roasted fingerling potatoes, bacon, sausage, scotch oatmeal, pancakes, a plate of salmon and varieties of cheeses and grapes, and farm raised scrambled eggs. Not only that, they also let you sample a small glass of strawberry smoothie- at least that was what was being offered in June. Our main complaint was that they didn't refill our OJ, which made us thirsty. So- overall right now, it was a good stay. However, we encountered problems. One thing was the AC, which had malfunctioned in our room. The engineers tried to fix it, but it didn't really work. Secondly, we got a pillow which had black marks on it. This truly disgusted us. How could a Hyatt be like this? On such a great, high caliber of hotels, this shouldn't be happening. And so, we transferred hotels later on our stay. Like others have said, the doors are just plain loud! It is confusing why this happens. When a door shuts without you touching it, it makes a loud noise. And lastly, parking at the Hyatt was expensive. Their valet isn't really even a valet- you just left your car in the underground port cochere! They didn't even move it away! And you had to pay 41 dollars for it! That is more than the Intercontinental- which is only 39 a day! Plus, their self parking has no in and out privileges- however the Hyatt Airport, for the same price, does! The only good thing in parking was that the person who helped us was very nice- he shared stories with us on his life and helped us open the doors and luggage. Overall, it's a good hotel. Most people are probably not going to experience things we experienced, and so I recommend it! It is a nice hotel, but it was just plain weird the AC and the pillow would be problematic. It was a good value as the room was low compared to other hotels which are probably the same experience but for twice the price. Also in the factor was that the breakfast was included- and it cost a lot! In conclusion, it's a good hotel- but if you do encounter problems, you need to get help instantly. I'll post photos soon!

Reviews.Title: “All round nice hotel..”
Reviews.Author: cheunggo
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through priceline.com and paid $70 a night. This was a great deal because it was priced at $199 - $299 on the website. Hotel was clean and modern enough. Located in the heart of downtown Boston and sandwiched between Chinatown and the Theatre district, the Hyatt provides easy access point to these two locations as well as to the 'T'. The hotel room was smaller than the Hyatt's I have lived in but the room was nice. The bathroom was smaller than I was used to as well. So, with two people wanting to use the bathroom at once could be quite cramped. However, room was clean, had a coffee making machine, a TV with all channels working (not a flat screen) and equipped with Nintendo 64 gaming (at $7.00 an hour!). Also had a bar, iron and board and a robe to use (if going to use the swimming pool). Decor was slightly 80's style mixed in with the new furniture. One thing to be aware of is the LOUD banging of the doors! Around 9-11pm, 7-9am, you will be woken up for sure by other people so bring some ear-plugs if you are a light sleeper! I got a room on the 16th floor and got nice views around the city. Staff were super friendly at the check-in desk. Couldn't say the same for some of the concierge/bell boys. Other slight criticism is the funny layout of the hotel. You enter the side of the hotel and go down a few steps to the Lower Lobby only to have to go up 3 floors to get to reception and to get to your room. Overall, a nice hotel although slightly weird in design and layout. Great value for money (for what I paid) and location for a great night out in the town. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: boyardee2001
Reviews.Content: good location near Boston Common, Downtown Crossing, Chinatown. walkable to many areas. area seems a lot cleaner from a few years ago. staff very friendly, helpful. room clean, comfortable. not particularly memorable in any way. but no problems. found a weekend special so rate was very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: duomogal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a quick, one-night stay in Boston. Priceline provided a great price for the Hyatt Regency, one block from the Boston Common. We had an above-average experience,at a great price for the location. The block that the hotel is on isn't terribly picturesque, situated at the end of Downtown Crossing, but it's within walking distance of most major spots -- including the theater district, Back Bay, Boston Common and the Public Gardens. Front desk staff was courteous, check in was easy. Our room was small but looked as though it had been recently upgraded, and was attractively furnished. King bed was incredibly comfortable. Anthony, the concierge, was helpful and friendly. There are certainly more luxurious accomodations in Boston, but probably none more attractively priced in such a central location. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service that surpasses the facilities”
Reviews.Author: FairwindTravel
Reviews.Content: 3night stay for a University graduation. Location downtown which has convenience benefits and downtown negatives. Not 5th ave NYC downtown..more like city core ambience. Something that is beyond the hotel's control. Close to Boston Commons and the tour and bus information centre. Walking distance to Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market. Half a block to the T(subway). Washington Street for MOR shopping half a block away. Higher end shopping at Copley Place a short walk away. Older property, well kept and clean and bright. Not renovated to the current Hyatt new look of slate floor and dark woods found in international Hyatt properties. Satisfactory but not outstanding physical plant. Limited F& B. A lobby lounge with small intimate dining room and another larger dining room across the lobby. Street entrance requires navigating a separate elevator from the 2nd floor lobby to ground floor entrance(and the parking lot) Then stairs from there onto the actual street./pedestrian entrance. Not convenient for dragging luggage or strollers but not a severe hindrance. Doormen present to assist. Double room fair size bright and clean. Wired and wireless internet connection for USD9.95/day. Smallish bathroom with good quality toiletries/amenities. Shower/tuib combination. No in room safe. Smallish closet. bank of 6 drawers under the TV. Medium size desk. One chair and round table. Standard coffee maker and bar fridge. Service is what made our stay enjoyable. Front desk staff friendly and warm. Lounge servers and wait staff in dining room were faultless. Too often one asks for something and waits long for the execution or have to remind/re request. Not here ask once it is is done with alacrity. Doormen greeted our exits and entrances genuinely. And when 5 people appeared at the bottom of the stairs at the street entrance with rollerboards and suitcases the lone doorman sprang into action insisting we leave them all for him to bring up. We didnot have to get his attention..he was there for the guests. Two requests for housekeeping was met within half an hour. Too often one waits long much too long. Not at this Hyatt. Other reviewers had remarked on the thinness of the walls. I had to ring Front Desk to ask they have a neighouring room turn down the TV volume. The F.D. said they would send up hotel security. Shortly after the fone rang in the offending room. No change to TV volume. 1 minute or 2 later the fone rings a second time and the TV is turned off. We received a voice message from the duty manager that night to speak with him in the a.m. When I did, he was most apologetic and offered to remove our internet charges and also proffered a full breakfast voucher. I have stayed in hotel rooms where noise was a problem...but the Hyatt's reponse and follow through here was impressive. And their concern for our comfort and satisfaction is indicative of their high service standards. Big city hotels . Downtown hotels too often service their clientele on autopilot and lip service. We never felt that during our stay. Sure the physical plant and surroundings are not stellar. The F& B have to compete in a city of fabulous restuarants. Service is this Hyatts's 4stars.

Reviews.Title: “Weird Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PickyVacationer99
Reviews.Content: Staff were nice enough, rooms were normal, but nothing special. European feel to the hotel. Very strange hotel. Seemed that no other guests were there until 2:30am when were were awoken by our neighbors "bedroom" activities. Common areas were empty. Had a hard time finding the check-in desk, the pool, the door to the outside, the door to get back into the hotel. i guess the hotel needs more signs. There are these long weird corridors that you need to walk down to go anywhere. Hallways seem to go on forever and then have stairs every now and then with no ramps. Not recommended for people who have strollers, people who cannot walk far or climb stairs or who are in wheelchairs. Also was a very powerful aroma in the lobby areas (not in the rooms though) so not advised for people who are sentitive to perfumes. Rooms were acceptable but definitely not what the hotel website describes. Beds are nothing special, just a feather mattress pad over a plain old mattress. They look comfy but feel mediocre. Our 6th floor city view room was an up-close view of another building's roof "junk". Kept the drapes closed. Rust around tub drain and rust stains in the grout. Just rust, but still made me queasy when I had to bathe my toddler. Hair was stuck to the paint on the ceiling in the bathroom. Nice to have robes in the room though and the soaps were nice. Pool liner also seemed to be rust-stained. No hot tub. Overall, I was mostly horrified by the X-rated noises from the next-door room. I was with my mother and toddler for a Mother's Day weekend! This hotel is not as close to the attractions as others. We found one closer and quieter and left after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwachh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not great, but good. I took the advice of another reviewer and asked for a quiet room with a view. We were given a room on the 20th floor. The room was very clean with a very comfortable king size bed. The bedding included a feather bed and down comforter. The hotel staff was somewhat hit or miss. They would say hello if you acknowledged them first. The exception to this were the doormen. They were excellent and more than willing to give directions or dinning advice. One glitch was the housekeeping staff. One morning, I was having coffee in the room when a maid just walked in. I did not have the do not disturb sign out, but usally they knock before entering. Another afternoon I had to call three times to find out when our room was going to be made up. No one seemed to know what the other was doing? The location of the hotel was very good close to the commons and the Freedom trail. We did not eat at the hotel, but found a Dunkin Donught for AM coffe and quite a few small restaurants with in a short distance of the Hotel. The Beantown Pub on Tremont St. stands out as a very good place for a drink and a sandwhich. It overlooks the burying ground where Paul Revere is buried. I did not notice anything out of the ordinary as far as walking the streeets around the hotel. The mix was one that you would find in most large cities. I did not feel threatened at any time. There was a large police presence and I did not notice any problems. If we would return to Boston, I would consider staying at the Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mfowl1844
Reviews.Content: The downtown Hyatt was located great in the center of downtown Boston. We walked everywhere, never taking the subway and only taking a taxi to and from the airport. The hotel was very clean, they had doorman at all hours of the day. The staff was very courteous and the concierge gave excellent restaurant recommendations. I would recommend seeing a Celtics game, Fenway Park, and eating at the Oyster House. Overall the hotel was great, we couldn't have asked for a better location and cleaner hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves, drug dealers, perverts”
Reviews.Author: walkermr
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that the hotel is beautiful, but the staff and the neighborhood ruin it. I stayed at this hotel for five nights for a business function held in the hotel. Early in the week some of our business supplies were stolen out of the room assigned to us by the hotel staff. We made management aware of the problem. What happened? More expensive things were stolen later in the week. About the same time we were dealing with this, a couple of men were caught having sex in the lobby bathroom. Then we find out that this is an ongoing problem in the hotel!!!! Do they put an attendant in the bathroom to discourage this behavior? No. Now, when you walk out on the street be prepared to be greeted with drug dealers from the numerous subway entrances and homeless people from the SEVERAL homeless shelter near the hotel. If you are planning on spending the money I would say move closer to quincy market and farther from Boston commons.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay After a Show”
Reviews.Author: SueD_MA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regency the night of a mid-week showing of a musical at the Opera House. The location was perfect for our needs. It had begun snowing during the show and walking only a block to our room instead of having to deal with the torturous ride home was sheer bliss. The room was spacious, clean, quiet and inviting. The beds were luxurious. The bathroom was clean and well stocked. The only downsides were the lack of a room safe (very odd in a city hotel), wireless Internet as the only option (no IEEE connection in our room; however, there are rooms that have it), and the temperature control didn't work so the room was colder than comfortable (for me ... H didn't mind) for most of the night. The staff was VERY friendly; always smiling and helpful (reminded me of Disney World :). The common areas smelled great and had nice soothing music. The hotel restaurant had above average food and service for a hotel, so there was no need to go anywhere else for dinner before the show. I would stay at the Regency for a show again, although next time I would ask for a business room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: radis
Reviews.Content: Spent a big we-end there with my wife. Not much to say, everything was perfect especially for the very (should I say extraordinary :) ) price we had through Priceline (65$ a night !). Nice and helpful staff, nice position, huge rooms, very nice beds. Slightly impersonal, but you can't have everything... :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr_and_Mrs_PSW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Valentine's weekend. We had a corner suite on a higher floor. We loved our stay. Everyone was very nice and helpful. We forgot our toothpaste, and they sent up all different types of toiletries. The location was good because we could walk to all the sites, it's a very central location (although there is not much to see on the couple of streets surrounding the hotel).
