Close to shopping, not too far from the aquarium. Room Service was a little pricey, but the food was very good. The bed was extremely comfortable, and our room was always clean and tidy when we came back from sightseeing. Over all a great stay and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An average experience”
Reviews.Author: Kamtini
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of the Hyatt Regency brand but this property is not among my favorites. Pros include price, great staff, and a very comfortable bed. Cons include location (the area is pretty desolate at night and it was difficult to find both taxis and good, nearby restaurants on the weekend - it is in the financial district so everything shuts down on weekends), rooms that showed wear and tear (particularly in the bathroom), and noise. Truly, this hotel was one of the noisiest I have ever been in - slamming doors and the conversation of people in the hallways was easily heard in both rooms we were in - we ultimately had to change rooms from the 17th floor to the 20th floor due to noise but the change in volume was somewhat minimal. Be sure to ask for a higher floor if noise is an issue for you - frankly, I am not overly sensitive to hotel noise so the need to change rooms was an unfortunate development. In the event I am again in Boston, I would stay again at the Marriot Copely Place (see prior review for this property). It was much more conveniently located with great shopping nearby and despite the number of guests it attracts, was far quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Great city - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jfed
Reviews.Content: This past summer we had occasion to visit Boston just to get awat for a few days and do some sightseeing. This hotel is in a great location - within easy walking distance of the Freedom Trail, Faneuil Hall, Boston Common, and some large department stores. Our room, although pleasant, was fairly average. The hotel staff went out of their way to be helpful and friendly; the concierge was exceptional, and the doorman made us feel "at home" by welcoming us back from our daily walking trips. The breakfast buffet was great, and the restaurant manager not only stopped by to see how we were doing, but took the time to give us written subway directions. The only negative would be the parking situation: it was not very convenient and quite expensive - but I guess that's par-for-the course in the heart of an expensive Northeastern city. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at this Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised...”
Reviews.Author: evjolin
Reviews.Content: We took a risk and pricelined in Boston, with great results. This hotel was in a good location and had SUPER comfy beds. If you're like me and want a cheap but nice place, and spend most of your time outside the hotel or in the bed, this is a great hotel to be staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great hotel in the middle of downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: xichic
Reviews.Content: We were able to get this hotel for only $99 through hotwire, so needless to say that this hotel was worth every penny. We stayed one night during the wine festival, and though it wasn't close to the Trade Center, it was only a short taxi ride away. The Hyatt looks like it may be an older hotel from the outside, but the rooms are totally updated with a modern touch to them. There was a nice atrium when we arrived on our floor, which gave the hotel a comfortable feel to it. The staff was friendly, and the location is wonderful (just a block from Boston Common area). The room is a fair size, with a very comfortable bed and very clean. The bathroom is average size, but very well appointed to. One downfall was the lack of a hotel safe. I haven't been to a "4" star hotel lately that did not include a safe. But other than that, we had an excellent stay at this hotel, especially because of the price we booked it at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MEGATRAVELER
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on Priceline. Excellent front desk staff - once you find your way from the street to the lobby. The room was immaculate and had every amenity we needed - including a lovely view. Housekeeping was great. The area is somewhat desolate late at night, so if that bothers you, you might prefer to stay someplace where there is a little more activity. But for our short stay it was perfect - and convenient to the T and South Station.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some bed help.”
Reviews.Author: Knows
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. Check in was fast and pleasant. The room was clean and decorated nice. It was the bed I had issue with. A feather bed was on top of the pillow-top mattress. Could have been great, but there was not a mattress pad in sight and the feathers from the featherbed poked us through the night. Sanitation - The mattress didn't have a waterproof pad on it either. Seems unsanitary to me and it is often required by health codes. Room service was prompt and the food was warm, fresh, and tasted very good. The price was very good at $159 night from the Hyatt website. Location was perfect, within walking distance to theatres, many restaurants, and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “This is the Place to Stay When in Boston”
Reviews.Author: findingtravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Boston for a much needed weekend get-away in December 2007, and I was pleasantly surprised by the service I that I had received from the Hyatt staff (from the doorman to guest services). The staff was extremely polite. I had a large corner room with two large windows allowing me to enjoy the views of the city. I felt like I was renting an apartment for the weekend. The room was immaculate and the room attendants were wonderful; the bathroom was very clean. As a single woman, I felt safe in the hotel. The location was perfect. I was near Macyâ€™s, and other name brand shops as well as the T line, which allowed me to easily travel throughout the city, and Amtrak. I was also in walking distance to Quincy Market and other tourist attractions. Iâ€™m hard to please, but the Hyatt Regency exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Check the Sheets Upon Entering”
Reviews.Author: Traveller101World
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend, the price was very good and checking in was smooth late at night but we did not notice until the morning that the sheets had a few spots of blood on them (looked like blood not red pen marks). Room was very clean otherwise and they replaced the linens but the sign in the bathroom about being a clean hotel had me wondering, do they only change the linens daily upon request between customers too or did they mean daily between longer stays for the same customer...at first I thought for longer stays but now not so sure? Oh, when the linens were changed, a towel was left right on the floor. Oversight #2. They did change our room that evening when we realized that foul mouth, on the way to being drunk just out of college kids were organizing a party in the room next door and it was only 5pm...I had a hunch get them moved or us, they moved us to a higher floor with a better view. Thank you Hyatt (sorry to my love for waking her up to move from her nap:) Lastly, don't take the cabs from the hotel. They take longer than walking a 10 minute walk and cost about twice the price. Thanks Boston and Hyatt for helping us out on giving no advice or controlling this consistent taxi hackney practice. Hyatt to Faneuil Hall 0.8 miles, $10, $8, $7...please.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed in the world but ...”
Reviews.Author: Chris&Erik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt following New Year's Day. We stayed in a 'Lafayette Suite'. Overall I was under impressed with the hotel. The location is great - walk to anywhere and our room had a great view of Boston Commons. The room itself was some what dismal - sort of a muted green that was pretty bland with nothing to liven it up. The furniture was early '50s looking with no ottoman for the chair (I need to keep my legs propped up). We were never able to order a movie from pay-for-view despite numerous attempts from engineering to fix the problem. Room service was prompt and not too bad but limited menu. The only redeeming feature of this hotel was the bed. It is by far the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on. Enough to over come the shortcoming that I would stay again? Probably not. There a lot of great hotels in Boston, many with equally comfortable beds I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Polite Staff, Comfy Bed”
Reviews.Author: featherpillow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights during Christmas week. We booked through AAA and received a reasonable room rate which included vouchers for breakfast. The front desk staff were very efficient, friendly and genuine. The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. We had a good view of the financial district from the 17th floor. The hotel is close to the theatre district and within walking distance of Chinatown, Boston Common, North End and subways. The only inconvenience we experienced was the layout of the main entrance in relation to the guest rooms. It was necessary to switch elevators in the main reception area. We noticed that all staff was trained very well to engage us in conversation and ask about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: nhsuzanne
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hyatt on 2 occasions via Priceline.com. I was able to snag it for $70/night, and it was listed as a 4 star hotel. The neighborhood isn't the most attractive option as other reviewers have mentioned, but I found it perfect for catching a nearby show. It's also very close to the Commons. If you like to walk it's not too far (less than 1 mile) from Newbury St., the Prudential shops, or Faneuil Hall. I like to get a little exercise on my vacations so I don't need everything right next door. The hotel is very close to Chinatown which has some great ethnic restaurants. The lobby is attractive and there is 1 computer on that floor with free access and printing for flight check-ins, etc. The staff is very courteous and professional. One negative is that you have to take 2 different elevators in order to get to your room- one from the entrance, and then one from the main floor. The hotel was running a promo for free breakfast with a stay and when I mentioned this they gave me a complimentary breakfast voucher even though I had booked the reservation through Priceline. They have Starbuck's coffee and they gave me a to go container so that I could bring breakfast with me in order to catch an early flight. They have decent pastries and fresh fruit, and lots of options for dried fruits and Macadamia nuts. I didn't check out the other offerings. The room was medium sized with a very soft plush king-sized bed. We were on an upper floor so there was a 1/2 way decent view. The room was nicely decorated and it had a large bathroom. I would happily stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: JoeMary01
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate from AAA. First room we got (6th floor) had a chemical smell that would not go away. Mentioned this at front desk and by the time we got back from a concert we had been relocated to the 8th floor. No problem with that room. Room was on the small side as well as the bathroom but OK. Parking is expensive. Centrally located near two T stops made getting around very easy. Conceirge seemed overwhelmed by requests and to answer a simple question had to go over to the front desk. First asked a clerk who didn't know the area (he was from Germany!) but then got good directions. Skipped the food as the prices were high. Didn't like the VERY slow elevators and having to go up and down a floor to get from/to street level. I've seen better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Property”
Reviews.Author: muchuckles
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a meeting that was being held at the BCEC and it was great. The hotel is within walking distance or only a short cab ride away from many of the major Boston attractions and the service was great. The only odd thing about this property is that the main entrance does not appear to be a main entrance. Once you walk in, you walk down some steps, walk through a sort of waiting area and then into an elevator to take you to the main lobby. From there you need to get on another elevator to go to the guest rooms. Needless to say, during peak times you have to wait for the elevator to take you to the main lobby and then wait again at another elevator bank to go to your room. Minor inconvenience. Overall, I would recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ravens1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for two nights, over the Thanksgiving holiday. The hotel, our room, the staff...everything was just perfect. We spent two full days "walking" the city... and utilizing the subway system as much as possible (which was wonderful). The hotel served as our "home base", to come back to every few hours and relax. The staff was very pleasant, and were eager to answer all of our questions on the area. Everyone, including all the doormen, were just great. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed..Too Loud...Not User-Friendly”
Reviews.Author: miamipt
Reviews.Content: Check-in, baggage delivery, and especially the elevators were very, very slow. On the guest suite side of the building, there was an atrium of sorts in the middle and all load noises: room service or attendants knocking on doors, screaming kids, or any other significant noise from the lower floors traveled up through the atrium and therefore we found the hotel to be loud. We also found the TV system and the phone system to be cumbersome to use. For the life of me, I could not figure out how to set the alarm. I ended up requesting a wake-up call, which rang late. Room quality was excellent. Nice space, well designed bath and feather bed was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pep07874
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Oct 26th thru Oct 31st. The Hotel is in an excellent location. You are in the heart of the theatre district and steps away from the play Wicked. We arrived to the Hotel by noon and were able to check in with no problems. Our room was on the 8th floor and had a nice view of the downtown area. We did not use the restaurant at the Hyatt because of the price. Breakfast for two could easily could run $40.00. We opted for a Starbucks or Dunkin donuts that appear to be on every corner for breakfast. Renting a car would be a waste of money if you plan on just hanging out in the downtown area. My wife and I walked everywhere. The subway is a breeze to figure out and cheap to ride. That appears to be the primary mode of transportation and is very clean and safe. Please e-mail me if you have any questions. pep078@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Solid Property”
Reviews.Author: choth21
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice--a bit on the small side. The bathroom is absolutely tiny. The bed is very comfortable, but is also really high atop a really high boxspring, I guess. It's a bit uncomfortable getting in and out of the bed. Overall, it's a solid Hyatt property, but nothing extraordinary in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and homely!”
Reviews.Author: tomatovine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location which makes it very easy to get around Boston on foot and is also very close to the T. The rooms are extremely comfortable and spacious and very clean. After a busy day of sight seeing it was a pleasure to return to a homely and peaceful room even though it is right in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt was all that!”
Reviews.Author: SmitM
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at the Hyatt for 5 nights and we have no complaints. Every thing was superb, the room on the 16th floor was spacious and the view was breathtaking. All the staff was accomodating. Our flight arrived early and the hotel let us check in with no hassle. The breakfast is pricey but the staff is superb. We got the Get Away package and the buffet breakfast for two is included kids cost $10.00. My husband and son were in heaven every morning. Take some comfortable shoes a lot of places are within walking distance and the staff has no problem directing you. The taxi's were not all that expensive since most things are close to the hotel. Use taxi wiz.com to figure out your destinations and the prices are pretty accurate. Check out Legal Seafood, Cheers,The Duck Tour, Galleria Mall in Cambridge and you gotta see the Red Sox's play at Fenway Park what a awesome experience. If you love to shop you can shop til you drop! We also had a late flight out so they allowed us to stay until 2pm with no extra charge and then secured our luggage until we were ready to depart. The Hyatt is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location plus good service...”
Reviews.Author: CanucksTraveller
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here over the Labour Day weekend. Location is very central to many places. The hotel street level is one level below the reception level, so the strange design requires one extra elevator to go in and out of the hotel, but not a big deal, except that you NEED a concierge to help you with moving larger luggage because of some stairs in between. The concierge was very friendly and courteous - he sure attempted to be as attentive as he could be to look after all the hotel guests. It is so close to Chinatown and we walked there for dinner without feeling unsafe at all. We had dinner at Hea La Moon and it was authentic Chinese food. Rooms were not large, but well-furnished. Parking was hugely expensive - $30 for self-park with NO in-n-out privilege, and more than $40 for valet parking with in-n-out privilege... A little construction was also taking place, but did not interfere with us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Happy at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: TiaraRochester
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 4 nights while attending a convention. The LOCATION made it possible for us to walk to Quincy Market and China Town. Other SHOPPING and restaurants are nearby. The helpful, personable doorman will give you directions. We enjoyed Bartevian Inc. which sells antiques and imports on Boylston Street. FOOD we enjoyed: Dim Sum at Chau Chow City in China Town, ( I preferred this over Peach Farm ), seafood at Union Oyster House near Quincy Market, and the Barking Crab, Pizza at New York Pizza and appetizers at Cheers at Quincy Market. We boarded a City Line trolley at Stop 1 in Quincy Market. Board early in the day as there are 9 stops at which you can re-board. The tours of Old Iron Sides ended at 3:30 but we were still able to walk around. The WW II ship closed at 4:00. Thru Sept. the $27 ticket also included a free harbor cruise which we didn't have time for. There is a CVS near the hotel. One can take a shortcut through the parking garage. If you want bottled water buy it outside the hotel if you have a budget. All of the STAFF performed their roles in a HIGHLY PROFESSIONAL manner. Housekeeping was good but I sensed perhaps someone had not vacuumed around the edges. Towels, toiletries were well supplied. There was no fan in the bathroom and no make-up mirror. CHECK-IN was efficient and there is self check-out. There is computer access in the registration area where you can print your return trip boarding pass at no charage. CABFARE for the airport was $20 and up depending on the day we used it. That included a generous tip. If you are traveling solo, the shuttle cab was $14.50 per person we were told. I felt having 2 elevators was a good security feature of the hotel, personally. I didn't find it to be inconvenient as some have said .It did mean that I needed to have baggage handling due to the stairs at the entrance. If I were to stay in Boston again I would probably seek a less expensive hotel. But that is not meant to be a criticism of the Hyatt. They did everything right.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt Boston”
Reviews.Author: rjslatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Boston on 9/3 for 1 night. The room was spotless and the staff were very friendly. The room was spacious, quiet and had a nice view of the city from the 14th floor. Check-in was easy. We had a couple of hours to walk around before our flight left. We walked over to Charles Street and had breakfast at the Paramount. Highly recommended. We then headed over to Newbury Street. It's easy to walk to most major attractions in Boston. We would definitely stay in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: tcuirish
Reviews.Content: Found a terrific rate for the hotel on travelzoo.com so my friend and i thought we'd take our chances. Excellent location, though my cabbie from the airport had a bit of trouble finding it. Short walk to Boston Commons and Freedom Trail. Close to Downtown Crossing T station. Staff was very friendly and they have a desktop PC located near the concierge's desk solely for the purpose of allowing guests to check - in for their flights online. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Pool needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: all4won
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here while my husband attended a conference in the hotel. The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is within easy walking distance of the harbor, aquarium, Quincy market. It is very close to Boston Commons. I take that back...the VERY best thing about this hotel is the staff. So friendly and sooooo helpful. As my children and I were leaving each morning, map in hand, a doorman rushed over to open the door and offer directions. The staff was so willing to offer their help rather than wait to be asked. Parking was available adjacent to the building. We parked our car and didn't use it for the entire trip. (Good thing, too considering the curved streets, one way driving and Washington St rule about no roads crossing it. Those things make for difficult driving in the city.) Rooms were clean and fresh. Beds and bedding were very comfortable. Our only disappointment was in the pool area. The water was cloudy, rails to enter pool were broken and/or wobbly. Shower handle in ladies room was broken. Floor was incredibly slippery surrounding pool. The entire pool area was shabby and in need of a makeover. Exercise room was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location, nice place...”
Reviews.Author: charles7
Reviews.Content: The problem of this Hyatt, in opinion, is the location. The neighborhood is crowded, dirty, smelly, etc. I found a bit weird to make the check in at the third floor, but my overall experience was OK. We said at the front desk that we were in a honeymoon and they put us in a superior rooom: big, modern, nice furniture, comfortable bed, huge bathroom. In short: rooms and the hotel in general are very adequate. DonÂ´t pay attention to bad reviews. Probably they didnÂ´t have a good experience at check in or so, BUT the truth is that this hotel is nice, very comfortable. The problem, at least for me, was the location. I think that for the same price you can find an hotel as good as this one at a better location: Back Bay or so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cairoArkansas
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was selected for us by booking through Priceline.com. The rooms were a good size and very clean. The beds are so comfortable, my son says they were "amazing. The staff was friendly and the service good. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “warning: rooms are rented to airline personnel during the day”
Reviews.Author: khepler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend on Friday night, July 27. I arrived at 4:30pm, and was told that our room was not ready. After some prodding, I found out that the Hyatt rents rooms to airline personnel who need to sleep during the day before overnight flights. These personnel do not check out until 6:00pm, 7:00pm, or later. This means that those guests who book rooms for the evening have to wait til the rooms are emptied and cleaned. While I waited in the lobby, I noticed many other guests around me who were also waiting for their rooms. Some became quite irate and insisted on speaking with the manager. They were told they had to wait. It was ridiculous. At 6:30pm, our room was still not ready, and my friend and I had to leave for the evening. We told reception that we'd return around 10:30pm to check in, and to please not give away our room. When we returned at 10:30pm, we were told that there were no more rooms with two double beds available. They gave us a king and brought in a rollaway. They did drop the price of the room in half for the inconvenience, but word of advice to the Hyatt--if you are going to double-book rooms and make guests wait til late at night to check in, at least give them some courtesy by informing them when they BOOK the rooms, not when they arrive to check in. At least give guests the choice upon booking. And give guests an automatic discount if they opt for late check in.

Reviews.Title: “Room not ready at check-in”
Reviews.Author: CRCS
Reviews.Content: The location was PERFECT. Very close to Boston Commons, where the freedom trail begins, Quincy Market and Aquarium. The elevator thing was NOT a big deal at all. My biggest problem was we checked in at 9:30 at night and our room was NOT ready and they could not give us a time when it would be. They gave us a king room ( for three of us) and we had a very uncomfortable night. They did move us to a room with two doubles in morning. When check in is at 3 your room should be ready by nine. Consierge was EXTREMELY helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “My Experience Would Make Me Want To Book My Next Stay At A Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: sunlvr2288
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Boston and in this property. This was, on the other hand, not our first time staying at a Hyatt Regency Hotel. We were there to attend a convention at the Boston Convention Center. This property is located 5 minutes away from the convention center. It is safe for me, as of now, to come into a conclusion that you will never have a bad stay at Hyatt regency. When we arrived, we were greeted by what we were accustomed to from a Hyatt. Our car doors were opened by friendly and cheerful staff. We were welcomed by an elegant crisp entry that leads you to an elevator that takes you to the main level where you check in. The main level was grand and spacious filled with welcoming staff. The rooms were clean, crisp and fresh. It was so relaxing to just lie in such a fluffy bed after a long drive from New York. Although there were some things that happened during our stay, at this property, they have made it very clear that it is imperative that customerâ€™s satisfaction comes first. All they cared about was what it would take them to do to make us happy. The property was located in a great location if you want great shopping, stroll in the park, delicious Dim Sum, Comfortable movie Theater and ice cream in the middle of the night. With all my experience in this hotel, 2 of the staff I encountered do need a deeper training on how to speak to a guest; it is very encouraging for me to book y next stay at a Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hyatt Regency Boston”
Reviews.Author: pc1029
Reviews.Content: 4 girlfriends stayed in one room at the Hyatt Regency Boston for 3 nights, 4 days July 19-22. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful even though our room wasn't ready until 3:30. The concierge was extremely helpful with suggestions and travel around the area, and restaurants and dinner reservations. Great fitness facility. I got cleaned up there since our room was a little crowded! Worked out great. The water is awfully hot, though, so be careful not to get burned, and there could be a little more light and another mirror to make it a little easier for 4 women to put makeup on and fix hair. But, I would highly reccommend staying there and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JLEPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: Without trying to be too fussy, this was a very good place to stay in Boston. It is very close to Boston Common, a ten minute walk to Fanueil Hall and the a pretty good view of Boston from the upper floors. We used the T to get around since you have to pay in the self park each time you take your car out or leave it there and be charged a flat fee of $30- a night. Valet parking was $41- a night. We stayed on the 17th floor, they were working on the outside of the building and there was an annoying cable with a giant knot in it right outside our window. I guess that's just bad timing. As I read in the reivews the lobby is a little confusing, but don't let that stop you from staying here, it only took one trip outside to figure it out. The rooms were average and on the small side like most city hotels but it was fine.I guess I expected a little more from a four star hotel. The bathroom door kept closing, hitting you in the back, and that was annoying, the door also hit the curved shower rod they obviously installed long after this hotel was built. It was a very small bathroom. When we checked in I was surprised to see only two bath towels and no shampoo (there was shower gel, conditioner, and body cream). None of the soaps were added during our stay which I thought was rather cheap of the hotel. I called and asked for more bath towels and got two bath MATS....so, we just grabbed the towels from the cart we saw in the hallway on our way out. We had the buffet breakfast which was "free" with our deal and when it appeared on our bill in error it was removed but I did see the $57.60 that they normally charge for two, it would not be worth $57.60 at all!! It was a normal, nothing special breakfast buffet. All in all it was clean and in a pretty good location, so if you get a great deal, it would be fine. I just don't feel like I could tell you it was THE place to stay in Boston. We were looking for just a little more special of a place to stay and I really didn't see the difference from a three star to this four star??????

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great People”
Reviews.Author: bugs1421
Reviews.Content: Loved the area of the hotel, enjoyed the people at the hotel very friendly staff especially the doormen. The amount of pillows in the room was awesome and the space of the bedrooms were very nice when traveling with youngsters, gave them plenty of room to roam around the bedroom. However the housekeeping service and check-in was a nightmare!!! We got to the hotel at 6:00 pm on a Saturday night (we had called ahead to let them know we would be arriving late) we didn't get into our room until after 8 pm. The room was supposably not cleaned yet so we were told to wait about 15 minutes and it would be cleaned, 1 1/2 hours later my husband explained to them that we have kids who need to be put to bed and needed a room. They gave us a king room and told us our room would be ready by tomorrow morning. When we entered the king room we decided we would stay here the rest of the trip and ask for a roll away bed for one child. Housekeeping cleaned our room Sunday and then we didn't see them until Wednesday and that was after we spoke with the manager they were very apologetic about the ordeal and had sent a cheese tray to our room Wednesday night after we got in from being out all day. The room looked nice however they hadn't vaccumed. So we called them again and the next day it was inspected by the assistant manager over housekeeping to make sure everything was taken care of. The rest of the stay was great, would think about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ambivalent about Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: ReesesIlGato
Reviews.Content: The location is great: a few small blocks from Chinatown, and all the historical, touristy stuff. 20 minutes walk to North End and Back Bay areas, if you can navigate the confusing streets of old Boston. Two irritations: There's no way to get to the street level by stairs. You have to take an elevator from street to lobby and then another elevator from the lobby to the rooms. Same deal if you have a car from the garage. Second: Avoid a room with interior doors separating it and another. The sound insulation is horrible through the thin door. We had this family with musical kids staying a few days. It's not anyone's fault for noisy kids (that's their nature and they're also on vacation). But hotel guests should not be subjected to personal sounds from adjacent rooms; that's just wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: HipChic
Reviews.Content: EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE! ENTIRE STAFF is absolutely accommodating and extremely pleasant -- from the concierge, to the maid, to the door man, to the front desk, to the wait staff in the lounge and restaurants. Closely located to everything. Would absolutely stay here again. "Candid" pictures posted on here from another guest are misleading. Our room was just as nice as the hotel website pictures. Our only suggestions for the hotel are: provide more amenities in the restrooms for guests -- such as cottonballs, disposable razors, etc. In my experience these items are provided in hotels of this calibre. Other suggestion -- offer "white noise" on the fancy clock/radio provided in each room -- to drown out the hall noises and next door noises ---- walls are somewhat thin. Besides those two items, stay and accommodations were top notch! ~Houston, Texas traveler

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Sarago36
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights during July. The hotel is a little confusing in that the arrival floor is actually on the 3rd floor (not ground floor) but the location of the hotel is excellent. There are lots of shops such as downtown crossing right around the corner. Chinatown is a couple of blocks away as is the park. You can walk the Freedom Trail in a few blocks, Faneul Hall and Quincy Market. We also walked to Fenway although it is a hefty walk. I loved the fact that the hotel windows open. Definetly a plus! Also, there are terraces on several floors with tables and chairs if you just want to sit outside for a bit. The pool is a delight with a steam room and sauna and complimentary shampoos and conditioner. Outside of the pool is a huge terrace area with lounge chairs and a gazebo with outdoor furniture, actually there are two! They are very nice. The fitness area likewise is excellent although they did not show Red Sox games either in the fitness area or in the rooms, though the staff informed me that it was in the plans. You can, however, watch the games in the lounge and they will turn up the volume for you. For coffee in the morning you dont need to order room service or leave the hotel: the restaurant will serve it to you right inside the door for $2 with free refills. Wish I'd known that the first night! Overall, the staff were very friendly, the concierge was a delight, and the hotel was worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: wh00t
Reviews.Content: Nice overall. Upon booking my room online, I called the hotel's number to request two double beds instead of the king and was told that it wouldn't be a problem. When we arrived, the receptionist did not see that change in her system, but thankfully was able to quickly give us the double beds we needed. Initial impression of the hotel was very positive. Nice decor and smelled good. The unusual two-elevator system (one to the lobby and one to the rooms) was not as bothersome as some reviewers have said. The elevators were fast and it was hardly a nuisance. The room itself was very nice, impeccably clean and nice view out our 14th floor window. Beds had lots of linen and pillows. One problem here was that the blankets made a lot of noise! I am a toss-and-turner and the ruffling was a bit of a disturbance for my room partner. Sadly our TV remote did not work. We called for a change of batteries and those did not help either. We were told that maintenance could come and fix it, and I'm sure they would have, but we just toughed it out. Service was friendly! The doorman was so nice and always greeted us with smiles. We also called for two glasses and a corkscrew to be delivered to our door and it arrived in about 5 minutes, despite our being told it would take 15-20. Finally we were quite pleased with the location. Right next to Downtown Crossing station, Macy's, etc. Very central and easy to get to wherever we were going. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place to stay in Boston...”
Reviews.Author: sunnyday12
Reviews.Content: We received an incredible deal via Priceline ($75/night) for this property. Located in Downtown Crossing, it is not a terrible place to stay, but not the best either. The entire setup of the hotel is weird itself. All guests must take 2 elevators to get to their accomodations. One elevator to the lobby, then another elevator to the rooms. Check in was okay. We were unable to get a King Size bed, but while the women who was checking us in was going to see if one was available, another gentlemen who was behind the desk chimed in and talked over the women who was checking us in. It was an odd occurance and rude to say the least...and definately didn't make a great impression having just walked in the door. Anyways, we went up to our room on the 11th floor. The rooms are nicely appointed. The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are clean. (Just a warning, the bathroom floors do get VERY slippery when wet!!) We left the hotel for our dinner reservation and came back around 1am. We left our breakfast room service order on the doorknob. In the morning, we received the breakfast late and cold. It definately wasn't worth the $16 for a simple breakfast sandwich. The Hyatt is definately not a horrible place to stay. We were in Boston for the evening and on the spur of the moment got a great deal. If you are looking for impeccable customer service and amenities this isn't the place for you. If you are looking for a clean, comfortable place to stay in a decent part of the city this is a great hotel. By no means would I ever pay full price for this property. There are definately better hotels in the city of Boston in far greater locations. The odd setup and layout of the hotel does not make you feel like you are staying at an upscale property. Our stay was by no means horrible, but not one of the most memorable from the hotel's perspective. All in all, it is a better than average property...but as I stated before there are better places to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: plumies
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a great hotel and we enjoyed our stay. Like many of the reviews, getting into the lobby (and out) is a bit confusing at first. But this wasn't a problem once we figured out the layout. There are 2 entrances into the hotel, 1 from the street and 1 from the parking garage. Both entrances take you to the first lobby with elevators that will take you up to main lobby. There is also another set of elevators that take you up to the guest rooms. What I liked: - I got a great package deal from the hotel's website. No other hotels in downtown in the same category could match it. - The upgraded, corner suite was very spacious, clean and comfortable. The room was almost 3x the size of Omni when I stayed there years ago. - Our room/floor was very quite. There was some kind of convention there but we hardly even noticed. - The staff was very friendly and helpful. - There were 2 TVs, one in the sitting room and 1 in the bedroom. - Hotel was centrally located so we could walk to just about every attraction, or hop on the T from the station close by. What I didn't like: - There was only 1 robe. This isn't a big deal but past stays at other Hyatts have had 2 robes. A very minor thing. - The blow dryer was very old and low wattage. It's like the models from over 10 yrs ago. There was also a crack and a hole in the handle. This was probably the most annoying thing in the room for me. - The view of the room was not very good due to the floor level (8). I'm sure the view is better at higher floors. Again, not that big of a deal for me since we weren't in the room most of the day. - The parking prices are ridiculously high ($30 for self parking, $41 for valet). Our package came with complimentary valet parking, thank goodness. - The breakfast buffet was nothing to write home about. At $21 a person, I expected a little more than very runny scrambled eggs and the standard affairs (bacon, sausage, bread/bagel, cereal, fruit, oatmeal). The fruit was fresh and good. My recommendation is to take the $21 and go to one of the local cafes. Even better, take the T to North End ($4 roundtrip) or a cab (~ $20 roundtrip) to Bova's and experience some of the best pastries on Earth (yes, it's that good!). Other comments: One of the room elevators was not opening the doors once it got to our floor. This was a bit unnerving at first since the elevator just sat there. But then we just avoided going up in that particular one. Problem solved. Some of the reviews on this site said how scared or hesitant they were, or that is was a ghost town in this part of downtown. We stayed there Fri-Mon and experienced neither of these. But like in all major downtowns, people have to take some precautions, especially at nite. We didn't eat at the hotel's restaurant, Avenue One, since we preferred to eat at other, more well known restaurants (my reviews of Legal Seafood and Union Oyster House will be posted shortly). Conclusion, I would definitely stay at the Hyatt again if I'm ever back in Boston. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be centrally located to many of the local attractions and wants to be able to walk to them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JCortez224
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Boston for one night during Memorial Day weekend. The staff was great, we were upgraded to a Terrace Suite when we checked in. It was beautiful and very clean/pleasant, although you can't actually go out onto the Terrace so that was bittersweet. We ordered room service which was excellent! The breakfast buffet was wonderful as well! Great location to all of Boston. Overall a great trip! Will return to this hotel whenever we are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: porcupine698
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Boston is by far the most superior hotel I have ever stayed at. Having always used Marriott in previous trips, I decided to venture out from the norm and book the Regency. Upon entering, I was immediately intrigued by the elegance of the building and decor. Every employee I encountered always had a smile on their face and was willing to help. The staff was very knowledgeable on the surrounding city and I often utilized their advice for restaurants and things to do. Even the bell staff was willing to answer questions about directions and such and were always one step ahead in opening the doors and helping with bags. I was very impressed. The room we stayed in was gorgeous. We were on the 19th floor overlooking the city. The views were breathtaking. Waking up in the morning and looking out over the surrounding area was a pleasant experience. The architecture of the hotel was also impressive. Stepping off the elevator, there was an atrium that was three floors tall. Instead of walking out into a narrow and claustrophobic hallway, we were greeted with a sitting area complete with artwork and statues. Normally, hotels focus their main decorating on the lobby. But this hotel had all the right touches in all the right places. The beds were one of a kind. I have never felt so rested before. Everything about this hotel will make me want to choose Hyatt in the future. I forget exactly what the nightly rate was, but it was definitely worth every penny. The fitness center was well-equipped and the pool was very nice, complete with sauna, steam room, locker room, showers, and rest room. The restaurants also looked very good, but I did want to leave the hotel to walk around. Next time I will definitely dine in the restaurants. The only downside was the expensive parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: CCArizona
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to travel to Boston for our honeymoon. Not your typical honeymoon destination, but what a fantastic city! The Hyatt Regency Boston was the perfect hotel to meet our needs. It's close to two major T-stops and numerous attractions, including Quincy Market, Filene's Basement, and the Boston Common. In fact, we walked almost everywhere, even to Cambridge. There aren't too many restaurants or bars directly next to the hotel, but a short walk gets you everything you're looking for. The staff was friendly, and the fitness center/pool is a great plus for travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with a nice pool.”
Reviews.Author: fifikiwi
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid (through priceline), it's a decent stay. Good location, close to Downtown Crossing, China Town and the Theatre District. The front desk is trying to be helpful but not very efficient. I called to ask for a room change due to a strong cigarette smell (I asked for a nonsmoking room). I told them I was ready to switch right away, I waited for 20 min and no one came to bring me the new room key. I finally had to go down stairs to get it. Room is clean and good size. My favorite part is the swimming pool, it's a nice one that you can actually swim laps.

Reviews.Title: “Little things”
Reviews.Author: jakeo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an over night at the Hyatt. I have been staying here for several years and have always been pleased with nlocation and the room itselfl. I do understand though why poeple that are paying full price complain. They used to deliver your paper to the door but now have stopped that. They also used to have complementary coffee for the early riser in the lobby but that was also discontinued. The staff is responsive to your requests but most of mine have not been carried out. One time I needed a roll away bed and that took four phone calls. This trip I needed a tooth brush sent up and that never arrived. I arrived early and understood that a room was not ready at that time, but after walking around for an hour and a half and waiting for them to call I checked with them and they said they would "rush" a room for me. I waited another hour or so and no phone call, so I went back to the hotel and checked with the desk. A room was ready now. I put my stuff in and then left. About half an hour after this, the desk called and said my room was now ready. On another stay, I requested a room with two beds and was given a king. Upon complaining, I was told I "requested" two beds, but "reserved" a king. Also some of the concierge staff is wonderful and knowledgeable. (all were polite) Some however have very little knowledge of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt is just fine”
Reviews.Author: klee09
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Boston, and I used reviews from several sites to make my decision on where to stay, along with the normal considerations of price and location. The Hyatt did have an awkward entrance, but other than a pause on first entry; it didn't create any problems. As far as location, I didn't feel unsafe at any time and I was traveling with my two college age children. It is very near Boston Common, the Theater District, Filenes Basement, and Chinatown. I define near as a short walk. Faneuil Hall and the Freedom Trail are a short hike, maybe 10 - 15 minutes at a stroll. The T stations are close and you can get anywhere in the city from there. The Hyatt had the best price that I found for the time of my stay. They were willing to guarantee the type of room that I wanted even with a late arrival. The staff was very polite and pleasant. We didn't eat at the hotel, except for one late night room service order. They food was okay, not great but certainly not bad. Prices were comparable to other restaurants in the area. The room was clean and comfortable. Housekeeping was attentive to our needs, by replacing toiletries and not adjusting the room temp we set. I wouldn't mind staying at the Hyatt again, if I return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Take a step back and look what you see...”
Reviews.Author: t_hajwane
Reviews.Content: So my right honourable friend below, really gave the hyatt an ear bashing... is it really that bad, depends on what you expect. I personally had no expectations of the hyatt, no great expectations, did i expect clean above avg rooms, i did, did i get it? Yes i did... Did i expect a nice view and a comfy bed, did i get it? Yes i did... The Hyatt does have its pitfalls, yes, you have to get 2 lifts to get from streetlevel to lobby then lobby to your rooms, is it really that much of an incovenience not particularly, if it ever got on my nerves that much i'd take the scenic route via Macy's! I didn't have that much interaction with hotel staff, the doormen were always courteous and when we needed assistance the hotel swiftly provided. However the breakfast was a let down, the Hyatt are clever in that they include a continental breakfast in some rates and then charge you 8$ to upgrade to the buffet breakfast. Is it worth it, when you're hungry anythings worth it, choice was limited, i would of preferred a la carte in that price but that wasn't an option. But again it did the job, if it got that bad, i could of walked down the road to one of the diners we'd found for all day eggs and pancakes. The rooms were big, no safe, bare that in mind, but we didnt have a problem in terms of security. The bathrooms were lovely, room gets hot though, but AC worked a treat. TV was good, all i need is the news which i got so i was happy. The location a stone throw away from 3 T stations, a stroll from Boston Common, coffee shops and Loewe's theatre. Now from face value, dunkin doghnuts looks pretty rancid, but i dont know how they do it i got hooked on their coffee!! If you are in my boat, there were plenty of them scattered everywhere!! On most days we walked up Boylston to Newbury Street, it was fantastic! Ok so whats the deal here is it worth it? Depends how much you pay the Hyatt throw around a stupendous amount of offers, we did make use of one of those offers so i paid in the region of 150-200$ a night. Which for a hotel of the Hyatt's calibur wasn't that bad... Would i stay there again, no, for the reason that now i know Boston a little bit better, i'd like to stay near Newbury Street for a bit of a change of location, the pitfalls, unless you are willing to fork out for hotels like the taj, 4seasons, the lenox or the in waiting mandarin then as we like to say in london, 'it aint gonna happen!'

Reviews.Title: “Sooo not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: nyclay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Boston, on May 26th and May 27th. We have debated to title this review either: soooo not worth it OR The Nickel and Dime Hotel OR How to ruin a nice vacation. As the satisfaction level quickly began to fall, I began to repeat â€œ Thatâ€™s going into my reportâ€�. Hereâ€™s the report: Location: fair at best. Several blocks from historic landmarks. Price: Average nightly: $350+ per night. Please! Iâ€™ve had better experiences at Motel 6. Much better. Oh, and they forget to tell you about the $41 per night parking fee for Valet parking and $31 a night if you park yourself. We noticed this and moved our car on the night of check-in. But apparently this didnâ€™t register so on check out we were charged the $41 dollars on top of the $31 dollars I already paid. I will say that when confronted on this, they removed the $41 charge. And donâ€™t believe the listed prices for room service. My $9 ice cream came out to $12+ tip. Speaking of room service: I ordered assorted pastries and muffins for breakfast. I got two muffins. I guess assorted means blueberry and bran. Want more nickel and dime? Careful not to open the mini bar fridge. Everything is bar coded, so if you take something out and put it back inâ€¦it registers on you bill as purchased. Want to save that ice cream you ordered, or chill a bottle of wine for later? Sureâ€¦but there will be a $25 cleaning fee for storing things in the fridge. The front desk warned me to not bump up against the fridgeâ€¦could cause charges to show up on your bill. Oh! And get this: one night we settled in to watch a movie. We surfed the choices: fairâ€¦not good, but fair. Then chose one. The price? $12.00. We watched Monk instead. Service: Very Poor. The Bell Man gave a curt and rapid review of the rooms features when we arrived. Bordered on fearful. On the first day, the toilet started to back up and almost overflow. I fiddled with it myself and got it going again. (How many stars is this hotel?) Finally I had to call for a plunger on our last day. They showed up 30+ minutes later. And the lay-out is just weird. You have to go up an elevator (no stairs as an option) to the 3rd floor for check in / lobby. These elevators are slow and one must wait for them for some time. Then you have to go up a different bank of elevators to get to your rooms. These elevators are even slower and you have to wait longer for them. There is usually a line. The music in the elevator is nice and loud. Kind of like being in a small psychedelic club with mirrors. Was there a complementary paper in the morning? Funny. No way. If I had stayed at some 2 star hotel? Probably, but not here. The pool? I found it one nightâ€¦after traveling through a maze of corridors. Itâ€™s old, small, and stuffy. About 3-4 lanes. A lap pool. Our entire experience can be summed up: sub-par.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: ChrisP78
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of the city is Hyatt Regency Boston. Great location. Very beautiful hotel- well kept and clean. I had never stayed at Hyatt and would be back. Price was $189 which was reasonable for downtown Boston as there are few hotels and the ones that are there are very high ($300+). Lobby was jam packed with Swiss neurologists, so there was quite a line at check in, and there seemed to always be lines for the elevators for some reason. Pool/Fitness complex is VERY impressive- all new state of the art stuff, water, towels, very very clean. Everything seems new in the hotel. Staff was good- front desk was a little overly formal but was helpful and not stuffy. Conceirge was weak- the guy at the front desk was more helpful and we tried calling concierge at least 4-5 times (got voicemail the first 4 times) and they gave us a recommendation for a restaurant that was not what we wanted. I'd give this place a 5, except for I forgot my key once and the maid let us into the room without ANY ID. And- there is no in-room safe. Not good. Overall would def. stay again. Nice place, and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “be careful !!”
Reviews.Author: boatnit
Reviews.Content: I took my family for a Boston weekend vacation. I found the hotel to be in the perfect location for shopping, theater and food. For the most part the service was good. The room was rather small and cramped for 4 people and the bathroom was unusually small. You could not fit 2 people in there at the same time and the door would not open all the way due to the shower curtain bar. My son had bought some souvenirs with his own money and accidentally left it behind the window curtain. I telephoned the hotel as soon as I got home. Of course they did not find the bag and would call back after questioning the housekeeper. They called back the next day and I was told the housekeeper would not be in for a few days. A week went by with no phone call. When I called there, Bernadette, whom I've been speaking with still said that no bag was found. No explanation as to why they did not call back. I asked to speak to a manager but they were all in a meeting...conveniently. It seemed like she could not be bothered and didn't care. I will never stay there again just for the treatment I received from her and their dishonest staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt a delight”
Reviews.Author: flightsofancy
Reviews.Content: We got a great price for the Hyatt using Priceline and were so pleased with our stay. We have a 2 and a 7 year old and the staff could not have been nicer. The rooms were very elegant, the pool terrific with a sauna in the locker rooms. We ate breakfast in the hotel and it was absolutely delicious and incredibly expensive. The location is perfect --walking distance to the Commons. Strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: andrelabadie
Reviews.Content: A faceless, corporate hotel but no complaints really. The rooms were a decent size and pretty clean. Location was fine too, and the staff were friendly. Would happily stay here in future if away with work.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay fantastic Clean Clean Clean only one negative”
Reviews.Author: ourmiraclechris
Reviews.Content: This hotel Is SUPER CLEAN, the staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is right in the heart of Boston. The little touches in the room were amazing like the white ginger shampoo,soap and lotion. Room service is phenominal. The indoor pool was fun for our son and was very clean. There is concierge and a doorman the level of service is wonderful. Here is the negative the breakfast offered for $24.99 (buffet) was shockingly horrible. Not what is expected of such a high class hotel and 4 star establishment. Really the complete opposite of what we experinced with the rooms service food. Really a shame. Also I would not book with travelocity again. Their guarantee is a fraud. We found a lower price on their site within the 24 hrs and their 'technicality' is why they cannot honor the guarantee. Bad customer service for travelocity IMO be safe and book directly through the hotel or use hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Radiant1
Reviews.Content: I just returned from spending three days in Boston with my son during winter break. The staff couldn't have been accomodating and friendly. Our room (two doubles) was just great - very comfy beds (lots of pillows), clean attractive rooms and spacious enough for two. The fitness area has very up-to-date equipment and is suitable for all your basic needs. Pool is spacious, clean and great for both kids (somewhat shallow) or adults who want to swim laps. Our package included breakfast which was wonderful. A buffet variety hat would more than meet anyone's appetite needs. Close walking distance to many attractions: Theatres, Various Restaurants, Chinatown, Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market, Aquarium or to the Boylston T stop Green Line. We took a tour of Fenway Stadium - loved it. We would definately return again to this Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel, but seedy location.”
Reviews.Author: Carzook
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt over Valentines weekend. It was your typical Hyatt hotel but the location was kind of shotty. The surrounding blocks are unattractive and gloomy. I booked a room at a discounted rate so I was happy with my stay. When I go back to Boston however, I will probably look to book at another hotel only because of the surrounding area aound the Hyatt as well as the design of the building and it's awkward entrance. Other then that, I was happy with the other aspects of the hotel (ie - room, staff, decor, etc...).

Reviews.Title: “Return visitor- improvements have been made”
Reviews.Author: riclaw
Reviews.Content: While being the beneficiary of a great price from Priceline for the hotel, this was a return visit after 3 years absence. There are a number of very positive things about the hotel. It is within walking distance of South Station, Chinatown,and the Theater District. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms have been updated and upgraded recently with comfortable beds and nice stuff in the bathroom. The wireless internet(T-Mobile ) worked well. The breakfast buffet was above average with helpful staff. If the location works, this is a very friendly place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ron777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location - close to the business district and close to shopping and nice restaurants. The service was great and the room was perfect. It was exactly what a hyatt should be. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and friendly/professional staff”
Reviews.Author: fellow_traveler2
Reviews.Content: Well kept and clean rooms. Friendly and efficient service from reception, concierge and house-cleaning staff. Convenient to Downtown Crossing shopping area, Chinatown, and Boston Commons. Only drawback was the lack of a proper entrance/lobby--you have to enter through the sub-ground floor and take an elevator to get to the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Hi Praise for Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: TVDad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in the prettiest part of town, but it is a short walk to the theatre district, Boston Common, Fanieul Hall Marketplace, and other attractions we were interested in. Inside the hotel, friendly, cooperative staff answered questions about how to walk, drive, cab, or use public transportation to get to any location we needed. I loved the beds in the rooms! Very comfortable. Also very clean rooms and common areas. However, don't stay here if you're looking for a room with a view. You'll only see skyscrapers and highway from most rooms. We only used the restaurant at breakfast, where they had an excellent buffet, including all the standards plus smoked salmon and meats & cheeses prefered by europeans. They will also let you order off menu if there's something special you'd like (they made chocolate chip pancakes for my daughter at no extra charge). The bar served drinks with generous pours, although they were pricey! We did have dessert in the lounge one night, which also seemed a bit more expensive than it should have been. They do have a health club and an indoor pool. It's a bit of a walk to get there, although it is indoors. Nice equipment to work out with and great shower, sauna, steam facilities. No hot tub, which was a bit of a disappointment! All in all, we got great bang for the buck from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Tom2592
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Boston is a typical mid-scale business hotel located in an odd building whose immediate neighborhood is less than attractive, but close to many things. Staffers were eager to please. It is on a par with a Sheraton or Hilton, but a solid notch below a Westin or Omni. I would not object to staying there again, but if I am doing the reserving on a future Boston trip, I will seek a better alternative. We booked a larger, extra- cost "corner room". The building is shaped like a piece of pie and "corner" turned out to be the very point of the pie piece. What a weird room with truly useless space! The decor is OK, but nothing special. I'm 6'1" and my feet hung off the end of the King bed, though they did not hang off the end of our prior hotel's King bed and did not hang off the end of our subsequent hotel's queen bed. My conclusion is the King beds are wide but short. The quality of food and breadth of choice at the breakfast buffet were outstanding. The hotel somehow adjoins Boston's old retail heart and theater district. Both went to seed a long time ago. We never felt unsafe, only unimpressed. The hotel has only a tiny entrance at street level and then requires an elevator ride to the lobby on the third floor, which negates the sense of "entrance" you get when you walk into a nice hotel. Hyatt does a good job with a compromised building in a compromised neighborhood. The original architect should be serving a sentence in Design Prison. It is 5 minutes and a world away from Back Bay and Beacon Hill.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Benched
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1/20-1/23. I am very perplexed by the two previous reviews, as they seem to be describing a different hotel. First, let me start out with the customer service. Without exception, every staff member was friendly, and went out of the way to help, regardless of their position. It was very well staffed, and I didn't have to wait for check in, check out, or to talk to the concierge (Mike was extremely helpful). I felt a bit guilty having pizza delivered to such a lovely hotel,(my 16 yeard old son didn't want to go out) but one of the desk clerks overheard that they had not included napkins in my delivery - she quickly volunteered to go hunt for some! I saw no evidence of any of the hotel being outdated. Our room was immaculate, and was as up to date as they come. The room service meals were great (although a bit pricey). The athletic facility was excellent. The equipment was new (treadmills and bikes had built in tvs), and there were even refrigerated wet washcloths! The pool was rectangular and had a lane for lap swimming (18 yards), and rarely used. By the way, the location is about a block from the Boston Commons, and quite convenient. I would certainly not call it a sketchy neighborhood - it is just that it is adjacent to the financial district and Macy's, so that things get somewhat deserted at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with stay”
Reviews.Author: cruunited
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Boston Saturday night 1/20. We were very happy with the stay. They allowed for early check-in, arrived at 2:15 and check-in is not until 4, but they had no problem with giving us a room at 2:15. We stayed on the 19th floor and could see the gold dome of the State Capitol building. The room was very large, clean, and well taken care of. I've stayed at the Park Ave in Chicago and a few other top locations, so I can't give the Hyatt five stars, but I don't have anything bad to say. The parking was convenient, hotel was close to the commons, and walking distance to Fanuiel Hall and Newbury Street. It is on the corner of Chinatown and at night, going the other way, could get sketchy, but you would know not to go that way. It's very centrally located. $6 cab ride to Mistral's on Columbus. They are doing some facing work on the front side, so it's not as pretty to look at, but this is just maintenance. The lady on the phone who I booked it through advised me of this. For $150, the quality of the room, the service, and the location, it's a great deal. We had room 1925.

Reviews.Title: “Poor for a hyatt regency, never going back to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: snich
Reviews.Content: I travel often and frequently, and would never stay at the hyatt regency boston again. Iv never complained before but feel it necessary. When I stay at a hyatt i think of the one in lake tahoe, comfortable, nice pools, clean with good service. This hotel was dirty, poorly kept up, in a sketchy neighbourhood and the service was bad. The room was well worn! The housekeeper, never properly cleaned the room and left towels on the floor dirty and did not replace them. I am a gold passport member, and purchased an upgraded corner room, which was not even in the corner, and did not have 180 degree views as suggested. In a Hilton or marriott, they will at least upgrade you when you are a member or leave you drink coupons, a small bottle of wine, etc for special occassions however nothing on my birthday. I love boston, but this hotel was such a dissappointment that I will not stay at a hyatt unless necessary again.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed with the hyatt chain”
Reviews.Author: lottieti
Reviews.Content: Disappointed with the hyatt chain. First time we've ( my partner and I ) have stayed in a hyatt hotel and we won't again. We stayed over New years. Needs updating, security for New Years Eve wasn't very good or organised as we had a group in the room next to us that weren't booked into that room. Maid service wasn't very efficient. Our privacy sign on the door was ignored, we were only ever given one bathrobe and there were 2 of us, and the toilettries weren't always stocked up. When we left, they didnt put all our belongings in the taxi so we had to wait at the airport for them to send them. There were some positives in that the bed was very comfy, mike on the concierge was very helpful and the bar staff were brilliant. We have travelled many places around the world, and some of the hotels in the poorer countries have been by far better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Boston - Highest Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: JulesTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Boston over the New Year's Weekend. We found the location to be perfect for our trip - which was purely a weekend getaway for the holiday. With the T stop right out the door we were able to get over to Harvard, Copley, Aquarium so quickly and easily (purchased a day pass for $7.50 for unlimited rides - great thing to have). It was a little chilly so we could not walk around as much as we would have liked - but the T system saved us. The hotel was really clean; our room on the 19th floor had a terrific city view and of the Commons. The pool looked very nice but we were so busy we never had time to enjoy it. The staff was really fantastic from check-in to check out. The Concierge desk was so very helpful - we sought advice each day from Anthony (great) and the other Chap (also great) - it really assisted us planning our days. I highly recommend the Hyatt Regency at Boston! Great hotel and great staff. The big comfy beds were so fantastic we actually watched two pay-per-view movies while there and enjoyed the cozy room.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay at Hyatt Regency in Boston”
Reviews.Author: nononesense
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hyatt was excellent. Even though we booked the rooms via Priceline, the staff provided excellent services. We got a room on the 20th floor with beautiful views of the city and the water (maybe because we were their Gold member). The bed was so soft and huge for two people. The location is convenient within walking distance to everything: Chinatown (2 blocks), subway (red line is right around the corner), movie theaters (couple of blocks), opera house (just across the street), Boston Common, Fenuil Hall, Quincy market, shopping centers, North Street to the Old North Church and little Italy. By the way, if you like Italian food, try Antico Forno (93 Salem St, North End). The food was absolutely delicious, and the price was very reasonable. The only thing we didn't like about Boston is that the parking fee was outrageous ($26/night for self parking underneath the hotel). Use this one. Don't use the one across the street. It is not cheaper ($25/night). Be aware of the parking attentant at this parking lot. We used them the first night. The guy said that it would be $22/night for overnight parking. But when we went the next morning to get our car, the attendant demanded $25. We disagreed and paid $22. He didn't like it, but let us go. They changed their price on the board the next day. We parked our car in the garage underneath the hotel for the rest of our stay. No trouble after that. Overall, we highly recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Boston is the best”
Reviews.Author: P.Jordan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting family on Cape Cod and decided to spend the night in Boston before heading home. The Hyatt Regency is the best. We had a wonderful stay - great service - friendly staff from the time we walked into the hotel until we left. Location is perfect - we walked to Boston Commons, Faneuil Hall Market Place. The Beds - just unbelievable - and on the 17th floor - I really thought I was in heaven! Thank you for making our visit to Boston extra special. Pam Jordan

Reviews.Title: “love the hotel hated the staf”
Reviews.Author: natasha75
Reviews.Content: When i first walked in the hotel i thought it look really nice and i felt as if i was getting my moneys worth when i got to my room around 4:30 all i wanted to do was to eat something and just go to sleep since i had to drive all the way from New York City so i order room service it took for ever to be connected to teh room service department and when i finally did i was put on hol for about 5mins carmen the guy that answer the phone was rude even though i was beign really nice i felt as if i was ordering from burger king, when i made my order he said that itwould be in my room in 30mins well 50mins past and i called him and he said that he was sorry but he had forgotten to take my room number so my order was being held and he said that eh would send it right up. i asked him if it was going to take another 30 mins and he said that it wasn't because they had the foos made. At this moment i got really upset because i knew they were going to send me the dinner that had been sitting for a good 20 mins. i told him that i didn't want food that was sitting there for that long and he said that it wasnt so i believed him and i told him that it was fine when mark the server arrived with my food he was really nice and presented the food to me but i was dissapointed so when he left i called room service and carmen answer again really rudly, he didnt even bother to greet me he just said carmen speaking so i told him that i didn't want the food anymore because it look like it had been seating there for way too long so i wanted to cancel my order very rudly he said that if i didn't wanted in the 1st palce i shouln't have asked him to send the food up to my room, then he said that he need it to see the food and to make sure that i hadn't eaten it and i told him to come get it and he said fine and hung up he didnt;t ven give me the time to ask him if the charges were going to be taken off. when i went to check out the next day the room service charge was charged to my room... with people like carmen are the kind of people that make a good experience a terrible one would i stay at the hotel probably but no way would i recomend anyone to order room service because the terrible service of the guy answering the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: francis54
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights over the Thanksgiving holiday weekend. An extremely comfortable hotel with a great location - just two-and-a-half blocks southeast of the Boston Common! Staff was extremely helpful and courteous (gave us a free room upgrade), Filene's & Macy's just around the corner, and the "T" is less than two blocks and a safe walk through the Hyatt garage on Chauncey Street. I also used the 6th floor health club. It's clean, modern, and complimentary for guests. I've been traveling to Boston alot over the last year and this is the best hotel so far. Booked on Priceline for $99.00. I'd stay here anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: chris509
Reviews.Content: i gave my stay a 5-star because i rated it mainly on the room itself, which is really what i cared about. But overall i might say it's quite fair to say Hyatt Regency Boston's a 4-star hotel. Checking-in (*watch out) ------------------------------------------------- My friend booked two rooms on Priceline at the price of $138 per night three days before the trip. At about 3:45pm on September 30, 2006 (which was a Saturday), our party of four arrived at the check-in desk. The wait was okay, but as many other guest had suggested, we were told that there was no room available at the time (check out: 12; check-in: 4!!). We were assured, though, that there would be rooms for us when we come back later that night. The hotel staff were patient and nice. Our party was attended by a lady named Stephanie. i left my cell number and asked if we could have two rooms on a higher floor. i called back about 6:30pm, front desk said the rooms were open but not yet ready. At 8:00pm, the hotel called and said the rooms were ready. We went back to the hotel past 10pm, and were placed on 15th and 20th floor. i asked how the hotel dealt with the wait list, and was told it is on a first-come, first-served basis. Therefore, if you want to have a room available as soon as possible, make sure you come to the hotel when you get the chance. Don't wander off like our party did and don't wait till the last minute! Luggage ----------- Since our only piece of luggage was brought into the storage when we first checked in, i thought we had to wait a long time for them to come up, like some guests complained. But it came to our door within a fast 10 minutes! Room (size, cleanliness, etc) -------------- When you step out of the elevator, you can see right away that floor 19 to floor 22 has a loft-style waiting area, where there are comfortable chairs for guests. My husband and i were on the 20th floor (i believe the room number was 2034). The room has a king-sized bed, and the size was pretty decent (approx. 12 x 18). i think the width could actually fit two king-sized beds. i wanted to take some pictures, but my camera battery was so dead, and by the time it finally got fully charged, all our stuff was everywhere :-p The next morning we were in a hurry to leave, so...sorry for not being able to get more photos!! (Photos from previous travelers were very helpful; they reflected what i saw anyway.) The front desk said that rooms on higher floors have similar sizes, so i guess you can always ask for rooms on a higher floor. The room itself was quite clean. i liked the bathroom. There was a bamboo bowl on the sink counter with scented leaves and stuff, which was pretty pleasant. The view outside the window was okay, not a whole lot. Bed was very comfortable and nice. There were three sets of phones available in the room: one with a wireless headset, one wired by the bed, and also another in the bathroom. The hotel site says they provide bathrobes and slippers, but i didn't find the slippers. Fitness center and swimming pool ----------------------------------------------- Open till 11pm. The gym equipment is new and well maintained. Would have been nicer if it was open till a later time. i did see other guests come in at 11pm, and they weren't asked to leave. Neighborhood -------------------- A lot of guests complained about the neighborhood being "unsafe" or weird, i have to sort of agree. i wasn't really concerned, since there were 4 of us. During the day when all the shops are open, there are a lot of people around, but it is true that the whole area die down after it gets dark. Seemed like most shops are close at 8 or 9pm. Watch out if you need to get back to the area very late and if you need to get a quick bite. There is a 7-11 on the other side of the hotel entrance (which is near Macy's), but for others such as CVS, i think they are really quite a walk. i didn't try to look this up, but i read it online that the hotel is "connected" to Macy's. So if you are concerned about the safety, maybe you can get to Macy's from within the hotel, and then the subway station (the "T") is quite near. i found the location okay, it's quite a nice walking (about 10-min) distance from Quincy Market. i personally perfer taking the subway, which saves much time. At the location you can easily walk to Boston Commons, Chinatown, the State House area, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel as long as you don't have to interact with the staff”
Reviews.Author: Mikesgirl2006
