Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency is a beautiful hotel and in a great location to see all the sights of downtown Boston. However, except for the helpful, informative, doormen the service is awful. When we checked in we were told that the hotel was overbooked (we had made these reservations 5 months+ in advance) and they would need to move us to another hotel for one night. After reviewing our reservation they changed their mind and our room suddenly was available. After we were checked in, we left a message at the concierge desk for directions that was never returned. The front desk couldn't help with directions or local sight information either. We went to the lobby and had driving directions basically thrown at us by the concierge, who was too busy talking to the other members of the concierge desk to help us. Lastly, there isn't a jacuzzi and the pool was cramped.

Reviews.Title: “What a Deal!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaFM
Reviews.Content: Traveling on vacation for 3 weeks with my 13 year old son, I wanted to budget lodging at 200.00 a night. I felt fortunate to get a rate under 200.00 with my AAA card at the Hyatt for 7 nights. Because we could not get a room our first 2 nights at the Hyatt, we ended up paying 350.00 at another hotel. The other hotel was in a better location (Back Bay) and the rooms more luxurious but the Hyatt was just as comfortable. The Hyatt staff were all so nice and we never heard any noise in our room...sleeping in during our vacation! Upon arrival, I too was concerned about the location since we were using the T during our stay and returning to the hotel late at night but if you walk from the T and enter the Hyatt from the parking garage entrance, it's just 1 block and a much quicker walk. We never had any problems. I highly recommend this hotel. It was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “They try hard”
Reviews.Author: BarefootTom
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 1723 for two nights while on a business trip to Boston. The Hyatt was the only hotel in the central part of downtown with a decent rate for the nights I wanted. I found the hotel to be very quiet and comfortable, with a staff that tries hard to ensure you have a pleasant stay. I did have some issues about the neighborhood, however. I was out walking after an early dinner (it was still light out) and was approached by a man in front of the nearby abandoned Paramount Theater who asked for money in a very aggressive way. The sidewalks around the Hyatt were littered with trash both days I was there and even the cab driver said "this is not the best part of Boston". But the Ritz Carlton is only three blocks away, so it seems the area is on the upswing. I recommend this hotel but be careful in the area at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Stitchers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights with our two children. We reserved a "corner room" which is about 650 sq feet. We didn't have any trouble with any of the staff. They were all more than nice to us. They even sent cookies up to our room when they found out that it was my daughter's birthday. The pool is very nice as well. Neighboorhood was fine except for a couple blocks in one direction. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds!”
Reviews.Author: tempra23
Reviews.Content: We stayed the nights of July 3- July 6 This hotel was pretty easy to locate. There is a parking garage right next store with decently priced SELF parking. Valet is too expensive. One thing we didn't like was that you can't use a luggage cart and take up your own luggage. We had to have a bellman do it. This was a pain because we didn't want to be stuck waiting a long time for our stuff. We were lucky we only had to wait about 15 min after getting to the room. Also when checking in the room didn't have a fridge, as I requested one. So one was brought up right away. Also we ended up not being charged extra for it like I was quoted. The rate was good for one king bed room, about 165 gov't rate. The AAA rate was slightly higher for that time frame. The bed was VERY comfortable. We could have slept until noon if time allowed. There were hardly enough towels though. We were able to manage without having to call for more. The tub/shower was roomy and there was plenty of counter space in the bathroom. There were also robes in the closet. A mini bar was also located in the room. DON'T TOUCH THESE. Its motion sensor so even if you move something you will be charged $6 for a bag of M&Ms! We just kept it closed. We had no problem with noise except for a couple kids in the hall above us but they were quiet after 9. The pool area is decent. There is also an outside balcony by it. The locker-rooms by the pool are nice and have a sauna and steam room and showers. The hotel looked like it was in a shady area at first but after walking around we had no problems feeling safe. There are a bunch of stores about a block over as well as a couple T stops within 5 min walking. The Boston Common is just a block over along with the freedom trail. This was a good hotel in a pretty central location. Its probably about a 15/20 min walk to Quincy market.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Some problems with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: slickoperator
Reviews.Content: I booked a four day stay in this hotel for me and my wife, so that we could have a getaway in early summer 2006. To tell the truth, it was a bit disappointing. I arrived at 2.30 in the afternoon after a fairly gruelling three and a half hour train ride from New York to be told, before I had said anything else, that I was politely asked to go away until six o'clock in the evening because the hotel had some sort of difficulty with its accommodations. I quietly and politely explained that, given that I was paying a hefty sum for my room, I really hadn't expected to be told this, especially as I had just got off a hot, sweaty train after a long ride. This was politely ignored. The receptionist gave me a map of downtown Boston and told me to go away for three and a half hours. I agreed to do so but it was not without some (suppressed) infuriation. I don't know whether you've ever walked around downtown Boston before. I had, and knew that killing time for three and a half hours would not be easy. And all I really felt like doing was taking a shower and a rest. My wife was due to arrive at Logan airport at 6.30pm, and I had not wanted to do anything but lie down. However, that was not an option so I did indeed walk around the town for three and a half hours. This is no way for a hotel of any quality to behave. If they had a problem with their bookings, it was their job to get that right, not to penalise their customers. (My booking, by the way, had been in their system, for months.) The room they gave us was satisfactory, but for the money I paid, I thought it small. For much less money, I was given a much larger room at the Affinia Dumont, and that was in New York City. My wife and I ate on our first evening at the downstairs bar. The menu is limited and uninspiring. The hotel restaurant has a better menu, but we didn't want to try it. Frankly, the smallness of our room just made us want to get out of the hotel completely and go to restaurants in town. In other respects I would describe this hotel's facilities as adequate. If you're a business traveller and just need somewhere for one night, it's fine. But whoever you are: be warned. This is the kind of joint where, even if you've just arrived at a reasonable hour, they're quite capable of making you wait 3 and a half hours to get into your room. And I just don't think any hotel of quality has the right to do that. (It compares badly with the Marriott at Cambridge, by the way. I arrived there at 6am to check in and they checked me in immediately, without question.)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Terry9
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is within walking distance of many areas of Boston. Walking in to the lobby was a treat--lot's of candles and warmth. Our room was excellent. The bed couldn't have been more comfortable--very plush. All other amenities were wonderful, too. We got a special AAA rate for our stay here that included breakfast vouchers. The waitstaff at breakfast were wonderful. Very warm and friendly. Our two-night stay here was part of a two week "road trip." It was the most expensive hotel we stayed at, but felt worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “good deal in Boston”
Reviews.Author: mattabessett
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in two rooms at the Hyatt over the weekend. Got a AAA rate of $186 per room on Hyatt.com several weeks in advance, but checked back a week later and saw the rate had dropped to $140, so cancelled the first reservation and reserved the improved rate. Also online found a code for free breakfast and used that in the reservation, so it pays to check the hotel's website! Had checked other reviews here and knew what to do: use the self park rather than more expensive valet, and carry your own bags to avoid the wait. As others noted, you have to use two elevators to get from street to room, but no big deal. The street outside is ugly and has run-down buildings for sure, but did not in any way feel unsafe to me. Two blocks from downtown crossing shopping, two blocks from the Boston common, right next to chinatown, so we actually thought it was a good location for getting around. Inside, the hotel was great looking, room was large for a city hotel, service was all good, and the buffet breakfast was awesome, especially if you can get it free! We also used the pool every day, and the kids loved it! For the price we paid I thought it was great value and I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad points”
Reviews.Author: NSHP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from Sat 20th May for 3 nights. The room was very smart, the bed and bedding very comfortable, the bed was very high - hard for me to get onto! The air con switched on and off a few times during the night which woke me up a few times, so that could have been more user freindly. Also the fridge buzzed a few times also (the fridge cannot be opened, unless you want to be charged). There was a kettle and hot drinks for free. The hotel is very pleasant and the bar area nice. I would say that I did not like the location it was in, as it seemed to be surrounded by some 'unsavoury' streets, we did not feel safe even during the day and so had to get taxis out in the eve (I live in London, so can comment on unsafe areas). Another bad experience was that when we checked in, the porters took our bags and 2 hours later we were still waiting for them to be sent to our room. I telephoned about 4 times and in the end my husband had to go to reception to complain. I had visions of our bags being lost, which was not a nice thought after the long flight we had just had. If you want a clean, comfortable hotel for a good price, this is a good choice, but bear in mind the location is not safe. I think that a lot of the competitor hotels in Boston can charge more as they are in nicer areas. This also struck me as a business hotel/ used for conventions.

Reviews.Title: “Staff can not handle the busy times!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel around 11pm on Friday of Memorial Day weekend. We are a family of 4 so we booked a room with 2 double beds. We knew that we would be checking in late so we called to make sure that we would still be able to get the room that we had booked. Durning this phone call they never bothered to take our names or look up our reservation, just said "no problem" to the late check-in. At the time we didn't think anything of this. When we arrrived they told us that a room with two beds was not available and would not be available for our entire three night stay. Mind you, I booked this room 4 months in advance. We were told that we would get a room with one king bed and a sofa. One of our children would have to sleep on the sofa (not a pull out) and the other would get a roll a way bed. When we explained that this was completeley unacceptable and asked what had happeded to our reservation for a room with two beds, they basically said, "sorry, nothing we can do". I was quite irate, because providing a bed for each of it's gets is a hotels most basic service and they were failing to do that. The next morining I phoned the "Perfect Stay Ambassador" and she was very sympathetic and told me that we would get a new room that day. I made arrangements with her to have our luggage moved to the new room while we were out sightseeing. Upon returning later in the day to our new room (with 2 beds) our luggage was not there. We had to phone several different departments to track down our luggage and it was temporarily lost. It took them a very long time to locate it and bring it to the room. There were other little complaints that I had about the hotel, that alone they would not have been a big deal, but after the disaster with the room assigment, the other problems just left me feeling more aggrevated. The sink in the bathroom was clogged, the thermostat in our rooom wasn't working and them maid never left enough towels for four peoople. We were constantly calling to get them brought up. Also, since it was a holiday weekend the hotel was booked to full capacity. There were several groups of college students staying at this hotel and they were quite noisy in the middle of the night. The atruim design of the hotel makes this very bad for noise. I will certainly never stay at this property again, and I will think twice before staying at another Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “always a good stay”
Reviews.Author: redsox19
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times now and love it. It provides the best of both worlds, Shopping very close by for my wife and many pubs for me. We are both in our early 50's and we walk every where. The longest walk we take is to Fenway by the way of Newbury St. which is about 2 miles and takes us about 40 mins. Everything else is no more than a 5 to 15 mins walk. Their are a couple of draw backs...1 don't plan on checking in much before 4pm unless you are really lucky. 2. if you have your luggage stored once you check in plan on it taking about 1 hr to get it to your room. We have solved the problem by not using the valet parking and just self parking same enterance as the Valet parking. Your save $9 a day $26 vs $35 and you can leave your luggage in the car and just get it when you get your room. It can be a mad house around 4 in the lobby so plan on it. Other than that I have never had a problem here. We will be back in Aug. for our next Sox game.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed, Hotel needs more staff”
Reviews.Author: Tilly&Kyle
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency on a rainy weekend in Boston. The hotel is situated extremely close to the theatre district, and is convenient to lots of restaurants and shopping. The room was very large and the bed was fantastic. Our only complaint about the room was during the night there were very loud plumbing sounds from within the walls. The breakfast in the restaurant was extremely tasty (French toast was great), but the service was very spotty. The staff was very courteous, but there were not nearly enough of them. This was a theme with most of the hotel staff. We would consider staying at this hotel again, but will probably consider other hotels in the area next time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: frednuff
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel tired after a long flight. I just wanted to check-in quickly and rest. But there was a long line to check in. Then it turns out the room wasn't ready (1400hrs). So went out for a coupke of hours walk. The room was medium sized, furnished to an OK standard. Bed was very comfortable but bath room was small and dated. Breakfast was good but expensive. Best thing about the hotel is the location. + Location + Breakfast - rooms not great - Strange entrance via lift to lobby - expected more from a Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hackett2069
Reviews.Content: Before my husband and I go anywhere, I do extensive research on hotels, restaurants, and other attractions. This hotel got some very good reviews, especially for the beds. The beds were wonderful. The hotel itself is in a safe neighborhood and was very clean. Those are my absolute musts. The staff was very helpful and friendly, from the valet parking guys to the front desk to the very busy concierge. Close to the public transportation and within walking distance (if you like walking as we do) of many attractions. The only bad thing about our weekend was the weather, which was COLD. This hotel was not actually my first choice because of the price. But we got a discount from Travelocity so it became a little more affordable, and really wasn't outrageously priced. As far as the mini bar, my husband did the same as one of the other reviewers, picked out a bottle to look at and then saw the sign that said we would be charged. It did not appear on our bill after all. At checkout the clerk printed us a Mapquest when we inquired about printers in the Internet area. We are planning to go back to Boston in warmer weather and will definitely consider returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: CalicoGirl
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The room was excellent, the service terrific, and everyone who worked there was very friendly. It was elegant, clean and comfortable. I felt very safe inside the hotel. There was a bar and a restaurant in the lobby, but I did not use either. This is a good location if you are going to the theater or like to shop. It is pretty close to the subway also. I will say the Boston subway is scary to me. I would not ride it at night as a woman traveling alone. After you get off the subway you still have a little walking to do to get to the hotel, which I would not do alone at night. If you take a cab, you will be fine. Or if you use the subway in the daytime you should be fine. Just be sure to be on the platform going the correct direction. I found that Bostonians are friendly and if you ask them for advice on using the subway, they will help you. Wicked was playing at the theatre just down the street from the hotel which would be a straight shot down the street to the hotel and a safe walking distance in my opinion - just not a safe area from the subway alone at night. I feel much safer in New York City alone than I do in Boston. The hotel itself is terrific though, the only drawback was the area at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zadok99
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Boston is a good hotel. It is in a great location and it provides a very professional service. Everything went well during my stay in this hotel. The only trap is the mini-bar which registers and automatically charges to your room account whenever anything is removed from the fridge. Putting it back does not undo this charge! So beware of picking up the little bottle of pretty things to see what it is because as soon as you do it is yours whether you want it or not!

Reviews.Title: “i love the location of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelescully
Reviews.Content: i was travelling with my son and we were here for five nights - feb 11th to 16th. we have stayed here before several times so knew what to expect. the rooms are clean and comfortable - no view worth mentioning, with small bathrooms. the concierge staff are excellent - they always are and took care of our bookings to wrentham village and reconfirmed our flights back to england. the breakfast buffet is fine - with a continental and full option - be aware that the price varies - it is sometimes $17.95 and sometimes $20 - depending on which menu they give you to order from! you can upgrade to a business plan which includes breakfast for two, internet access etc we declined as we didn't have a laptop with us - now if they had inroom computers it would have been worth it! we like it here - we like the fact that it so close to shopping. if in boston again we will probably stay here - especially if we can get a good deal with priceline or hotwire - we paid $66 + taxes and were happy with that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travel59
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went up for a quick weekend trip to Boston. We were delighted with the Hyatt Regency Boston. We are both very particular - and have frequently been disappointed in hotel stays. We found this hotel to be above average in all areas - especially in cleanliness, which is of utmost importance. The location was outstanding. The view was good. We took a Silverline bus from the airport - for $1.25 each - and were able to walk just a couple of blocks to the hotel. The location is fantastic. It is within walking distance of many important/interesting sites and an easy walk to the subway line that takes you most anywhere in the city. We would definitely stay at the Hyatt Regency Boston again. No problems to report, except that if you go to bed early - the noise from the doors closing, throughout the hallway, makes it a bit hard to sleep through.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. Friendly staff, good size room, huge bed! Great choice for breakfast Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: reet65
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here St Pat's weekend 3/17 to 3/19.We got a steal at $99.00 a night ( thru Hotels.com). the rooms were very nice, fairly spacious, clean and the beds were comfortable. friday night was st Pats and we saw plenty of revelers and when some came back to our floor we could hear them shouting in the hallway( but I am not sure walls made of steel would have dampened the noise and it wasn't for long) Loved the big bathroom vanity ( 2 women and our assorted necessities can take a lot of room) We were given a voucher for one free breakfast both days in the hotel dining room. Why only one, we don't know, but when it came time to get the bill for breakfast we were charged $21.00 for the buffet. Apparently that's what they charge per person. Now I am not cheap, but given what was offered in the buffet, we thought the price was exorbitant. No carving or omelet station or anything like that. Otherwise the staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were nice, just don't eat at the buffet, they have a regular breakfast menu.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Figured Hyatt was going to be nice since its a reputable chain, but WOW! We flew in on the red-eye and they let us check in at 6am, which I've NEVER been able to do anywhere. The hotel was beautiful and modern, with great triphop/ambient music piped through out. The room was clean and decorated well The bathroom was huge, the bed was so comfortable. Our housekeeper put things back exactly where she'd found them. By far the most helpful was the concierge who we kept making random requests of, but everytime he delivered! Highly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hyatt Regency!”
Reviews.Author: giddyup_IRL
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great city. All staff we encountered were very friendly, helpful and professional. Reception changed our room because we didnt want an interconnecting room and they gave us some great recommendations for local bars (The Littlest Bar and The Hub were both great spots). Waiting staff at breakfast were great too. I can heartily recommend the King rooms. Nice size and a fantastic bed, spotlessly clean and nice decor. Hotel is in a great location - nothing wrong with the neighbourhood. In the daytime theres a walkway directly to Macys. We were there for the blizzard so it was nice to be able to go shopping without having to brave the elements. Very near to the Park Street and Downtown Crossing Stations and only a 10-12 min walk to Faneuil Hall. About $20 each way by cab to/from airport Enjoyable stay in a nice hotel on our first visit to a great city. When we go back we'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel only let down by some areas of the fitness club”
Reviews.Author: Daithio
Reviews.Content: Got a fanastic rate for this hotel on ----. I had 4 rooms booked for business. The location is excellent, only $20 in a cab from the airport and right beside the main shopping area's and Boston common. The reception area and the rooms were super, clean and with good charachter, the staff were also very friendly. The only let down was the mens changing rooms in the fitness club. The pool itself was only adequate but the showers are pretty awful (just 1 and one for disabled, the regular one was old and cold, the diabled one the same) and the sauna wasn't properly turned on (again it was cold), having come down at 7.30am this is more than annoying, One tip, if on check out day you're reckoning on leaving your bags with the reception and concierge, leave plenty of time for collecting them as this increasingly seems to be a chaotic service in U.S. hotels. If you can take a walk through the common to Charles Street on Beacon Hill,there's a breakfast place (est.1937) called the Paramount which is about the best I've ever been in. If you get a good rate this hotel is really unbeatable but if you're paying the full rate you should defintely consider if you need to use the men's health club which is well below standard although the running machines are fine. There also seems to be an issue with wireless internet access which boringly has to be purchased through out the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. everything is very good. We booked thru priceline and the price is very good for this kind of hotels. The only thing that is not convenient is that the lobby is on 3rd floor and you must take elevator for 2 times to get to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently terrific!”
Reviews.Author: magrose621
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Hyatt in the Financial District and I can't say enough about the location, cleanliness and friendly staff! The hotel, which has undergone recent renovations, is just steps from Chinatown, Downtown Crossing, the Theatre District and the Park Street T stop. You can't find a better deal for this location! Our room was exceptionally clean with a marble bathroom and shampoo and soap dispensers in the shower (personally, I love that feature!) The bed was simply luxurious and the complimentary Boston Globe a treat. The 18th floor view was a plus and we found it very quiet. We found an amazing deal on Expedia ($109 for a king bed) and couldn't have been happier with our room. I can't speak to the Hyatt's restaurant or bar, because there are so many other options nearby to try that we didn't stick around except to sleep. A few food suggestions: JJ Foley's on Kingston Street is a great Irish pub with excellent food, and try the Malaysian cuisine at Penang on Washington Street in Chinatown - - fantastic and the price is right! We'll be back at the Hyatt again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay there”
Reviews.Author: blasketisland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the first week of Dec 05 for four nights. Must agree both with my colleague from Ireland and with the reviewer from LA on both counts of shopping and slight problems. More so than using the seperate lifts I thought the stairs on the entrance were a problem with heavy luggage caring them down them. However to be fair also to the hotel, I think in hindsight our cab driver should have pulled around to the side entrance within the car park which would have made things a bit easier. We did have a room on the 15th floor so that does afford great views of Boston. Didnt think there was anything particularly wrong with the neighbourhood more than the usual things you see late at night, though a bit more street lighting would make one feel more secure. The hotel staff were very helpful as was our housekeeping. We didnt spend much time in our room as the Macys and Filenes were way too near for my girlfriend not to get tempted to visit, some days several times. The pool and fitness centre were great too and the hotel always seemed to be buzzing, in the evening at least, with people who had been attending conferences there. That did add to the atmosphere a little All in all I would stay there again, it was value for the rate I felt, plus having stayed in the Boston Harbor for the preceeding four nights, I was a little worried that it would be a major let down. My fears were unfounded as although the hotel isnt a world beater it more than lives up to its billing. It does exactly what it says on the tin.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Shoppers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights just before Thansgiving. The hotel is in a great location for those whose sole intent is shopping, shopping, shopping. Conviently located close to two T-stations, the hotel offers access to all areas of Boston city. The neighbourhood isn't great, but with its close proximity to major department stores and great restauants this is a small compromise. Staff were extremely helpful and the rooms were lovely and clean. Request a room on the higher floors for a fantastic view of Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking hotel that needs some staff traning”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am going bullet the highlights it's much easier to read: * I was with two (2) co-workers for this trip and a client. We had a nice rate for being right in the heart of Boston. All of our flights arrived early , so I had called ahead two days before our arrival to arrange an early check-in for myself (Co-worker and my client) * Hotel is hard to find if you are looking it up on anything online because of the name change and it's not that easily seen from the street. * Parking layout is interesting and does not look so good * We arrived at 12pm and the property looks great very clean, but we were welcomed by numerous signs on large boards explaining they were sold out the night before and check-in might be a little slower and early checks were not allowed. Their intentions might have been good by communicating this sold-out problem ahead of time, but every person I saw (including myself and co-worker) were put on edge the moment they read the sign a lot of "oh great were in trouble now" kind of feelings...So your angry before you even get to the desk * When we went to the desk I informed them that I requested an early check-in and it was confirmed two days ago I was out of luck cause the rooms were not ready. * They took my cell phone # and told me they'd call me when the room was ready (almost four hours later)(called at 4pm) * Food in restaurant was "okay" service was excellent , Soup was really really bad (their special chicken noddle) , told the waiteress and she took it off the bill * Got to my room at 4pm , looks great I think that I was put in a larger room based on the problems at check-in cause my co-workers all complained their rooms were super small. * My client did not get into his room until 8pm (all the rooms were still not ready) , only to be woken up at 12am by a false alarm fire drill , hotel desk/security people forgot they were outside and never advised them to come back inside.......Which is really strange cause nobody knocked on my door to let me know their was a fire alarm....(that made me feel safe)...no alarm speakers in the hotel rooms * Hard beds ...very very low to the ground * No bath soap in room regardless of how many times I called and asked for it , they have the dispenser in the shower with three types of soaps (mine was broken) * Bellmen took forever to deliever luggage , they were busy so I'll cut them some slack on this , but I did need to call and remind them they had my luggage twice * Internet is all WI-FI by T-mobile , you need to log on to their site and pre-pay to them. If you do not have a wi-fi card you can get an adapter (make sure to call ahead on this I got the last one) , a $250 refundable deposit is taken until it's returned on checkout * Overall great looking hotel (except the hard beds) , but you get the feeling the staff is new and just learning how to deal with being busy....So ...great product without the customer service to match it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, GREAT staff”
Reviews.Author: Platna
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 10-minute walk from South Station which is very convenient. The neighborhood is not that seedy, but it's not great, either. We just walked on Washington St. to and from since it's full with people almost all night. The rooms are average size, clean and the bed was great. The bathtub had some rings around it but other than that it was fine. The restaurant and lounge are nice for late drinks. The health center is great - it has a good-sized pool (but not too big), a steam room, all kinds of workout equipment with flat-screen TV's overhead, massage rooms and separate saunas (for men and women). But what really makes this place worth it is the staff. They are extremely curteous, attentive and quick. When we ordered glasses and a bottle opener at 2am someone ran it up from the kitchen in about 5 minutes. Same with everything else we wanted. There were some unwarranted charges on our bill (be careful about moving anything in the mini bar as they are on sensors and you get charged automatically) but the front desk clerk took care of it right away. We also got an early check in (about an hour) and our room preference. They offer to store bags at the concierge if you have to check out but your flight leaves later - gave us an extra half day in the city. Theft or anything of the kind was not a problem as we left money, passports and all kinds of valuable stuff in the room. Nothing was touched. However, there was a problem that the front desk could not fix - no hot water on Saturday morning. Everyone was taking a shower and I guess they didn't have enough. The cold shower did not feel too good. Other than that, our stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotwire price, but beware high parking costs!!”
Reviews.Author: Camdeninnseeker
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in November. The Hyatt was fine for the discounted price we paid on Hotwire. However the hotel does not have its own car park and the parking fee of $26.00 per day (or$36.00 per day for valet parking) adds a substantial extra to the cost. The pool/gym area was very nice. Overall everything was fine at this hotel, nothing was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; lousy guests”
Reviews.Author: chriswin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hyatt Thanksgiving weekend. The staff is extremely pleasant and helpful, even during busy periods - I arrived Thanksgiving day and the restaurant was completely booked but I was able to enjoy the same dinner in the lounge and the staff was very attentive. The rooms are great; the bed is so comfortable you may not want to get out of it. I liked the T-Mobile Wireless Internet - it's $9.95 for a 24-hour period. I'm not a fan of the dispenser in the shower for shampoo, conditioner and shower gel but I suppose it does help keep expenses low. The neighborhood can be scary at night but there are safe pockets for you to walk if you want. The only problem I had was with the two different parties who were in the adjoining room. On Friday night, the first group decided to stay up and talk all night and I finally had to call the front desk after 3:00 a.m. to see if they could do something about it. Saturday night was fine, but on Sunday morning the second party decided to get up extremely early and carry on a loud conversation where one member kept laughing loudly every few seconds. Since I couldn't sleep any more, I just checked out early. The front desk suggested that next time I ask for a room that does not have an adjoining room. All in all, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just one night on a weekend on a business trip. The hotel interior was very nice and the staff friendly and helpful. Our room wasn't ready at check-in at 5:00 PM, but they gave us a complimentary drink and appetizer and called on the cell phone when the room was ready a short time later. What was disappointing was the exterior and the area around it. To get to the street was circuitous and then you had to go back upstairs (carrying wheeled luggage), so awkward on checking out and meeting my car service. The area around it was fairly seedy and dark on a street way off the mainstream, so a bit uncomfortable at night. The weakness of the staff is that they weren't particularly helpful in providing advice about nearby restaurants, so didn't travel too far in the dark. The next morning, discovered nice restaurants nearby and that we were only a few blocks away from Boston Commons and the theater district. Who would have known.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Texan2000
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on priceline - for $100 a night. The room wasn't huge, but was nice and clean and had a very comfortable king size bed. also got a free newspaper at my door every morning. Great location - only a five minute walk to the subway. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Boston Option”
Reviews.Author: dale_river
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and was perfectly happy. (Got a good rate on Hotwire which made the stay extra pleasant.) This hotel used to be the Lafayette and is very plush. My room had a view of the gleaming statehouse dome and downtown Boston. Very comfy bed with a fluffy pillowtop, upscale bath amenities, very quiet. Only complaint is it took a really long time to retrieve my checked luggage, inexplicably locked in a room off the parking garage (instead of the more usual lobby checkroom). Also, hotel parking is rather expensive. But overall it's a lovely hotel in a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Usual Hyatt quality except for...”
Reviews.Author: LarrySF0523
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent Hyatt guest at properties around the globe, and I am somewhat disappointed at this particular property. I had to move to 3 different rooms on the same day before finding one that I "liked". The first room on the 17th floor was great except that I heard everything in the hall and next door, so the sound insulation was not great. I moved to something on the 8th floor near the end of the hall which was supposedly a non-smoking room. But, my allergies kicked in immediately as the slightest hint of smoke, so I moved to something on the 11th floor near the end of the hall. By that time I was frustrated and tired of moving that I just gave up and stayed in the last room. All 3 rooms had severe grout issues in the shower. And, the hotel had shower dispensers for the bath amenities (shampoo, conditioner, bath gel) which I don't care for (I like sealed containers). On a more positive note: The room service personnel were the outstanding and genuinely pleasant folks I've come to expect from Hyatt. Service was prompt, servers acknowledged me by name, food was hot. Had breakfast in the restaurant and encountered similarly great service that is uniquely Hyatt. Loved the T-Mobile wireless service in the guest rooms. Great location; just a block from Macy's and Filene's; right at the foot of the entry to Chinatown; right in the Financial district; block from Boston Common.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall- I must say the hotel was very comfortable, typical Hyatt quality. I have travelled globally and rate this hotel as very nice. However, the food in the main restaurant is very expensive. I found staff to be very friendly as well.. Rooms were what you would expect from a Hyatt. The bed was awesome- so comfortable you did not want to get up in the am.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms...”
Reviews.Author: jennybear
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, I thought that this hotel would be great for my four day stay in Boston however I was wrong. My husband and I have traveled extensively and have never stayed in a dirtier hotel. When my husband pulled down the comforter on the bed, there was hair in between the sheets and stuck in the pillows. We called the front desk to complain and they sent new sheets promptly however they handed us the sheets and walked away. In addition, the sheets were the wrong size. In addition, there was a piece of someoneâ€™s toenail on the carpet (they donâ€™t vacuum) and a large clump (about half an in thick) of wet hair on the ledge in the shower (or clean the shower). Also the bathroom sink and toilet had not look like they were cleaned in weeks. We returned to our room one afternoon while our room was being made up and to my surprise other guests were allowed to enter our room to complain to the cleaning staff about similar issues in their room. I was appalled at this since no one was watching these â€œvisitorsâ€� as they were in our room. While watching this, I figured out why the room was so dirty. The cleaning staff only carries a spray bottle and a dirty rag to clean everything with. They use that same rag to clean the bathroom and the dressers. They place the â€œcleanâ€� sheets and towels on the floor in the hall. After complaining to the manager, I only received an, â€œIâ€™m sorry about the inconvenience.â€�

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmskas
Reviews.Content: My family (spouse & 2 kids age 2 & 4) & my mother stayed at the Hyatt Regency for a family wedding for 4 days. (Aug. 26-29) We fly in to Logan & took the new Silver Line from the airport (only 1.25 each for the adults (kids were free & only .35cents for my senior citizen mom). It was not too bad of a walk to the hotel using strollers & wheeled luggage). This is not a bad option in good weather if you want to save some money. Check-in went fine. The front desk person was a little too sarcastic (she was trying to be funny). So when we asked how long it would take for our luggage to arrive at our room we thought she was kidding when she said 3-4 hours. (We arrived later into Boston than planned since the airline was late so we really needed our luggage quickly to get ready for the wedding.) After 3 phone calls & promises to get our luggage to us we finally got it an hour later & with only 15 minutes to get ready for the wedding. Luckily we made it in time. This was the only bad experience we had. The hotel overall was very clear and attractive & had a very nice scent whenever you entered the hotel lobby. The room was also very attractive and clean. The beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was clean & well stocked. We had the opportunity to visit the hotel where my other siblings stayed (Boston Park Plaza) & found it very outdated & somewhat dingy). The Regency was a good location for most of the activities we wanted & the "T" was a very short walking distance & very easy to use. It was only my 2nd time to Boston & was sometimes disoriented while walking --but were quickly offered assistance from local Bostonians who obviously noticed our lost faces!! The indoor pool area was very nice & a good outlet for the kids. We did not eat at the hotels restaurants. Overall the staff was friendly & helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel & would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and VERY expensive Parking”
Reviews.Author: Checco
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on Priceline, so it was worth it. Room and particularly the bed are outstanding. The hotel itself is very nice. The location is very nice, all downtown attractions are walking distance. Only a couple of points: . it took 4 ours to have our luggage in the room and the bellman asked explicitly for tip even if the service was horrible. . they gave us a non-smoking room that had a strong smoke smell . they do not have parking spot and no convention with the adiacent parking...self parking is 26USD for overnight stay, but you are charged every time you go in and out (8USD per hour) Valet parking is 36USD.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hyatt Property”
Reviews.Author: toledopirate
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in downtown Boston, even nicer as I was there on business and could expense the trip. Hotel has been renovated, including the lobby and their rooms. Lobby is just stunning, room is also decorated just like the pictures on their web site. Staff was very courteous and helpful. The Sealy 700 plush bed in my room was really over the top. Breakfast was nice, though a bit pricey if you are on a budget. I thought this Hyatt was classier than the Hyatt Regency Cambridge, where I went to visit a client. I ate dinner at the hotel restaurant, their waitstaff was very busy with a banquet but served me as quickly and graciously as they could. I would stay here again and bring my family.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband booked our room thru Priceline a month or so in advance, and we were pleased to find this room for $75 a night. In researching the nearest T stop however, I was a bit confused as the website for the hotel only showed driving directions so we had to be a bit creative and remembered one prior guest's review that mentioned the close proximity to Macy's and shopping, so we chose to get off the T at the Downtown Crossing stop, which has a few entrances & exits, but I had printed off a small map and we did find our way to the hotel's entrance. (once you find your bearings in the city, I'd suggest the Park St. T stop) (MBTA has a great website with trip planning tools if you can check it out in advance) The hotel itself does sit in an area that could be a little sketchy in the evenings, as the entrance is on a street without much going on, but we did find all the staff at the Hyatt to be friendly and helpful. It was quite hot and humid during our 2 night stay and we had hoped to check in a bit early but since we requested a room on the higher level, we did have to wait a bit. Our room with king size bed was on the 21st floor, and the only other folks we passed or heard were some staff. The room was spacious & clean with a comfy bed. Our remote control was tempermental, and another one was brought up to us promptly. I would be cautioned however as to whether eating at the hotel is worth the time or money as we were going to have breakfast there, but it looked to be quite pricey, and at the suggestion of another guest as to her wait time, we chose to move along. I was just as happy to find a nearby Dunkin Donuts and splurge later on lunch & dinner! Another caution I might add would be if anyone is sensitive to frangrance allergies, be aware that there is potpouri in the rooms along with the strong scent of the supplied shampoo & shower gel. It's not overpowering, but coming in from the excessive humidity outside with a headache to start I did take notice! All in all, I'd stay here again. Boston's a great walking city and in comparison to NYC, one that I feel much safer in out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but sketchy location”
Reviews.Author: Nshores33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and were given a corner room on the 19th floor. The room was very nice. The bed was extremely comfortable. While the location is walking distance to everything you want to go to, as well as close to the T, the area is dead at night. Downtown is smelly and filled with homeless people sleeping in the streets. The pool was cold, but the exercise room and steamroom were nice. Overall, this hotel would be a lot nicer if it were 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hyatt Standards”
Reviews.Author: fcfrag
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8/5/05-8/8/05. Easy to access, close to Commons and T, but not on par with other Hyatts. The entrance is little more than double doors tucked into the side of a building - we almost passed right by. During our 3 days there a doorman was on duty only intermittantly, and never at night. Twice when a doorman was actually on duty he ignored us as we got the door ourselves. We were allowed to check in at 10 AM; we found the desk staff was very friendly and one actually shook my hand and said "thanks for coming". The room, however, was not the product Hyatt normally offers. First, it was small and lacking any special character. In our other Hyatt stays we've found unusually shaped rooms and other amenities that set Hyatt apart from other chains simply offering a "nice" room. Not here, nothing other than the great Hyatt King Bed distinguished the room. Additionally, the AC was not quite adequate given that I like my room cool at night. The thermostat may have read 60 degrees but the room was considerably warmer, not uncomfortable, but not 60 degrees. Also one of the just two light bulbs in the bathroom was burned out and it's unclear how the maid could not have noticed given how dark it was in there. Finally, the ice machine on the 17th floor was empty our entire stay - my suspicion was that it simply made noise and not ice. In total, our complaints were minor; but it's the little things that the premium establishments get right. If the name on the front of the building had been Holiday Inn we would have said "very nice", but the name was Hyatt and accordingly, we expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Real Nice, Super Cosy”
Reviews.Author: Boghrat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely very nice, clean, and very cosy. The hotel staff is very curteous, the common areas are very clean, and it's situated in a fairly central location. The highlight of the experience was the bed: it's the plushest bed I have ever slept in. With four very large down pillows, and a down pad under you while you sleep, it's heavenly. Most rooms have a nice chair and ottomon that you can enjoy as well. The desk (for travelling executives) is large and the bathroom is of ample size. In sum, it's a classy, clean, and comfortable, yet slightly expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Run!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All I can say is thank goodness that my company paid for me to stay here because I would not pay to stay there. I arrived there with my partner after a nice relaxing stay in Provincetown. I was there for a business conference. We arrived around 1:30 and attempted to check in only to be told that the room would not be available until 3:00. We ran out for a late lunch since we had not eaten. the only positive was that the hotel was close to a number of stores and restaurants. We returned and attempted to check-in and this time I was told that check-in is not actually until 4:00. Note, before lunch, I left my name and cell number in the case they called with the room availability. Depite it not yet being 4, I was still able to check-in. We had left our bags with the concierge until the room was available. The bags were tagged with numbers and would be delivered to the room. On our way to our room, my cell phone rang. It was the front desk calling to let me know we could check-in after we had already checked in. We got up to the room and started to unwind. The room was so-so with a decent view. However, the bathroom really looked as if it hadn't been cleaned and the toilet would run a couple of times each hour. We jumped when the water in the shower started to run on its own -- and we thought the inn we stayed at in P-town was supposedly haunted. We waited for our bags. After about 30 minutes, I called down and was told that one of the bags was missing! The staff was looking and would bring them up as soon as the bag was found. After another wait I called down and was told that the bags were all found and were on their way. After more waiting, I called down and was told that one bag was still missing. I went down to the front desk and spoke to the concierge who was clearly embarassed by the situation. I had to bring what bags were found upstairs myself. That first evening, dinner was on the hotel. The food was so-so and the service a bit slow given there were only about 8 people in the whole restaurant. Finally after dinner, we were told that they thought they found the bag. Note, during dinner we could see another guest who obviously had a problem as well since the restaurant was off the lobby. Fortunately our bag was found and had been delivered to the wrong room or a "vacant" room. We were not the only ones, since we got a knock on our door from an employee in search of a bag different from ours. If I get sent there on business again, I'd definitely consider paying out of my own pocket to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “horrible housekeeping experience - underwear not mine!”
Reviews.Author: Pitgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 7/23 - 7/29. Housekeeping is very disorganized with what appears to be no quality control to make sure each room is cleaned. At check-in requested to have the linens and towels replaced everyday since it is supposedly the policy of the hotel to only do this when requested. Had to call the housekeeping manager everyday except 1 day to remind them I wanted the room cleaned and towels/linens changed. The day I didn't have to remind them to clean it I found someone else's underwear on top of my closed suitcase. Reported the 'extra' underwear to the hotel manager. The manager checked the room key records which showed that only the maid and I had accessed the room. The manager then 'interviewed' the maid who said she knew nothing about the underwear or how they got there. Since my room was not cleaned most days even though the manager said they were sending a maid up and finding the 'mysterious' underwear in my room it seems that maybe this maid on the 7th floor had a little extra 'business' going on the side. Another party in our group stayed on the 14th floor and never had to request maid service or changing linens - it was done everyday as soon as they left the room. I called a week ahead of time to request that both parties be assigned rooms on the same floor but at check-in was told that was not possible. Lucky for them that they didn't end up on the 7th floor too! We both had the same room type at the same price so I don't know why we weren't allocated together but it was a minor inconvience. The manager did make an adjustment on 2 nights price of my room since I complained but I would hesitate to stay in this hotel again. It was annoying to have to constantly call housekeeping to get service and very disturbing to find someone else's Victoria's Secret underwear on my suitcase. The location of the hotel is good and the valet parking attendants and doormen were efficient. Too bad housekeeping is not.

Reviews.Title: “I was impressed!”
Reviews.Author: SweetPea
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one night stay at the Hyatt in Downtown Boston. I arrived by train at South Station and the Hyatt was a quick 10 minute walk from the train station. It was 11 AM when I reached the hotel and was pleasantly surprised when the front desk checked me in without any issue at all. The room was very nice and much larger than I had expected. It was clean and the king bed was very inviting. I found all of the staff with whom I interacted with to be extremely customer focused - which was a nice change from some of the other hotels I have recently stayed at. The hotel is conveniently located to many shops on Washington Street and the T stop for Downtown Crossing. This Hyatt definitely has their act together and I highly recommend staying with them if your plans take you to the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Much Improved”
Reviews.Author: mzplacedinphilly
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel - ended up there last year about the same time for a conference. Last year, the rooms were horrid. I took a chance this year based on the latest reviews and must note the refurb has much improved the place. It is now up to what I consider to be Hyatt standard. The service was lovely with exception of a couple of minor hiccups - airline "lost" my luggage and when it arrived at 10:30 pm the hotel neglected to inform me which made for a sleepless first night. However, all made an effort to make my visit a pleasant one. Within walking distance to many popular spots. Spacious rooms with lovely comfortable beds. If you make a request, it is taken care of in a timely fashion. They must have taken the mini bar incident to heart and they advise you of its nature upon arrival. If you need a separate fridge they will bring you one. Overall, a pleasant stay. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff and a fantastic price!”
Reviews.Author: Westcoastprincess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a few days to explore Boston. I couldn't pick a hotel so decided to cross my fingers and let priceline do the honors. I bid $100 a night and a few clicks later we found ourselves staying at the Hyatt Regency in Boston! We had a wonderful stay - from the second we arrived (12:30pm) we were treated incredibly well, we checked in early, the room was smaller than we are used to but incredibly clean. The bathroom was tiny - but clean, the ledge on the side of the tub is incredibly handy for storing toiletries. Yes, I found the dispensers on the wall a little strange - but since I am a bath product nut we had more than enough of our own bath products so we never had to partake of the wall dispensary unit. It also bears mentioning that in addition to the wall dispensers the hotel provides separate bath gel, shampoo/lotion etc. on the side of the sink. Location - the hotel is located in downtown crossing - literally within one minute of Macy's, Filene's basement and a GREAT DSW and of course Barnes and Noble to name but a few shops in the area. It is within a 2 minute walk to Boston Common where you can catch the T - easy to use and convenient. We were there the day of the London Tube bombings and still rode the T - there was plenty of security and although I admit to being a little nervous I was comforted by all of the policy and the other throngs of people that were also riding the T. I can't say enough about the hotel staff, from the valet to the concierage - everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful. Alison in the lounge was friendly and very attentive - the lounge is very comfortable - full of couches put together in cozy configurations. A couple good places to eat close by: Fajitas and 'Ritas - the waitstaff aren't the best - but they are worth dealing with in order to enjoy the food. The concierage recommended Teatro - an Italian restaurant a few blocks away next to the Lowe's Theatre - a phenomenal experience! Overall a great experience - not the best hotel we have stayed in - but worth the price, I am extremely picky in regards to hotels and this was definitely one of the better/cleaner/best serviced hotels I have stayed in during the last year. Location wise - if you are not afraid to walk or nervous about taking the Subway - the location is a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several nice hotels in Boston but for this trip we decided not to repeat a previous hotel and choose the Hyatt. Since it recently had a major renovation, had a pool, and was $70 to well over a hundred dollars cheaper then the other hotels we have stayed at, we thought it would be worth a try. We were right. Although the hotel is too big for my taste and does not have enough elevators, everything else was great. The room was very nice, as was the bathroom. The pool was great. There is also a nice cardio area, and locker room. The workout area, however, was small. The staff was very friendly and nice. Overall a good experience. One additional point, it is easy to self park so do it and save about ten dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but little else...”
Reviews.Author: Siam-Orchids
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for July 4th weekend. The room was nice, the breakfast was just ok, the location was just ok. All in all, it's an average hotel in a great city. Fitness Center & indoor pool were hidden away, behind some doors, down 2 or 3 hallways and lots of steps, and was just average. We got a bill for $40.00 for "BEVERAGE STORAGE", in other words, we put our water in the mini bar. The front desk staff was kind enough to remove the charge from our bill, but when she said it was a "courtesy" to me, I was a little annoyed. Courtesy ? for removing a charge that shouldn't have been there in the first place ? But would we stay there again ? Probably, now we know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Boston!! ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend getaway to Boston and stayed at the Hyatt Regency. Let me tell you, Look no further! This hotel is AWESOWE!!!! I got an excellant rate throught Hotwire. The hotel is completly remodeled. My room looked as though I was the first guest in there. It is very well decorated with a flat screen TV and the most comfortable bed I've ever sleep on! The room is immaculate in everyway! The staff was more than helpful and the location is perfect, close to all the action. You wil be very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shgb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Reserved through Priceline and had a very comfortable, double bedded room, newly renovated. Rooms were immaculate, the beds were the best ever! Staff was super friendly. I usually stay in the Copley Square area for convenience but found the Hyatt to be walking distance from almost anywhere I wanted to go and convenient to the subway as well. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm hotel in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: catleigh
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with my recent stay at the Boston Hyatt Regency. My room was newly remodeled, and it was very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and warm. The hotel had a great location--within walking distance of Boston Common, Fanuiel Hall, and the North End. It was also only a couple of blocks to the subway, which was very easy to negotiate. I was in Boston on business, but I was able to squeeze in a day of sightseeing, as it was my first visit to the city. I got a great rate on Hotwire. When checking in, I asked for a room away from the renovation, which I learned of from postings on this site. My only complaint was that an additional fee was charged for wireless access. It's also a little difficult to figure out where to drive in for registration; the main door to the hotel is actually underground! All in all, however, it was a great stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: highdesertbadger
Reviews.Content: I just finished spending 5 nights at this Hyatt. I attended a coference there and found the hotel very nice. They are just about done with the remodeling project that has been going on for some time. Because of this there was some extra noise taking place, but it wasn't that bad. I found our room on the 21st. floor to have a great view. The room was spacious with a separate sitting area. The furnishing are all new and all public areas of the hotel are comfortable and upclass. My only complaint was the vanity in the bathroom. For such a large room they could have made the vanity a bit larger. That aside the hotel is in a great location and is convenient to the T and all the major downtown sites. I'd give it an above average rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice. But there is renovation work going on”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend if you're paying non Priceline/Hotwire rates and you get stuck on the a low floor like the 6th floor where they're doing renovation work. (We checked in late and checked out earlier so we weren't terribly bothered by the noise) The rooms are nice. What you would expect from a Hyatt. The staff was friendly and willingly to help. If you want a nice comfortable clean place to sleep and you're not going to spend a lot of time at the hotel, i recommend the hyatt. the rates (probably because of the renovation work) are reasonable for good location.

Reviews.Title: “point me to the pub”
Reviews.Author: DrJ6
Reviews.Content: To me this was your typical big chain hotel. Clean, basic amenities, comfortable bed, lots of towel, standard room layout with spartan decor. The hotel did its job without being overly memorable. Good location if you want to stay within walking distance of both the theater district and some of the big tourist attractions. The biggest plus was its proximity to The Littlest Bar - simply the finest Irish drinking establishment in the country.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: ipoems
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, clean rooms, and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! The renovations are coming along nicely and are nearly complete, certainly unobtrusive. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a ladies' weekend away and stayed once again at the Hyatt. As stated in previous reviews, the location is excellent. It is centrally located and an easy walk to shopping, the Freedom Trail and the Theater District. We felt safe walking to and from the theater. The room on the 14th floor was recently renovated, clean and comfortable. It was probably a designated priceline room at the end of the hall and lacked a mini-bar. The space was there for the bar, but no bar, which was fine with us since we came prepared. The beds had the feather toppers, but did not have the decorative coverlets, which made them look unfinished. There were no robes either. Since they let us check in early, housekeeping was still in the hall and we were given coverlets and robes upon asking. Pool looked clean, hot tub is gone. Pool and fitness center are on the 6th floor, but then you need to walk down two flights of stairs. No problem. The way I see it, you are going to exercise anyway! The Hyatt is a great bargain for the priceline rate, even with the $26 self park. We plan to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation in Progress -- Beware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked the room via Priceline for $90 as a weekend getaway. Seemed like a good deal. But buyer beware. This is an old Swissotel in the midst of a renovation. This is NOT a typical Hyatt Regency in any way (I have stayed at 3 other Regency's this year). I'll tell you about the bathroom. Missing bulbs showed a lack of attention (but the extra darkness was welcome). Rust on the bar for what was supposed to be clean towels made one worry about how well anything else was cleaned (took a photo with the camera phone, low quality but you'll get the point). They also do not provide soap/shampoo unless you request it -- otherwise the shower and sink have on-wall hand-pump dispensers that you would otherwise see in the shower at the gym. The staff was nice enough. The TV screen in the room at checkout asked for guests to call the front desk if there is anything that would prevent a guest from rating a "5" if called for a satisfaction survey. I shared the info above, and they were very understanding (gave a comp for breakfast). They cited the ongoing renovation project. I was very aware of the renovation -- it started before 9am on Sunday morning. The hammering and drilling were a pretty good clue that there was construction going on. Other items: * We did breakfast by room service which was good quality and very quick * There is a gym with a pool, but you would not believe how many levels of stairs you have to descend to get there! * Parking is via valet ($36) or self-park ($20) at an unaffiliated garage somewhat attached to the hotel Overall -- unless I was committed a room that had the renovation and was FAR FAR away from the construction zone, I would avoid the hotel for now. At this time, this is a Hyatt Regency in name-only. If you get a good price and are comfortable with a mid-tier hotel, it's fine. But do not expect a Regency-quality experience yet.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, superb service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Hyatt Regency Downtown from 2/25-2/27. We stayed in a newly remodeled room on the 20th floor, with a nice view of Boston. Although the hotel is very beautiful, it was the service that made this the most enjoyable hotel I have ever experienced. Everyone we encountered was anxious to make our stay comfortable. We are really looking forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency- Worth a stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Bellbe
Reviews.Content: The renovations in this building have made a world of difference! Beautiful, neutrals, and a great staff made this a great stay! The beds were incredibly comfortable, very european. Highly reccomend the fondues.

Reviews.Title: “Wait until renovations are done”
Reviews.Author: vtgambler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend trip to see the Lion King. The hotel location is convenient to the theater district and the financial district as well as the fanuiel hall area. We stayed in a room that had not yet been upgraded. It was pretty small and the decor generally not what I would expect from a Hyatt. I assume this will probably change when the renovation is complete. It was clean however, and the maids did a good job. The parking situation is ridiculous. We pulled into the garage at 3:00pm on Friday and left at 5:00pm on Saturday and the charge was $36.00. There is no discount for people staying at the hotel. Fortunately, when we returned we were able to find a spot on the street about 3 blocks away but I suspect this was only because it was late saturday night. Good luck trying to find a spot on a weekday. The restaurant (Avenue One) was very good, both the food and the service. We had one service problem - we requested a corkscrew which they said would be sent right up to our room. It arrived an hour and a half later when we were on our way out. Feel free to email me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but ....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the location - near Downtown Crossing and an easy walk to Fanieul Hall and the North End. This is a 3-star hotel at best. The bed literally sagged in the middle, even with the extra "topper" they used to camouflage the poor mattress. The pool / fitness room is accessed via the 6th floor. However, once on the 6th floor, you have to walk down 3 flights of stairs to reach these facilities. The walls are incredibly thin - as in you can hear your next door neighbor cough, talk, etc. There are too many other great hotels in Boston - even at a discounted Priceline rate - to waste the night at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms are nice, but still noisy”
Reviews.Author: pequod
Reviews.Content: I wasn't even aware before we booked this hotel last weekend that there was a renovation going on. We were given a room on the 20th floor, which turned out to be a renovated and beautifully decorated one with a very comfortable bed with down comforter and pillows. The location was great: a 5-minute walk to Boston Commons, 10 to Fanueil Hall or the Aquarium. Everything looked perfect for our last-minute getaway. It was not until we were settling down to sleep that we were abruptly made aware of what others have complained of on this site: the walls are incredibly thin. Our neighbor in the adjoining room got on the phone to his wife, and we were treated to all the intimate details of his conversation. Thankfully, he went quickly to sleep and we were able to as well. The next night we were not so lucky. Our new neighbors were up to all hours, and I could literally hear everything they said and did until 2 a.m. So, do the beautiful, comfortable room and good location outweigh the noise? I guess that depends on your tolerance for that sort of thing. Mine is pretty limited, and despite my generally nice stay, I will look elsewhere next time I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Rooms are Fine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very apprehensive about staying here, given earlier reviews, but am happy to report that the renovations are underway (I have a redone room on the 22nd floor) and include a full bathroom makeover (although the funky wall dispenser for shampoo/conditioner/bath gel remains) and Hyatt's wonderful new bed configuration (duvet, featherbed, five king pillows). Everything has that brand new look -- and smell. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again -- but only in a renovated room!

Reviews.Title: “Fine If You Price Line”
Reviews.Author: StellaBoBella
Reviews.Content: I will make this short but helpful. I would not pay full price for this hotel! However, if you get it for a deal on hotwire or priceline do not worry. The rooms are nice and clean and the staff is friendly. The bed was great and so were the blankets. On the negative side the maid took a pair of my pants and they wanted to charge me to send them to me (that was resolved). Also, the room ran out of hot water which makes for a not so fun shower. The location is good but be prepared to pay a high price for parking!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a Hyatt?”
Reviews.Author: Isolated
Reviews.Content: Spent New Year's weekend in this Hyatt pretender. Read on, agh! No rooms renovated, ignore the blurb on the web site. Toilet paper not replenished, ditto kleenex. Tacky dispensers for shower soap, conditioner and shampoo hanging on tub wall and next to sink. Trying to find this one is a real pain with the one way streets and lack of sign- age. I've been coming to Boston for over 30 years! Restaurant staff very nice despite "Beavis and Butthead" pair abusing each other and the waiter. Front desk crew like programmed robots. Bellhop service surly and slow. No doorman and had to walk over the the Ritz Boston Common two blocks away!to find a cab! On and on and on! Who's in charge here. In short, four star rates, no star service. Room made up at 5pm on "New Year's Day" with a lot of rooms empty. If Paul Revere had stayed here he'd have left for Lexington and Concord at lot sooner. Even the elevators have a mind of their own! Don't even ask about the state of the bathtub! That's enough! Bottom line? Don't even think about it!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price we paid - Not upgraded”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 2 nights (mid-Nov 2004) at the Hyatt Fin District over a quick weekend Boston trip. We booked the rooms on Priceline (for about $90/night) and, for that price, we were quite happy with the hotel. If however, we were paying the more standard $200-300 for the room, I would not be satisfied. What got me especially excited prior to our stay was Hyatt's website, which advertised that, in November 2004, the hotel would be renovated with "Boston's Newest Hotel Room." The website certainly makes it appear that the renovation would be completed by then, though it does not explicitly say so. Given our rate, I was under no false impression that we would actually get one of these nice renovated rooms, only wishfully hopeful. It's a crock. Turns out, NONE of the rooms have been renovated (as of our stay); we know because we asked the staff. He mentioned that no guest rooms were, though they had done one room up as a "model". Don't believe the false hype of Hyatt. Nonetheless, the rooms was standard Hyatt/Marriott level. Nice, satisfactory, nothing overly special. Our friends and us had adjoining rooms, with a door between, which was nice. The first rooms we were given were on a smoky floor (though it was non-smoking), and we asked to move and the front desk staff was excellent in quickly changing our room. In fact, front desk staff was excellent on the whole and extremely professional and courteous. Parking in the garage is outrageous, though I'm sure fairly typical for downtown Boston. I forget the exact number - $30+/night. We were lucky in finding street parking and, given that it was a weekend, only had to feed the meter on Saturday. The location is excellent for those who do the FAnueil Hall/Quincy Market thing. About a brisk 10-minute walk away. Very close to Boston Commons as well (5 minute walk). On the whole, satisfied for the price. If you are expecting luxury, come back to earth (at least until the renovation is actually started, not to mention completed). But the Hyatt is a standard business hotel in a decent location. In terms of the elevators mentioned by a previous poster, we also found that extremely annoying and time-wasting. To get from the ground floor to the reception level, you take one set of elevators. To get to the hotel rooms, you must take another set. Our friends told us that the hotel used to be a shopping center, which might explain the odd set up.....

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt-Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I used a American Express Travel Reward to stay at the hotel. As many other people have noted, the Lobby is a bit annoying, as it is on a seperate level of the hotel, but do not let this distract you. The hotel is very plain and average. They are undergoing a major renovation, which will take months..I would WAIT to book here until that is complete. The Staff were very friendly, but there seemed to be very few of them. The room was very plain, and the bathroom horrible...clean, but very aged. The bed was the only plus about the hotel. Very plush. I would book somewhere else, until they are finished with renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with friendly professional staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in late October 2004. We have stayed in at least 5 different nice hotels in Downtown Boston and this one is the BEST so far. The location is centrally located for business or leisure activities. Ordering Breakfast in the hotel's restaurant is a must. It was very fresh and made of the highest quality ingredients. The staff was very attentive, friendly and had a "willing to do whatever it takes" attitude, especially the housekeeping department. The Neutrogena body amenities in the bathroom were conveniently placed and well stocked. This hotel knows how to treat their guests and goes out of their way to make sure that your stay is a pleasant service oriented one. We will return here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: SteveRBoston
Reviews.Content: Centerfolds is a strip bar in the red light district. Boston abounds with many venues around and near this hotel. Fenuil Hall, Quincy Market, the Freedom Trail, Parks, and other venus worth seeing and doing. I disagree with your assesment of this hotel. If it took 1 hour for you luggage to arrive, did you take the time and call anyone after 15 minutes had elapsed. I have stayed at many Hyatt hotels, I find this assesment to be completly out of focus. Having stayed overinght many times at this location, I have never been woken up by food service carts rolling by, nor the 'thin walls" as the author stated. Perhaps a pair of earplugs would be helpful. On the contrary, I have found the rooms to be clean, beds were comfortable, and the only noise that I head was fire trucks going by one time. As for the location, sure its downtown, but it is central to most places to go.
